Reviews.Title: “WOW What a Relaxing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bill and Sandra P
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying one night at this Outstanding Resort. We could NOT believe all the attention to detail and luxurious ammenities we found. We "oohed" and "aaahed" at each little nuance. The decor was like steping back in time; a time of grand elegence of a bygone era!!! It would extermely difficult to find another gem like this to stay at. Everything, everywhere was beyond par excellance! We said it was almost like being on a cruise ship...with much more space to move around. Our one regret is not having more time to stay and enjoy the place longer.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeAnna B
Reviews.Content: Planning a graduation/birthday/First Friday party can be stressful- but not with the staff of The Clarendon helping you out! Made reservations for June for dinner, two poolside rooms, and also arranged a late checkout so we can swim all afternoon Saturday... I am pretty sure that the big chain hotels would not take care of you this way- something to consider when planning a stay-cation or traveling the countryside=locally owned establishments take care to take care!!!! Thanks Clarendon= you are always my first choice when booking events/stays in Central Phoenix! Sincerely, DeAnna

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigmanaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarendon over Easter weekend. I will have to say the stay was most pleasant. The rooftop bar was astounding with exquisite views. The room was very comfortable We were above the restaurant so we could hear the patrons with the window open but it was really no problem. Just closed the window. Bed was most excellent and there was a real closet to hang clothes in. The only thing lacking was a TV Guide but nobody provides that. Always wonder about that. Would be nice if that was provide at hotels as usually I am in a new town and have no idea of scheduling and if you have to wait for the roll around on the TV, by the time you view 200 channels whatever you have chosen to view is 1/2 over. The restaurant however left something to be desired. Although most of the food was pretty good there were some odd things. Ceviche was excellent. Ordered some taco's, never had a taco on a 3'' diameter tortilla before. The beans tasted as if they came from a can. A quesedilla with pulled pork was also served on same 3'' corn tortilla. Almost ordered chicharron. I've lived in the southwest for about 40 years. Chicharron is fried pork skin, not a ''cheese crisp'', which is really a quesedilla. Glad I read the ''fine print''. Steak and eggs for breakfast was excellent. Service was very friendly and efficient in both the restaurant and the hotel My main beef with this hotel is the ''add-on'' charges. The resort fee of $20 raised the price 25%. The room was worth the extra 20 bucks, I just resent the misrepresentation of the price of the room. If the cost of the room is really 100 bucks tell me. Don't try to sneak it in there as an add-onn ''resort'' charge. The other charge I found absolutely intolerable was a 5% property tax charge. This is the first time in my life I have seen a ''property tax'' added to my bill I have stayed in hotels from San Diego to Seattle To Maine to Florida and most states in between and have never encountered this. To tell the truth I refused to pay this just on a matter of principle. Unfortunately, or maybe fortunately my wife changed my mind for me. I as actually pleased with the overall stay and really have no complaint with the price, only the sneaky way they got there. The extra 5% tax thing however is completely unfair in my opinion. And I will think twice before I stay there again. I will have to admit I am a child of the 60's and will stand on priciple all day. So in the end I had a very nice stay and if you don't care about such things by all means i would reccomend a stay at the Clarendon and I will most likely be outvoted by my wife the next time we stay in Phoenix. It is way more fun than say one of the Hiltons or other chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities are better than the rooms, I am just not hip enough.”
Reviews.Author: Sb360
Reviews.Content: Everything was just a little off making me feel a little more dip-ster than hipster. I like things really clean and fresh, this was not the case and even after switching rooms, I had to do a little cleaning making me wish I could get my hands on a vacuum. All that great Phoenix air and no way to get any of it. The staff was super nice and accommodating, the bar and pool are great, I am just a room kind of person and am focused on the bed and the bathroom. Really just needs some freshening for us less than party people.

Reviews.Title: “Can't quite figure it out”
Reviews.Author: dkerber
Reviews.Content: We bought the Groupon for the Clarendon and just got back from a trip to AZ. This hotel just had a weird vibe to it. I'm really not sure what they're trying to do (maybe they're not sure either), but it seems like they don't have a direction. Some good things... the pool area is fantastic, the front desk staff is very helpful, the hotel offers free snacks at night (candy bars, chips, granola bars, whatever you want), and the rooms are very spacious. Some bad things... the location isn't the greatest. Definitely not downtown Phoenix. The hotel is a 10 minute walk plus 15 minute light rail ride to the downtown area. Also, the "fitness center" is a complete joke. The treadmill literally stopped working while my girlfriend was running on it. They have some dumbbells but no bench or anything to sit on. Also, the insulation is very poor. We were on the 4th floor and could hear people on the street below as if they were right next to the window. And the artwork on the hallway walls is all about murders and killings... very, very strange. Overall... considering we had a Groupon, so paid ~80 bucks, I'd say it was a decent deal but I can't imagine ever going back.

Reviews.Title: “The Clarendon is the ONLY place I stay in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: socalcargal70
Reviews.Content: I visit The Clarendon in Phoenix every month, staying anywhere from two nights to five in a row. The front desk staff David and Reva usually are working when I check in and out and they are always happy to see me, greeting me by name and knowing exactly what type of rooom I get and where. The pool is beautfiul, the waterfall wall is beautiful! The rooftop has the best views in Phoenix of the sunrise or the sunset. This is my "office" for any down time I have during my stay. The Gallo Blanco Cafe is another stellar part of my stay at The Clarendon Hotel! The ceviche is amazing as is ANYTHING you will get on the menu, The Agua Fresca is sweet and delicious and even better spiked! Wednesday night is ALWAYS jammed packed as that is Flamenco night with authentic dancers and singers. The morning staff at Gallo Blanco doesn't even give me a menu anymore they just ask if I am getting the usual! It's awesome! As far as I am concerned, there is no other place to stay in Phoenix! Thank you to all of the staff and owners of The Clarendon for creating a truly unique experience that I will continue to return to again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Swank hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: Stayed in jr. Suit last weekend with the whole family and we loved the property. Staff is great! Greta atmosphere in bar, restaurant, and pool side. Would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unique property”
Reviews.Author: DavidBradley
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Clarendon. Liked: the hotel's attached restaurant, it has a great ambiance and very good food; the pool, pool area patio, and roof-top patio are awesome and great places to relax; good-sized flat-screen t.v. ; and rooms are fairly spacious. Be aware, however, that this is a former motel, with cinder block walls. Perhaps not for everyone, but overall a fun atmosphere and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - Wish I could say the same about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: aztravlgrl
Reviews.Content: We are locals and stayed at the Clarendon for two nights as a mini staycation in November and used two groupons for our stay. There are a lot of very good things about this property - the pool (albeit unheated), the rooftop deck, gallo blanco, the front desk staff, the complimentary late night munchie bar and free coffee and water in the rooms. However - the main part of staying at a hotel in my opinion *are* the quality of the rooms and unfortunately our room did not match the quality of this beautiful property. 1. Our sink was becoming detached from the wall. Seriously, it was so awkward and I was afraid to put any weight whatsoever on it. 2. The conditioner dispenser was broken. 3. The room's baseboard was peeling/detached from the wall. 4. The walls were so paper thin we could hear the housekeeping staff going from room to room, doors slamming all the time and music from the pool. It was difficult to sleep at all (even trying to sleep in) because of all the exterior noise. I really, really wanted to like this place especially since it's a local business but I can't go back or recommend it to anyone. I would definitely recommend the property for an event -- just not the rooms. We had one more groupon to use on a future visit and I ended up calling groupon and getting a refund. I really hope we were just stuck with a bad room but it's not worth it to me to take the chance. We did alert the front desk staff about our rooms' issues upon checkout and they said it would be addressed - I sure hope it was!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lelou18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so nice. The staff were so helpful and nice. always pleasant and supporting. Excellent staff. The Junior sweet we had was very comfy, and we enjoyed it as well as free wifi all over the place. Our room was facing the pool so it was interesting to see it and I liked how lively the hotel was. However, I did not like the idea that we cannot open a window. I like to have some fresh air in the room. The other issue that was of concern, is that they are not keen on cleanliness. The lady did not vacume our room till we asked her to do so the second day. she missed on the trash bag and dirty coffee cups also till we mentioned them. Also they did not clean the pool and the jaccuzi area regularly although they have been used heavily. I think they should have more options for breakfast. although lunch and dinner was extremely interesting and delicious menu.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a spectacular place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Becki N
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at The Claredon for a girls night out and all I can say was what a great stay and I was sad I had to go. I live and Tucson and my friend lives in Flag so we dicided to meet in Phx for one night. I wanted a hotel that was central, had a cool, unique feel and a restaurant/bar inthe hotel. The Claredon did not disappoint. From the check-in to the cafe to the matinence staff, all of the people who were on duty were amazing and friendly. I loved the unique, relaxed feel of the place and the special touches in the design that you see all over the place. I loved that the mini bar, internet and parking were all included in my room rate, so many hotels now a days add on fee after fee for all the little stuff. It was very nice to have it built in to the cost of the room. The rate was a little higher than I would of liked ot spend but there was so much going on in town that I understand. I would visit again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to Like It More”
Reviews.Author: LeftCoastGirl
Reviews.Content: The staff here is really nice, and the design aesthetic (Mad Men boutique hotel to the max) is pretty extraordinary, but you have to be in the mood for a place like this, and, well, I wasn't. (For one thing, I was born in the '50s, so been there, done that.) This hotel seems to have been created from a 1960s-era apartment building -- everything (including guest room walls) are plaster and cement, and there's a big pool in the middle of the complex. The decor is pretty amazing -- very attractive and unusual and retro -- but it affected the livability of the room. My room was REALLY dark, depressingly dark, had-to-use-a-flashlight-to-read-in-bed dark. Lighting was not adequate, and the deep blue painted plaster walls made it gloomy and creepy. There were several small annoying maintenance issues -- broken switch on lamp, burned-out bulb on another lamp -- and little signs of wear that just made it more depressing. It was clean but not immaculate. Good: the mattress and bedding were plush and comfortable. Bad: the bedding and towels had little stains on them -- I knew they were clean, but the effect was icky. Location: it could be considered close to the light rail, but only relative to the rest of Phoenix: when you're pulling a rolling suitcase behind you, it's kind of a slog to the light-rail station. Also, it seemed on the edge of some kind of industrial area, and trucks started waking me up at 5 AM. The beautiful pool area and the hotel lounge/restaurant seemed to be very happenin' places -- the hotel even throws pool parties sometimes -- but the atmosphere and property was all just a little too hipster for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good, unique hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: onmyway403
Reviews.Content: The beds are great, the pool is charming, the light rail makes the location good, the restaurant is first rate and the staff are friendly and helpful. Noise around the pool a bit annoying at times. Yoga on the roof deck a nice touch. The decor is fun. The roof deck is a bonus by the way. I recommend it - especially for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jojoluvscr
Reviews.Content: The service at The Clarendon is top notch. I slept on one of the most comfortable beds ever. The bar has two great drinks that I tried: a white sangria and a spicy Bloody Mary. You can order drinks and some food at the bar and take it out to the pool. The restaurant is pretty good. The Heard Museum is nearby. Also, a breakfast place called the Good Egg is nearby, so is a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Happening little boutique hotel in Central Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: reinsiedl
Reviews.Content: LOGISTICS The Clarendon is located in Central Phoenix which means it is not in "downtown" Phoenix, however everything you will likely want to get to is within reach of the close-by light rail or a 20.00 cab ride. You can use the light rail to get to and from Sky Harbor Airport as well as to and from downtown Phoenix, and downtown Scottsdale (bar district, ballpark, etc.) is about a 20.00 cab ride. HOTEL/ROOMS Do not let the outside of the hotel or reviews referring to "cinder block" room discourage you from staying here as it almost did for me. The rooms and the entire hotel is decorated with a minimalist/modern, but very hip flair. There is very cool art throughout the entire hotel as well. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the decor is nice, and the technology is up-to-date. My room had a nice flat screen TV, an Apple friendly radio alarm clock with docking/charging stand, free water bottles, and a view of the main attraction - the pool. Get a view of the pool it is worth the extra dollars - there is a cool waterfall feature that run the entire length of the wall, and there is generally a buzz about the pool area. There is a 100 person jacuzzi (really like a small pool) that is popular as well. Free strong WiFi signal is also available throughout the entire hotel premises. My only complaint about my room (329) is that the window shade was missing the pull chain, so I couldn't open it to let the full light in. THE SCENE / NIGHTLIFE Not much happens in Central Phoenix - especially on week nights, but if it is happening it is probably at the Clarendon. The hotel has a small bar area that is located adjacent to a very popular restaurant also located near the hotel lobby area. The scene is a mixture of happy hour crowd - young and old, as well as patrons waiting for tables at the restaurant, and locals. I highly recommend Wednesday evenings to catch the weekly Mexican band / dancing display show, That isn't the right term for it, but it is a huge draw and the place was packed to see it. Fun to watch and listen to. SERVICE I found all of the staff from front desk to restaurant/bar to be excellent, but then again I generally try not to be a jerk when I am dealing service staff. I believe you reap what you sew, and some of the negative reviewers make me wonder. Stay here - you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jencot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Clarendon on the front end of a business trip. I loved this hotel! It is so much better than the standard cookie cutter hotels- (of which I had to move to one for my conference). I was dreading the move. I booked through a third party site after reading the reviews. First of all the lobby is wonderful as is the front desk staff- My room was not ready so I grabbed a YUMMY lunch in the restaurant. After finishing, the room was still not done so I just read while I waited. Not a big deal! Since I had to wait, the offered my an upgrade which I gladly took! I had a corner suite and it was awesome. Fridge, Kuerig, Sound Machine(which was so appreciated since I use one at home), desk area, and nice bed. There were SOME area that were not vacuumed in the corners and could have wiped down a bit more but overall, I was very satisfied. The pool area is awesome. I wanted a few days to chill out, catch up on books, and relax in the sun. The pool chairs are so comfy, the environment is so "chill". Loved the music. In the afternoon, they would bring out bottled water and otter pops which was a fabulous treat and nice touch! They did not leave me any new toiletries(philosophy products!!) so I called and they brought me some. I also noticed that my K-cups were not filled. Again, no biggie, I went down and picked out which ones I wanted. I also had leftovers from my fabulous lunch the day before and requested (on a whim) a microwave. Delivered. Since it was just me, I knew I would have more leftovers. It was great to have since I ordered pizza that evening. The food at the hotel is awesome by the way! The only complaint I would have would be on the taxi service they use. I went shopping and the taxi charged me $6 more than the other one from the mall. I did see the driver upon departing the hotel give cash to the gentleman who order me the taxi. Bothersome. I just called another taxi service from the mall and used him the rest of the trip. There were some internet problems in my area and when i was working poolside on my laptop for a signal(not a bad office), the owner came over and asked me about my internet and what room I was in and what issues there were. He informed me they were working on the problem. It was done that evening. Again not a big deal since there was a signal I could use by the pool. The $20 fee was no big deal- I did not have a car for parking but you also get the bottled water in your room, internet(which per day at the hotel I moved to was-$13 for internet for 24 hrs and $6 bottle water). You also get the awesome k cups and snacks in the evening. The other hotel had the awful cheap coffee makers with 1 powder creamer packet. The rooms there were $225 per night for JUST A ROOM. If you want a 5 star hotel with the same great price as The Clarendon with all the same great amenities, let me now where you find that. Some people go into a hotel on a 3 star budget with 5 star expectations. This place is great for the price and for what you get! A hotel with personality and pizazz! Read all the positive reviews because they are spot on. There was a photo shoot going on while I was there. The hotel is very cool and I find it an honor to have been staying where people want to have a photo shoot. If you don't like what you see- don't look. I would stay here again and hope to in the future with my husband and daughter. If you want to get around in town-rent a car. Not a LOT to do around the hotel. Again, I wanted a place to land and relax. It was exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoy this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BNeel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Clarendon several times when visiting our daughter in Phoenix. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. We enjoy the pool and the roof deck is very pleasant (although I miss the comfortable seating that has been replaced with wooden benches). The location is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: KEMP527
Reviews.Content: We booked the Clarendon for 3 nights, with the plan to stay a 4th if it was okay. Unfortunately, it just didn't measure up to our expectations. The positives: comfortable bed and a really cool hotel concept. The restaurant was so good, though I can't tell how associated it is with the hotel (We were told we couldn't charge food to our room). The staff was friendly and polite. There were so many negatives for us. First off- housekeeping. We came back from our second day and the bed was half made. The sheets were made up, but the blanket was half on a chair and half on the floor. The blanket and sheets had brown (what looked like rust) stains on both. We loved the Keurig machine in the room and used it daily- but the containers were never refilled, so we ran out of coffee. Likewise with the bath products- we used up the small lotion container/hand soap on the first day and didn't get more. Overall, we felt like the housekeeping was just shoddy- we didn't make a huge mess, but aside from towels and water being replaced, and bed being (mostly) made, nothing was neatened up. We closed the window screen (actually a piece of art that slides over) so people couldn't see into our room from the breezeway. When we returned to the room each day, the art was pushed over again, so anyone could see our valuables sitting out. Second, the location is just not what we thought it would be. From the website, you feel like you're in the middle of it all. It isn't. We prefer to walk/use public transport when we travel. After one night of walking around by the Clarendon, we headed back to the airport to get a rental car- an unexpected expense :( The area directly around the hotel includes some not-so-great abandoned lots, and neighborhoods. Fine during the day, but not at night. We also found it to be about a half-mile to the light rail. Also, it just isn't what it promises. The roof deck is pretty, and we were told it serves drinks on Fri/Sundays on the bar up there. We went up on Sunday- nothing going on, no one up there. There were a bunch of leftover food/drinks that hadn't been cleared-- maybe from Fri night? The pool is pretty too- we tried to go in the hot tub Saturday night and it was cold. We were told it was broken and they were "working on it" but after sitting in there for a good half hour, we gave up. Other families there told us it was broken Friday night as well. There were certain things that didn't bother us, but I felt might have bothered lighter sleepers. Our room had a glass-front mini-bar (with nothing in it), with a bright light that stayed on all night. We couldn't figure out how to turn the light off without unplugging the mini bar, so we slept with it on. Silly, since there is no mini bar service. Also we faced the inner courtyard/pool and the noise was pretty bad. We heard kids playing/yelling in the pool at 6:30/7 a.m. after adults had been out there partying until 12ish. Also, don't expect to have the pool area be a relaxing spot- we saw 3 separate photo shoots happening while we were there- engagement shoots, modeling shoots, etc. Photographers with equipment using sunbeds,etc. I don't think the shoots were for hotel guests, but not positive. There were other little frustrating details too- we couldn't find info on the website that said what time checkout was. We tried to call down to the front desk, and the phone didn't have an option like that. Our room smelled funny- we wondered if the bottle of febreze in the room was to cover up a smell? When we tried to go to the pool/ hot tub, we were told they were out of towels and had to wait for someone to bring some out. The price just seemed really excessive for what you get. We are now staying at a beautiful hotel in Scottsdale, in a great walking area, for significantly less (and no, no $20 a night parking/internet fee). At checkout, we noticed another couple was upset as well and felt ripped off too.

Reviews.Title: “Good central Phoenix Option”
Reviews.Author: NRS21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business and will be doing so again this week. It's well-located to get to Sky Harbor and other parts of metro Phoenix, and having a decent restaurant is a big draw for me. I did not get a chance to use the pool although it looks very nice, and overall it was pretty quiet. The rooms are nicely decorated, although this does not mask the fact that this is an older block-construction building so it has more of an upscale hostel feel as opposed to higher end boutique hotel, as well as a bit of sloppiness in painting and maintenance. However, the beds are nice and that plus the general atmosphere makes this preferable to a major hotel chain in the same price range. When booking keep in mind that you will have a $20 per night hotel convenience fee, plus a slew of local taxes that will add about 25% to the quoted nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Our romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Connie I
Reviews.Content: From the big, Covered parking, parking lot; to the airport style luggage carriers, the funky exterior, we knew we lucked on to a great place! Entering the hotel, it was lively and we were greeted and checked in painlessly, with the elevator close by. The rooms surround the pool, which was clean and fun with a LARGE hot tub called the hydro pool, as it was as wide as the pool. Jets were great. The room had all the amenities you could want, and included in the room price. No gauging! There is a 20$ hotel fee that they were sure we knew about. It included internet, local paper at the desk, free snacks at the desk in the middle of the night, etc. The town, as well as the hotel guests, rave about the tacos at the hotel restaurant. My fav extra was the luxurious house robes. The bed was so comfy great that I felt it should have it's own sentence. GO, ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “I called for information and I got......”
Reviews.Author: blah b
Reviews.Content: An extremely pushy salesman, undermining my knowledge. I work in a sales call center so I know someone is trying to sell me.... I do it all day. But what this gentleman didn't realize is that you have to gauge a customers interest by feeling them out. Instead of gauging where I was as a customer, he proceeded to tell me what I should do, how I should make my decisions. "I don't know if you know anything about hotels, but...." in a ridiculously condescending tone. I said I would talk to my girlfriend and I would get back to him, but the gentleman would absolutely not let me get a word in. Feature dumping every little thing he can find about the hotel. This is not a reflection of the hotel itself but merely the undereducated salesman who lost the interest of a customer. I may be a drop in the hat to the "fully booked hotel" and "regular customers" of this establishment, but I am still a person. I would much rather be coaxed into purchasing the place that having it shoved down my throat.

Reviews.Title: “Total RIP-Of!!! $20 Resort fee at the Check in”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: This hotel charge " $20 Resort fee " per night! at the check in; that incluid internet, pool, parking and you can chose 1 snack per day from a list of snaks they have at the front desk 50cents snacks, and incluid locals calls and the pool towels ah! and the gym is incluid! It is The same size that a regular room with 4 old fashion treadmills no machines at all!. So if u don't need Internet or snaks or parking you still have to pay the $20 DOLLARS RESORT FEE! The only windows the rooms have are facing the pool, NO PRIVACY! I didn't like the hotel at all. I felt upset since the moment I saw they were charging hidden fees like the RESORT FEE!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Gingerop
Reviews.Content: From the minute I walked in the front door I felt I belonged. The staff at the front desk was friendly, warm, helpful, and solicitous of my needs. They made suggestions on where to eat, what to see, and even Wednesday night entertainment. The view from the roof top is awesome, especially as the sun is setting. The pool area is clean, spacious and very inviting. My room was large, clean and well stocked. From my room I had a very of the pool at night time when the lights are on and the bottom of the pool reflects the sky. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Congratulations to the owners and staff who work deligently to make staying with them an experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Very bustling hotel.”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: The pool was always packed, which is fine by me. I hate to see hotel pools go to waste. The onsite restaurant/bar is pretty good, a little overpriced, but that's what you get for a hotel restaurant. Its an independent hotel chain, and the staff was friendly. However, their concierge services weren't really all that helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BOUTIQUE HOTEL NEAR DOWNTOWN”
Reviews.Author: Margaret K
Reviews.Content: We found the Clarendon during a New Years stay 2011-12. The pool was terrific, friendly guests & lots of lounging options. Was it beat up or worn? Let me say this: YOU try staying out in the Phoenix sun for more than one season and not look a little worse for it!! Re: wifi, I had no trouble. There were always 3 or 4 WLANs open, not a problem. I'm w/ Colleen on the LACK of light in the rooms, but having lived 8 yrs in Phx, I chocked that up to the massive sunlight available most months, and avoiding unnecessary heat production. There's little, if any, overhead lighting. About the snacks -- my husband checked us in, so I wasn't paying much attention, hence I missed out on free candy BUT it was made clear to me that rather than clutter up their world w/vending machines, I could simply ask for what I'd like. I had a COLD diet Coke every day. That made me smile. The food at Gallo Blanco is simply outstanding AND inexpensive. 3 to 7 pm happy hour EVEN ON WKENDS!? We love food adventures, but why go anywhere else when it's so close and cheap? We ate there 6 times - breakfast, lunch and dinner. Re coffee - Tastes great and it is pretty easy to use the system. I usually travel w/a real coffee mug. Do that, unless you want to drink out of styrofoam. Bedding and mattress? LOVED THEM. The price was affordable for a terrific place in a neighborhood that was comfortable and very close to public transit -- buses and the cool new light rail. I used to live nearby, so I was a little reluctant, but I felt comfortable. Our room did have a smoke smell, but an open window solved that, and I am picky! I found a fewburns in the carpet, so - mystery solved. Not an ongoing issue for me. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nlbuk
Reviews.Content: I tend to visit more frequently when on business meeting colleagues for lunch at the amazing restaurant. I do love to stay there just to relax. Nice beds, friendly staff who always remember the regulars, but also treat first timers with the same friendly demeanor. I have become quite fond of the otter pops so much I've tried to find that specific type for myself at home. The property amazes me, it's such a neat place, I adore American architecture designs from the 50's and 60's thus making this hotel a real treat for me. I never grow tired of it when I walk through the doors, always something new going on. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: ckr3214
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is just a fantastic property. The crowd are diverse, hip urbanites and the decor is very artsy-'70s. We will absolutely be back to this property and loved the little amenities, such as late-night snacks and a hot tub that seemed longer than a football field. Fun decor that brings retro design into 2012. The restaurant and lobby bar are great and the staff friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own lighting, hipsters!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen W
Reviews.Content: Ultra-hipster hotel with a few genuine touches of comfort (outstanding beds and bedding, nice terrycloth robes) and a whole lot of figurative smoke and mirrors (there's an actual paucity of mirrors, as well as lighting. What can I say? Dim lighting and bright orange walls are the hipster hotel's best friends.) If you're intending to do a lot of work here, beware: the hotel wifi is slow, the desks shallow and uncomfortable to work at, and like I say in the title, the lighting is all but nonexistent. Not good for the olds, just sayin'. The room itself was clean but smelled mildewy, which I'm guessing is the result of lack of adequate bathroom ventilation. Avail yourself of the "free" candles included in the outrageous "resort" fee; that and the free candy (after 10pm) was about all I got for my money in that department. The property is lovely, and has some crrrrazy history attached. Read the plaque in the lobby. Or google "bolles + arizona republic". Good times. Service-wise, again, this place is more about show than anything else. In addition to my own check-in, I had occasion to watch several other people check in at the hotel and brother, it is one elaborate process for some reason. The food at the onsite restaurant is A-MA-ZING. Try the chilaquiles; I did, twice. On the other hand, the service was beyond horrible both times I went. (On the other-other hand, the closing-shift bartender kicked a**!) Oh, and because someone asked: the Clarendon is a pet-friendly hotel, but dogs only. At the time of my stay, a one-time fee of $50 applied.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, affordable, good beds, pretty clean.”
Reviews.Author: Zolzac
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night with our two children. They loved the pool, and at night, with the lights, what's not to love. Its cool. Bottom line, except for the insane tax they charge for rental cars and hotels in Phoenix, it was a great value. Beds were comfortable, rooms were clea

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: nolazona
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Groupon for a night here, so we thought it would be a nice little summer escape. I was a little concerned that since we got it through a Groupon that we might not get the best service but not the case. Room was modern/funky and spotlessly clean. Front desk was awesome - we got an otter pop upon checking in, how can you not love that. They also had water bottles for guests at any time, which in AZ in the summer is a great amenity. Pool is nothing super exciting but also clean as is the area around it. A big highlight is the restaurant inside - Gallo Blanco. It is cheap and outstanding. The drinks and the food are truly fantastic. Overall, I could not have been happier with our stay there. Oh - we did not bring ours - but I believe they are Pet Friendly as well - another bonus.

Reviews.Title: “an affordable, hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: induway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very hip but it is not luxurious. But it's very affordable and has nice amenities for the price. The pool area looks far better at night - the terry lounge chair covers are a little tacky and unkempt looking (surprising). The wicker furniture and cushions are showing their age - the seams are ripping and there are holes in the wicker. **BUT** the $20 daily resort fee includes WIFI and snacks, Keurig coffee in the room and 2 bottles of water (after 10pm) - considering that many other resorts nickel-and-dime for wifi/drinks, I will happily pay this fee. The bar/restaurant area downstairs is very hip and a great place to hang out and grab drinks. This place seems understaffed - check in was a little disorganized and delayed... but not unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Mid-town Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: AmandaWild
Reviews.Content: I first found out about this hotel on Expedia. At first I thought I might book the hotel through Expedia, but I found booking the hotel through the hotel website to be the best deal. There are a number of booking options to save you money, so check them out. We went with the deal where you can book three nights and get the third night for free. I found that the rates fluctuate quite a bit depending on the weekday and season, but I think this is normal. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful at check- in explaining all of the various features of the hotel, and providing us with a complementary room upgrade. Our room was on the second floor facing the pool and close to the water wall. The sound of the water wall close to the room was very relaxing and I would recommend it as it creates some white noise to block out other sounds. I was never disturbed by any noise except a door slamming in the hallway very early one morning. The room was a good size with a king size bed. The bed was extremely comfortable. The only other hotel that I have stayed at with a bed comparable to this one is the Marriott in Calgary, Alberta. The sheets, duvet and pillows are very high quality. I loved how the bedding was all white so you could see the exact cleanliness of it. There was a gray Vellux blanket at the end of the bed also. The wine fridge, Keurig coffee maker, and complimentary water in the room were great! It would be really helpful if the room would add a small microwave. As there is no room service at the hotel, it would be nice to have a microwave to warm up any supper leftovers etc.. I really loved the unlimited late night snacks and drinks. The staff were always so accommodating with us. I was pleased with the Aveeno and Philosophy toiletries in the bathroom. The bathroom was clean; however, it smelled of cigarette smoke. The smell of the smoke seemed to really linger in the shower curtain, but I realize this is difficult to get rid of and it could have been some time since it happened. The signs for your room door just say “do not disturb” on both sides. I was hoping one side would say something along the lines of “please make up room later.” There were two out of nine days that our room was not made up because we slept in and used this sign. This was not a huge deal as we usually keep the room fairly neat, so I never mentioned it to the staff. I think a room sign update would be a great change. There was always plenty of parking at the hotel and many of the stalls have sun shades (not that we really needed them), but in hotter weather they would be a big plus. There were also some stalls to charge electric cars. I thought that this was very forward thinking, so I was a little surprised that there were no recycling bins or bags in the room. I also thought it might be a good idea for the hotel to have a sign in the washroom suggesting that guests place the towels that they want washed in the tub and the towels that they will use again on the rack. The pool was very nice and heated! It provides for a hip atmosphere with all of the coloured tile and fountains... The hot tub was even better. It is HUGE! I think fifty people could fit into it. My husband was able to enjoy this a bit more than me as I am expecting and decided to be safe and just put my legs in. There were plenty of loungers, beds and chairs around the pool. The music around the pool was a nice touch. The best features are the water wall, and the coloured lights in the pool and hot tub at night. We made it up to the roof top a couple of times to check out the views. It was beautiful up there. I think the renos are fantastic from the previous pictures that I looked at online. If I was able to drink, I likely would have tucked a bottle of wine away for a sunset up there. The hotel was very close to the galleries and museums that we wanted to check out. This was so convenient as we could actually walk to them, or you could use the light rail transit which is only a couple of blocks away. We took several walks around the surrounding neighbourhood and really enjoyed ourselves doing so. Gallo Blanco was an amazing restaurant. I think we ate there five times. I tried the fish tacos and they were delicious. The guacamole and tortilla chips are also very yummy. I was very surprised to see that the guacamole included oranges. I never would have thought to add them in, but it was a good addition. I love their iced tea (hibiscus), and the staff was gracious enough to make me one for the road. How sweet! We caught a glimpse of the Flamenco dancers on Wednesday night, but missed the show. If we get back to the Clarendon, I think it would be a very worthwhile evening. Thank you Clarendon for providing us with such a great home away from home for 9 nights! We highly recommend your hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun01
Reviews.Content: My 9-year-old son, husband and I stayed at the Clarendon for one night and loved it! The chic design is fun, the heated pool and 52 person hot tub spa is awesome! The pool area is very nicely done in a Vegas style manner with covered chairs and lounging couches. The rooms are clean and has some cool, modern features (like a picture that slides in front of the window to cover it.) The staff was all very friendly and accomodating. You get 2 free bottles of water in your room! Yes, free! And there's a mini-fridge in your room to keep them cold! The hotel restaurant has some of the best taco's I've eaten (and I'm a Mexican food junkie!). It was a chilly night, so we went to the rooftop deck to check it out, but didn't stay long. It's really neat up there, so pack your own alcohol and have drinks up there if you go when it's a bit warmer. It's also a nice location in downtown Phoenix. The front desk also offers free snacks (bottled water and granola bars) when the restaurant is closed. I needed to receive and send a fax, and the front desk employees were most helpful. And I wasn't charged for it! Overall, a very nice stay and a place we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Retro-Chic, Hip, and Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissFranberry
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is easily my favorite boutique hotel in the Phoenix area. It's retro-chic with modern amenities and fantastic service all the way through. We were fortunate to have been able to stay in a pool-view suite recently and while it was still over 100 degrees outside, our stay was incredibly comfortable and very enjoyable. Aside from having a wonderfully attentive and friendly staff and a funky vibe, there is a high level of charm and detail that the Clarendon accomplishes. From their beautiful pool area (which we utilized each night of our stay), to the FREE, UNLIMITED munchies (after 9p.m) that included sodas, chips, and candy bars; to the fact that bottled water was FREE (as many as you need), we were very impressed. Add the fact that the rooms are spacious and feature nice big TVs and (in the suites at least) a large sitting area, desk, bar, and fridge, as well as ample free parking, and you've got a winner for what they call an "Urban Retreat." Centrally located to many downtown Phoenix points of interest including great dining options near uptown and the bustling art scene downtown, the Clarendon is not only a hotel, but a local hub; featuring live music and a killer happy hour at their hotel restaurant Gallo Blanco. Don't forget to head up to their awesome rooftop, too. The views are great and it's a nice area to take a seat and enjoy the desert sunset. I would recommend this hotel to younger folks, business travelers, and even families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hip/different place to stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Jammer1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a dozen times in the last 4-5 years, and I have to say it has rarely disappointed me. The rooms are quiet and clean, the staff is almost always gracious and helpful, and they work work hard in their on-site restaurant to provide first-class food. One great reason to stay here is that it is right near the "upper downtown" part of Phoenix - not the stadium downtown, but the other high-rise part of central Phoenix - and you are close to a number of great restaurants and watering holes when you're at the Clarendon. Another is the general comfort of the rooms - large, good beds, good TV/cable variety, decent spaces to work (desk and internet.) There is a nice pool and now a roof-top bar, and both are good. Prices really vary depending on time of year and seasonal demand, but that's Phoenix in general, with the winter season being the most pricey. I like the description in TomRinA2's review of a "funky independent place" to stay. Don't think funky as it not clean or weird - just different from the standard Hampton Inn or Marriott property. Good, even a great place to stay when you're in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely modern - staff is excellent - great value”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: Not quite downtown so that would be the "lost point" in my rating. Check-in staff is very nice and helpful. They saw me on TV and did everything they could to help me get a cab, carry my heavy props et al. Very helpful beyond the "call of duty" :) A former condo complex converted into a well-appointed and surprising hotel. Rooms are well- equipped. Phone is FREE for international calls! iPod player, cool TV, nice bathroom and attention to details. If you are hungry and jet-lagged at any time of the day you get FREE snacks and small plates during the happy hour. Hungry for a nicer meal? Their TexMex restaurant serves some tasty food items in a nicely decorated area. The staff in the restaurant is also simply perfect! And if it is a warm day and you need to chill out, the amazing pool and its lounge chairs is waiting for you in a very modern atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Improvement”
Reviews.Author: AntonioDroid
Reviews.Content: I booked the Clarendon for 2 nights during a weekend trip to see friends. Chose the hotel based on location, cool factor and price. There are a lot of amenities: free wi-fi, treats at check in, etc Lounge bar and restaurant (Mexican) are excellent and draw people in from outside the hotel. Pool and Rooftop areas were also very cool; others mention noise or crowds - neither on my trip as temps are cooling. I did find that I couldn't hear a thing in my room even when kids were at the pool Sat morning. Staff is very friendly (and helpful) - both front desk and maids. I was given a choice of floor for my room as well as choice of otter pop flavor. Room: here is where there is some room for discussion and where the largest gaps are. The room (2 room king suite on 2nd floor overlooking the pool) is very spacious and well appointed (BIG flat screen, large wine fridge, good furnishings, comfortable bed w/good clean sheets, high style, art, etc.). The AC was great - not musty, the room quiet, free bottled H2O appreciated. However it could have been cleaner; I don't want to know the previous occupants hair color (vacuum the room). The bathroom was also OK as far as cleanliness goes (more hair) and less than OK as far as condition goes (especially compared to the room). The tile was cracked and the tub was worn - functionally no issues, with the new shower head offsetting the old shower knob (seriously who designs these things?); curtain clean, door definitely not. There is a mix of upscale and cheap, purchased and homemade with custom details sprinkled around. The window covers are very cool in concept, but are less successful when you use them. The bench at the foot of the bed is great, but splintered from suitcases hitting it. Even with those detractors, I'd stay here again and easily recommend it to anyone. I may have breezed over it in the beginning, but the bar and restaurant are really great - food is fantastic. Overall the Clarendon is hip and a good property continually getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this oasis”
Reviews.Author: Merdog
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love/loved the Clarendon. It is truly a little urban oasis. My sister and I had all sorts of plans to see the city and instead we ended up lounging by the pool gorging on amazing Mexican food from the onsite restaurant. AMAZING! We loved relaxing and this place makes it easy...or will soon as the renovations are done. I was a little dissapointed they were doing so many renovations while we were there. New speakers by the pool made for no music and workers in and out, new coat of paint made for a very loud experience that definitely was not relaxing at all. There was also one extremely rude front desk guy but other than him everyone else was awesome. The beds are the stuff dreams are made of...so comfy! All in all it was a good stay and I definitely want to go back. It's a throw back to another time and I'll throwback to that time any day of the week. Once those renovations are done you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Who would stay at this hotel???”
Reviews.Author: gary p
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay at this "boutique hotel". So loud and noisy at night that one cannot sleep...like staying at a fraternity house. No iron in the room, shower faucet disfunctional, only one hand towel per room. AC when turned on smelled like a combo of dirty wet dog and urine. The pool and rooftop deck are open until midnight and beyond so be prepared for constant guests and outsiders romping around and shouting all evening...not a relaxing place to chill at all. Left a day early. Management refused to provide any refund or discuss..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: maureenm28
Reviews.Content: Found this gem through a groupon and booked an anniversary weekend. The only problem we encountered was a women's soccer team booked there for the same weekend. We had to contend with slamming doors and screaming women til the wee hours. Not the hotel's fault though and as with the other reviewers, enjoyed the ambience of both the hotel and the restaurant. Would stay again - after checking for registration of any traveling sports teams!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a lot of color”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen10151
Reviews.Content: With a little bit of colorful paint, a nice pool area, and upgrades they've turned this rather run of the mill hotel into a cute little boutique hotel. It was clean and quiet. The cafe attached had a great Tex-Mex breakfast with some different twists on breakfast food. The center, focal point was the huge pool with colorful, South west mosaic tiles and a large (long) hot tub. $20 hotel fee which helps to pay for the covered parking and mini bar treats. Also a roof top outdoor bar was nice to watch the sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganWineLover
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend at the Clarendon and was pleasantly surprised. My kids had booked us there as a gift. Very funky place. Still felt a little tired looking in a few areas but overall they have done a great job in updating the place. The room we stayed in had separate sleeping quarters with a huge flat screen TV and a contemporary feel to it. Nice pool/spa and a great roof top lounge to view the sunsets from. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. The restaurant was outstanding. We normally don't like to eat at hotel restaurants as they usually are very bland and generic but we ended up eating there all weekend with a couple of breakfasts and suppers because the food and service was outstanding. Would definitely go again

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Richard R
Reviews.Content: I have to give the fullest of full marks to the friendly hospitality of the staff and the quality of the hotel. Details are important and they do them well, including the most inspirational and inviting urinal I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Staduim and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Xavier0381
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room with a view of the pool. The outer rooms have noise from morning traffic. The upstairs patio is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: DeAnna B
Reviews.Content: Check in was so smooth...room was emaculate..the pool is amazing...dinner at the restaurant was subperb, the bed was comfy, and checkout was a breeze. Very inviting, attentive staff, lovely views of Phoenix from the newly renovated roof deck, the pool and hot tub were inviting from the get go, and then a quiet dark room. Would definitely stay again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot. I am sending a friend this weekend”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Clarendon by chance about two years ago. I really enjoyed it and I was treated with great service. I arrived late from Boston and the kitchen was closed the manager came out and said don't worry about it I will go back and make whatever you want. I told him just make whatever is easiest for you. He brought personally prepared a torta for me and the wait staff was so friendly and pleasant. Very cool vibe throughout the property and you could definetly tell the owner put a great deal of passion into the property. I am traveling to Phoenix this week and my work has book a downtown hotel for us. One of my coworkers missed out and had to scramble for a place. I told him don't look any further I got a great place. Clarendon Hotel I am proud to send you the business. John Stamatopoulos

Reviews.Title: “not your typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2oldtravelers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather retro. Several lobby areas to sit and talk and have a cocktail. It was raining so I did not check out the roof lounge. Pool is large, clean, with a huge hot tub area adjacent. Plenty of chairs and a nice place to have a cup of coffee and read the complimentary paper in the morning. The restaurant is funky and noisy. Food is OK.. Rooms are eclectic in decor and furnishings. They have been updated with remote AC/Heat, updated bathroom fixtures. They contain an empty mini refrigerator (not stocked, as implied in hotel blurb). Snacks are free after 10 and before 8 from the front desk. Parking is next door. The extra $20 for a (a sort of resort fee) is a bit excessive. After all, this is not Vegas. A nice, different place to stay in central Phoenix. The hotel is built around the pool area and there are views of the pool from each elevator exit. We stayed in a mini suite with two queen beds. A single lounge chair was provided in an alcove and not located to see TV.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCRevie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for 3 days/2 nights and can't say enough great things about it. i got there late and tired to check in and Billi was so super sweet and helpful. She went out of her way to make sure that I got settled in and taken care of. In the morning, I was welcomed by a very cheery Billi(even though she worked the overnight) and an amazing breakfast in thr restaurant, allo Blanco. This was the first of 4 meals I had there that were way beyond belief...Some of the best mexican food EVER! I came back after 2 days in Sedona and a stop in the Grand Canyon, only to be welcomes by Jay and Reva. The desk staff in this hotel KNOWS what GREAT service is and do it with ease. I spent my last morning bonding with the fabulous David and after a dip in the pool and a soak in the hydropool beford heading out to explore Pheonix with my childhood pal, who I just had to bring back here for "The Last Supper" with me before I came back to NYC. This place does not disappoint and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fun and free of pretense.”
Reviews.Author: leesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a girls weekend- loved the cool vibe! Walking distance from the metro- great lobby with a wonderful, authentic restaurant- food straight from mexico city. Yummy maragaritas and excellent guacamole. Rooms are nothing fancy- but are comfortable and well thought out. Ask for a room that faces the pool area- be sure to check out the great views from the rooftop. The front desk folks are extra helpful- feels like they actually like their job. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Unique Place to Stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: MCLake
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is a strange little hotel, but in a good way. The outside walls painted with blue stripes give you an idea of what you're in for, but you really understand it when you enter the lobby. Everything is kind of funky retro: bright colors, bold patterns, shiny everything. The front counter was incredibly helpful and welcoming. Our room was fairly large, clean, and comfortable with some nice little features, like a keurig single cup brewing system and to go cups in your room. LOVED that. We're not really pool people, but our room did overlook the pool and we enjoyed people watching. The pool and hot tub area is really striking, with a lot of places to lounge, read, play, etc, a water wall, and some awesome tile work. Couple of minuses: fluorescent lighting in the bathroom. Ick. Also, the smokers (and there seem to be quite a few) all stand right outside the front door and smoke, so you get treated to that crowd and that smell every time you come and go. The roof deck is under construction, but it does provide a great evening view and will be really lovely when it is completed. It's obvious that the property is very much a work in process, but it is still, in it's current state, a very nice, fun, customer-oriented place to stay. Oh, did I mention the front desk gives out free snacks after 10 pm? Because they do. And it's awesome. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is bringing your kids. This is really more of a singles/ younger folks/getaway kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Walking To A Different Beat”
Reviews.Author: tripol1974
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Clarendon in Septemeber. It was a last minute trip that I had to make. Since I was traveling alone I decided to look for something a little unique. Clarendon fit the bill perfectly and was a great value. I took advantage of a third night free offer, so my room rate ended up averaging $60 per night. There is a $20 daily fee, but it is clearly disclosed and it didn't bother me. The front desk staff was top notch. The late night snacks at the front desk were a nice touch. The beds were comfy and the rooms were clean and spacious. I did not get a chance to use the pool, but it looked very nice. I was in and out quite a bit. I was slightly dissapointed the rooftop bar was closed. I was looking forward to taking advantage of that. Also, make sure to check out the bust in the lobby honoring a reporter that was killed at the Clarendon in the 70s in a car bombing. While it doesn't give you a warm fuzzy fealing, it does give you a sense of history with the place. Wifi in my room was too weak (219). had to go to the lounge to use it. Downtown Phoenix is one of those places where you can go two blocks and have a complete change of scenery. While I felt secure at Clarendon, I probably wouldn't have wondered off to far in either direction. No need as everything you really need is right there. If you have an afternoon to kill, take a roadtrip north on 17 up to Flagstaff. you go from the desert valley to a 7,000 feet elevation wtih a heavy smell of pine. It is like you are traveling between planets.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the Young & Fashionable !”
Reviews.Author: EBJ11
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon Hotel is a cool, urban, Hipster hang. If you are looking for something unique- boutique and FUN...this is your place. I love coming to Phoenix- Scottsdale in particular but this time our trip was for business- not pleasure. Location and price were the main considerations so I had to squash my desperate urge to stay at one of my fave places ever- The Phoenician- and pick a different venue. A timely Expedia email came with great deals for Phoenix, so we booked The Clarendon based on the reviews and great photos and took a chance. For what we got- the price was GREAT. Let me tell you the best things about this hotel first. It has a very cool vibe and the moment you check in, you feel very at ease. The front desk staff is friendly, easy going and helpful. We took an early flight in and I needed to check in 3 hours early- they were willing to do it for a $25 fee....I was tired and anxious to unpack and relax so I paid it and I appreciated the fact that I was given the choice and a room was available. This hotel is a mid-century building brought to life by colorful, retro decor and fun art everywhere. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite on the 2nd floor, overlooking the pool area. The bed was really comfortable and the furniture, art and retro style of the room was really cool. Our suite also came with a 50" LG flat screen. Another touch I loved was that they are not stingy with the amenities....unlimited free water bottles and a big bag of ice were a truly nice surprise for someone like me, that drinks water ALL day. Extra towels, cups and even snacks from the "mini-bar" are all available at any time-you need only ask at the front desk. The pool is an event in itself and it's a cool scene with piped-in music, a glass wall of cascading water that lights up at night and a massive jacuzzi. If you want to chill poolside in a fun atmosphere- you will love it. There is a good restaurant on the property as well- Gallo Blanco. I ate there several times during our stay and I highly recommend the 1/2 Chicken "Pollo Asado"- so delish. We also went up to the rooftop area and although it seems to be undergoing some construction, the view and atmosphere up there was so gorgeous and romantic on a hot desert night. I'm sure when they are done working it will be incredible! Here are some things to consider: This is an old, mid-century building that has been updated. No central air...our room had 2 air conditioners and they made noise all night. The bathrooms are microscopic with a sink just outside of the toilet/shower. The scene at the hotel is happening and it's loud at night- if you want peace and quiet so you can drift gently off to sleep early...this is not your kinda place. Although these could be considered "cons", just realize that if you are looking for a resort with a luxury feel and those kinds of amenities- stick with the Phoenician or one like it. What you will find at The Hotel Clarendon is a nice little boutique hotel that's comfortable, stylish and fun at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and economically priced luxury.”
Reviews.Author: blusocial
Reviews.Content: I have a 2-day conference I attend in downtown Phoenix every November for a professional sales assocation I belong to. I find it convenient to stay at a hotel rather than drive back and forth from the edge of the East Valley. I have stayed at the Clarendon several times and the nightly rates are more affordable than gas. I chose The Clarendon over major chains based on I am a proponent of investing in local business. The Clarendon focuses on service and the small things that matter. The beds feature mattresses and bedding found only in luxury 5 star hotels. Rooms are spacious filled with techincal gadgets such as an iPod dock and flat screen TVs. the decor is modern and sleek. The hotel features artwork from local artists and has an interesting story of Don Bolles down their main floor hall. I find it easy to get to and from the hotel to my meeting destinations and local sites. They also have a restaraunt in the hotel that serves up amazing Mexican food. Prices are substantially cheaper than most hotel restaraunts. The have a rooftop area where I like to take my laptop to catch up on my emails. The place is quiet and the staff is personable and remembers your name and room number. There are always free snacks at the front counter. It's just a relaxing destination.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mishthedish2
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel is unique..from thefunky artwork on the walls to the soothing saltwater pool. The attached restaurant serves delicious meals...and the bar/lounge great cocktails. I used the complimentary PC also.

Reviews.Title: “The Clarendon Hotel, Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: LeeDeFl
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We are here now, and I did not want to wait until I got back to home on the east coast.The Clarendon is awesome! We arrived late last night from out flight, and the hotel staff was ready and waiting for us. Wow, talk about pleasant and informative, the nice young lady that checked us in showed her true love of her employers and business. The rooms are pleasant and fun, the beds are comfortable, and that is a big plus in my book! The whole hotel has a great atmosphere. We ate dinner at the restaurant tonight, and ate fantastic food at great prices. We came out here to visit my brother's daughter in St. Joe's Hospital and were lucky to be also close to the hospital. Would come here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has charm, history, location, and a very attentive staff and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: AZVagabonder
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to make it over to this hotel again after staying here about 13 years ago. What a difference the new ownership has made. I had seen the pool area remodel over the years, and now after last nights stay, I got the full flavor of revitalization. As a lover of the boutique experience, I enjoy the retro charm and touches in the lobby. I was booked in a Junior Sweet, and had no expectations when I walked through the door. I was greeted with soft classical music (a wonderful touch, by the way), a clean room with adorable furnishings, and a wine fridge. The staff, from the owner to housekeeping and the front desk were warm and welcoming. I loved every aspect of the hotel, pool area and the fabulous roof top patio. The only two suggestions I would make (actually, my partner would make), is to have a more convenient smoking area, as the hotel front and roof are quite a trek at 3am, AND have some fun in decorating the brick wall view from the glass elevator. Great job guys! Had a fantastic Staycation and didn't want to leave...hence the late check out :-)

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Different, Fun”
Reviews.Author: SDTripster
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix on a business trip for one night, and needed an inexpensive place to stay and meet with some clients. The downtown chains were charging a fortune, so I took a risk on The Clarendon and was very pleasantly surprised. It's a "funky" place with a kind of urban "distressed chic" that LA, SF and NYC hotels try hard to achieve and charge a lot of money for. The Clarendon is relatively inexpensive and is the real thing: somewhat "tatty" as my British friends like to say, but with cool and trendy appointments that make it well worth staying a night or two. The staff were absolutely fabulous - friendly, helpful, thorough in explaining the property's amenities and totally down to earth (shout out to David at the front desk!!!). My Jr. Suite had a Samsung flat screen TV, a Keurig single cup coffee maker and a Sharper Image clock radio with a built in MP3 cord and soothing sounds. There were Egyptian cotton robes in the closet and a massage head in the shower. I also noticed some holes, chips and cracking in the plaster around the shower enclosure, but otherwise everything was clean and in fairly decent condition, a little used, that's all. Loved the fluffy towels. The rooms and corridors are painted in bright colors (my bathroom was azure blue) and decorated with old western movie photos blown up and turned into pop-art. It was hotter than blazes when I arrived and it took some time for the AC unit to cool the room down and I didn't dare venture outside to the pool or take in the view from the famous roof-top deck. One downside, the AC unit blows right at the bed and because I had to keep it on all night, the breeze kept waking me up. I did use one of the hotel's meeting rooms; filled with wall to ceiling mirrors and a giant marble boardroom table. Different. What makes this boutique hotel even more unique is its history as the site of the assassination in 1976 of investigative reporter Don Bolles whose car - with him inside - was blown up in the hotel parking lot. You would think a hotel would try to keep this kind of violent history under wraps. Nope - not the Clarendon, they put it front and center! They have a bronze bust of Bolles with an accompanying biography next to the front desk. And the hallway to the meeting rooms features huge blowup black and white police photographs of Bolles' Datsun, blown to smithereens - cool. The restaurant and bars in the main lobby are fun, relaxing and hip - the food (primarily Mexican) terrific and inexpensive. Parking is plentiful and free. Driving to the center of Phoenix will take you about 8 minutes. If you want the same-old, sterile chain hotels - this ain't the place. You want unique, different and fun - you've got to try The Clarendon Hotel Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: syl0103
Reviews.Content: The clarendon is the best boutique hotel very contemporary and the beds are to die for! see for yourseld weather it be a night to getaway, a business trip or to relax and stay in a unique fun environment! I am definately coming back! Thank you Clarendon!

Reviews.Title: “Fun downtown Phoenix "resort"”
Reviews.Author: elsal
Reviews.Content: Having my home air conditioning expire on a very hot August afternoon in PHX, I quickly reserved a room at the nearby Clarendon Hotel. They have very reasonable summer room rates, even with the additional, non-negotiable, $20 a night "resort" fee. Not being there to be trendy, or to enjoy their rooftop bar or hang in their large communal jacuzzi, I asked for a quiet room away from the fun where I could use their wi-fi and rest while blasting the A/C. My "junior-suite" room 220 was just what I needed. Comfortable bedding, plenty of chilled bottled water, a nice modern TV in a spacious and clean room. Ordering a carne asada torta from the Gallo Blanco restaurant was a nice treat. No room service, but it took less than 10 minutes for the restaurant to have it ready when I came down from my room. It's an odd feeling for me to stay in a hotel in my home town, but if circumstances occur in the future where I need to, the Clarendon Hotel will be on my short list.

Reviews.Title: “A flawed but oddly charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNamaste
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is Phoenix's effort at a boutique hotel with a pool scene, similar to, say, Ace Palm Springs or Rumor Las Vegas. Physically, the property is a remodel of a much less reputable hotel, and the Clarendon is a big step up in style and substance from its predecessor. However, the legacy of the old hotel shows up in the awkward layout of rooms and the overall maintenance and condition of the property. There are a lot of things to like about the Clarendon. The staff are friendly and helpful. The service fee charged per room pays off late at night, when the front desk will cheerfully give you snacks (pepsi, cheetos, etc) after the restaurant closes. The bartenders make good drinks, and the bar and lounge areas, while modern and minimal in style, are welcoming and relaxing rather than pretentious or achingly hip. The best thing about the Clarendon, by far, is the rooftop lounge area. The Clarendon's location offers a great view in every direction, so you can sip your drink, hang out under the umbrellas, and chill out under the desert sky. After a hot day, few things are better than grabbing a cocktail from the bar downstairs and relaxing on the Clarendon rooftop with friends. But what could be one of the best things about the Clarendon is actually the best illustration of why Clarendon is, at best, a flawed but oddly charming property. The Clarendon would like you to think that it is built around a pool scene, and indeed you can see a pool or two there in the courtyard, with colorful umbrellas and a reasonable attempt to look like a boutique hotel in Palm Springs. But the wide variety of clientele results in a confusing pool scene mixing kids, older parents, vacationers, would-be hipsters, local partiers, and alcoholics, none of whom is quite sure that the others are really supposed to be there. Time of day doesn't seem to matter, either, and this strange pool scene bleeds into the rooftop scene the longer the night goes on. It's not unusual to hear kids stomping up the stairs to the rooftop, then see them running around shouting and punching each other while their drunk parents grope and fumble through a slow dance while barely avoiding the cactus. Ah, romance. The least attractive feature of the Clarendon is the relentless noise. Part of this is due to the general condition of the hotel. In our suite, for instance, the windows rattled incessantly, prompting a quick fix of wedging paper into the window frame just so we could hear each other talk. Likewise, as a legacy of its earlier incarnation as a much cheaper sort of hotel, the walls are very thin, both between rooms and between the rooms and common areas. But part of the noise is also due to the wide range of noise-making clientele. All of the noise from kids screaming and stomping, pool music blaring, drunk people shout-talking, and outside traffic zooming and honking, is transmitted directly into your ears with minimal interference. Even having a suite, with a (mostly pointless) sitting room situated between the front door and the sleeping area, didn't make much of a difference. The key to boutique hotels is having a unique vision and identity that carries through the entire property. While the Clarendon has obviously done a lot of work to upgrade the appearance of the property, much less thought has gone into what kind of hotel it is really supposed to be. The result is more like a budget motel with nice decor and attached bar/restaurant than it is a boutique hotel. I can't recommend it for long stays. But if you're in town for a night, you might check it out, if only to sip your cocktail on the rooftop and enjoy the desert breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Best Eclectic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michellee67
Reviews.Content: The waterfall by the pool, the decor of the rooms and the rooftop view out out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and different!”
Reviews.Author: dbandfamily
Reviews.Content: As others have said, if you are looking for a chain feel, this is not the place. It was an older building but you can see it has been remodeled in many ways, with bright colors and art splashed thought-out. As someone else mentioned, Urban Renewal. I loved the sheek and modern, yet eclectic look that carried thought-out the rooms, lounge and roof top deck. Our room was impeccably clean, great coffee and tea all ready. Great "Philosophy" shampoo and conditioner products. I can see where some would not like the Blue walls in some of the rooms, it was a little different, but I think that is what made it exciting and fun, we enjoyed having a different experience. You can see that they have put effort into the special "small" details. I think folks have to look at the value they are getting, where can you stay with all the extra touches, for such a great price. A few things we would comment on..everything in our room are great, big flat screen TV. The beds where also great. Only thing that was abit pesky was we stayed in room 221, the vent in our bathroom must have been on the fringe, every time we turned on the light is sounded loud. But since we only needed it when we went into the bathroom, we could ignore it. But perhaps others would be bothered by this. We enjoyed the music playing in the pool area. There where a lot of folks in the pool on a Friday evening, from 3-5, maybe a large group? So the noise was up around the pool area during that time. But after that cleared out, there was room. This is not a diving pool, but a nice area to cool off and relax. There is only one pool area. We did not hear a lot of noise from our room, as the wall are concrete. We loved lounging in the Rooftop Deck area at night, so relaxing. The staff was friendly and attentive. Gavin was greeting people and helping them with their bags, opening doors and just generally welcoming. Towels where available at the front desk, just a few feet from the pool area, so no big deal for us. Perhaps keeping track of how many are given to guests in specific rooms would a way of keeping control. This was done at some of the other hotels we have stayed at. They ask you how many you need, and track it, and at the end of your stay, that is what is expected to be returned. I would have loved some umbrella's or shade structures in the pool area as the sun can be excruciatingly hot, they have these set up in the rooftop patio area. It seem they have more and new exciting renovations happening, so I think it will only improve. Over all we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service... best local hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dyannap
Reviews.Content: After learning about a special rate celebrating the 40th birthday of Ben, the hotel owner, I booked two nights at The Clarendon, the first in July the second in November. I had visited the property once before, a few years back when the restaurant on the premises was under different management; I was left with the impression that the hotel looked really cool and fun and I made a mental note to check it out sometime. With the special deal I found, I decided now was the time. I booked a Jr. Suite for both nights, and my first stay was last night. I checked in early before my boyfriend arrived. Rachel helped me check in and was really friendly and helpful. I took in all the details as I walked to the elevator and then to my room. Really fun, local tilt-shift photography was hung on the walls leading to my room (#221). I wish I had snapped a few photos of my room, because it was really fun - a great king-size bed with a funky, upholstered headboard, dark-wood heavy furniture, a plush occasional chair by a lamp, a long desk/dresser, a 42" (if not bigger) TV anchored to the wall, and awesome blue walls made up the room. Unfortunately, I noticed the room hadn't been cleaned properly. By the Keurig coffee maker, I found a mess of opened sugar packets, creamer, and used swizzle sticks, and no cups or coffee. I called down to the front desk and Rachel answered. I told her what I found, and she came up to check it out. She seemed sincerely disgusted at what she saw and she was very apologetic. She left the room and came back with some cups and went down once again and this time returned with coffee, tea, and a wet rag to wipe down the counter. She also brought a few bags of chips, some candy bars, and four bottles of chilled water. She asked me what else she could do to make up for the mess, but I told her she'd done enough - more than was her responsibility, actually. Later that evening, after a pretty dismal experience at the Gallo Blanco Cafe, in the hotel lobby, I stopped at the front desk to request some extra towels and some sugar for the coffee.
