Ben, the owner, happened to be at the desk at the time and told me he heard we'd had a bad experience at the restaurant and asked how our stay had been otherwise. I told him about what happened before in the room and complimented him on having Rachel on his staff. Like Rachel, he was very apologetic and asked what he could do to make up for it. He also told me it had been Rachel's first day, and I couldn't have been more surprised - what an asset to his team! Before we went back upstairs, Ben gave me his card and asked me to let him know when we'd be staying over again so he could upgrade us to a full suite. He then came by the room with a huge stack of freshly laundered towels (they were still warm!) and apologized again and thanked us for our patience. Talk about customer service! When we checked out, Rachel was back at the front and asked about how our night went. I recapped for her the rest of the events and she again thanked me for our patience and good nature. This is why I support local businesses, especially when they hire amazing people who know how to treat their patrons and guests. For the wonderful customer service we were given, I'm rating this hotel five stars. Ben and Rachel, THANK YOU for being great. I look forward to our next stay, though I wish I didn't have to wait until November! P.S. - The amazing AC in the room? What a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting property with some serious character”
Reviews.Author: jandk712
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for a quick overnight before I headed out on a business trip. We picked this hotel because of its uniqueness, location and most of all price. It was very easy to find, parking was close. When we walked into the registration area (shares space with the bar) there was a flamenco performance in the room. We thought it was a fun addition to the night, but it was very hard to hear at the registration desk. No big deal for us, but imagine some may find that difficult when trying to check in. When I say it has character, that is true. If you are looking for a "Hilton", this is not the place for you. If you want something that is not the "usual", you should check this place out. The room had fun decor - the window covering was a slide-over picture which was cool. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Least liked: It is August in Phoenix, which means it is hot and humid. The room did not have the air turned on at all before we arrived. It took quite a bit of time for the room to cool down and in the meantime, it was uncomfortable. Of course, this is Phoenix so it is hot, but would have been nice to walk into a room of cool air after traveling and being outside.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Mid Century Modern Vibe, Pool, & Room!”
Reviews.Author: ModernBear
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! The pool is sparkling, sexy, & always has a lot of eye candy lounging around for both sexes. We loved our retro decorated suite and the fun stuff included in our stay like free snacks after 10pm. We stayed 4 nights and had a blast, dined at the cute restaurant and enjoyed the pool and hip roof deck on top w/ stunning views of Phoenix and beyond. The only thing we would suggest is installing more towel holders and hooks in the bath/vanity area. Otherwise highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great valentine stay”
Reviews.Author: Jsiercke
Reviews.Content: Rooms have wonderful design and amazing pool. Great place for local romantic getaway and excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TamithaB
Reviews.Content: I recently was at Clarendon for birthday celebration with boyfriend. They front desk was SO friendly and helpful especially when I told them I was there for birthday. The taco stand is always fun and reasonable priced especially for happy hour. The room was very nice and clean. The whole staff was super friendly and we had a great time. I can't wait to come back. I would only suggest trying to get to pool early enough to get a good spot if you plan on hanging there all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: jeccamae
Reviews.Content: We arrived after getting a great deal on our 1 night getaway for my boyfriend's birthday. They were packed and check-in took awhile but the staff was very friendly and made up for the minor inconvenience with a room upgrade and free drink passes. The hotel is older but if you can appreciate it's funky charm, it's a gem. We loved our retro comfy room and the pool area was great. The view from the rooftop lounge was an amazing sight. There are lots of fun artwork and little touches that make this place unique. Oh and the drink passes were good for anything we wanted, not some limited watered down well drink. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel with a great energy killer pool fantastic restaurant and best rooftop in phx!”
Reviews.Author: rhurley999
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about the Clarendon. If you are looking for a unique phx experience with great energy you've found it.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Friendly, FUN, affordable!!”
Reviews.Author: CPLembke
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is a great example of urban renewal... It's located in the heart of Central Phoenix, and is totally close to some of the most exciting nightlife and restaurants in the city. It's totally affordable, yet has the style and pizzazz of hotels similar to the W, but with much more of an individual personality, and far less attitude. Design detail is in every nook and cranny of The Clarendon... The pool is one of the funnest places I've ever been submerged in!!! I also adore the roof top deck, with fantastic views of the city...

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: JW_Belfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the end of a road trip. The Clarendon seems to be an older hotel that's been remade as a pretty cool boutique hotel. It's clean and has pretty cool decor. The pool area is great and has an awesome hot tub, open until midnight. Unfortunately the bar closed at 11 on a Friday night - which they didn't tell us until it was too late... But they did provide all night night snacks and soda free of charge. Location wise it seemed grand but we had a hire car and didn't really explore the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for toddlers.”
Reviews.Author: travelwell_11
Reviews.Content: The railing does not meet any safety guidlines. My grandson is 18 months old and a big guy. He fit thru the bars and would have fallen to his death if I had not grabbed his arm and pulled him to safety. I told the front desk that the bars are too wide and someone will get hurt but the response was nill. The rooms are not clean. Housekeeping gives you fresh towels but the sink, tub and mirrors are not touched. Great place if you don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, urban escape -- retro done right”
Reviews.Author: Zombie4President
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon Hotel in Phoenix is in a perfect location in Downtown/CenPho area. Off Clarendon and Central-ish, it's near the light rail and the best of the Valley's local restaurants, museums. But it's also far enough off of Central that you know when you pull up that you can expect to actually get some sleep at night. The hotel is done in a retro, 60s-ish mod theme, with bright colors and clearly defined shapes in every room you look -- but it's done authentically and doesn't feel ostentatious (which is saying something, since the lobby has mirrored, flocked wallpaper). Obviously, the standouts at this hotel are the pool, the rooftop deck and Gallo Blanco, the onsite Mexican restaurant. The pool is gorgeous and worth the stay all by itself. Astroturf spots throughout the pool deck area are an awesome touch (no burned tootsies!) and the spa is seriously the largest I've ever seen, and according to their Web site, it seats 50 people. Reportedly, the pool has underwater speakers & light-up stars at night, but neither of these were working when I stayed here. We had a junior suite, which was ridiculously huge. It had two desks, a giant tv, a fridge and a king bed but enough space for 10+ to just stand around. Pretty sure it's the size of my living room. The bed is heavenly! Also, the whole hotel is older (60s-era Phoenix) so it's all concrete block construction. The benefit is that the room stays cool even without the A/C on... the downside is that the internet reception is spotty. At night, go down to the front desk and get FREE munchies -- full size candy bars, soda, otter pops & mini bags of chips. Before 10p they're $1, but still. Before 10p, make sure you go grab sangria and guacamole from Gallo Blanco and head up to the rooftop deck for sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Such a surprise - a wonderful hotel, where I felt like their most important guest."”
Reviews.Author: CoyoteQ
Reviews.Content: From the moment I came through the door, I was treated with friendly service tht was above and beyond what I have experienced at most "chain" hotels. From the bottle of water and "Otter Pop" I received when I was registering to the Kit Kat when I needed a chocolate fix later that night, I felt like the most important person staying there. And the price was definitely reasonable. The Clarendon staff was always ready to answer and question or help me with anything I needed. The Rooftop seating is a great place to enjoy the morning sunshine. The little touches of decorating genius had me and my camera very busy. The room was clean, but the carpet need a good steam cleaning. The bathroom was immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Cup of Tea”
Reviews.Author: AbqChica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there during Spring Training and basically decided it was not our cup of tea. We did get a room that was quiet. And it was clean. We found the decor to be too modern for us. I particularly disliked the dark color on the walls. And I generally found the hotel to be rather run down. The pool was fine, and the over-sized hot tub was neat. Though it was closed one day because someone had broken a glass or bottle nearby and they had to clean it. Of course you're not supposed to have glass in the pool area, but there's not enough staff out there to monitor that. The rooftop lounge is also overrated. Basically blue carpet, lawn furniture, and big umbrellas. Also run down. If you do decide to support independently owned businesses and stay there, be sure to bring your own towels. Towels were at a premium when we stayed. The front desk was always running short on either pool towels or bath towels. We ended up hoarding every towel we could get our hands on. Oh, we were on the 4th floor and the elevator was busted for at least a day. Luckily it wasn't a day we were bringing luggage up to or down from our room. The superior service everyone refers to in their reviews was a big attraction for us. We found it just average. The bright spot of this place is the restaurant in the hotel. Excellent, fresh, Mexican food. They make their own horchata! So for most average tourists who want a down-town Phoenix experience, I'd recommend staying at a hotel on North Central Avenue near the museum. But definitely have meal at the Clarendon's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Best customer service!”
Reviews.Author: mbroTempe
Reviews.Content: The staff were exceptional. The room - beautiful - clean - and had everything we needed. The FREE mini snack bar at night was great too :) The next day at the pool the staff came around handing out free flavor ices to everyone. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sanditx
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable! Friendly staff. Second time to stay and this was better than the first! Loved pool area with it's lounging in either the cabana or pool side chairs! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I would live at The Clarendon Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LisaAnitaWegner
Reviews.Content: I came to Phoenix for two film screenings end of June, and the Phoenix Art Museum put me up in The Clarendon. I'm usually not too keen on hotels and yearn to get back to sleeping in a home. Not this time... The Clarendon was the perfect mix of classy, relaxed and artistic. There are free night time snacks at the front desk! Endless coffee, tea and bottled water. Awesome pool, powerful yet adjustable airconditioning, big tv and rooftop patio . Dreamy beds and a real personality. And they are dog friendly- I didn't bring my dogs but I enjoyed seeing them around. I could never understand how people could live in a hotel, but now I do. I could live at The Clarendon. I am intending to go back in November 2011 to shoot a film in the desert. Lisa Anita Wegner Mighty Brave Productions/ Dufferson Herman Arts Umbrella

Reviews.Title: “Very fun vibe!”
Reviews.Author: iceestar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night here for a little 'staycation' and really enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly, the bed was SO comfortable, with about five big pillows. I loved that they offered free snacks in the evening, and the restaraunt was good too. We stayed on a Friday night, and the restaraunt was lively, but not overpacked, we ordered some chips and guaco and took them to the rooftop. Great views! It was totally empty up there, I thought it was staffed on the weekends, but maybe not. The pool was nice, the waterfall feature was a cool touch, but I did notice the tiles around the pool could have used a good scrubbing. Overall everything was clean and orderly though. The pool wasn't crowded either. Only complaint was that our air conditioner woke us up early by making this buzzing sound every five minutes like an alarm clock, weird! Overall we had a great time and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous urban oasis”
Reviews.Author: trambustatrice
Reviews.Content: we arrived all hot and bothered at nighttime and within half an hour had cooled down in the fantastic pool (hot tip - they pipe music underwater) and blissed out on the pool beds. this was followed by a delicious meal at the hotel's mexican restaurant served by friendly and funny staff. there is a rooftop bar which we didn't get a chance to check out but i'm sure is great we stayed a total of two nights and were devastated to leave. the hotel staff were super friendly and cool, the room (we had a junior suite) was well priced and the philosophy toiletries were so great i ended up switching my usual shampoo to the one in the room. even though this hotel isn't smack in the middle of downtown, it was easy and quick to get downtown on the tram system the only complaint would be that the AC seemed to be a bit on the fritz. i imagine this would be more of a problem in the height of summer and probably specific to our room overall, i couldn't recommend this place enough

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: jayluvsu
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to book a room at this hotel. My husband and I stayed here on the first and last night of our weeklong trip, and we actually looked forward to returning on our last night. The front desk staff was very friendly and personable, and the vibe is cool and artsy. I love that the door of each room is affixed with an Arizona license plate, displaying the room's number. Our first room was a standard queen, and we were very satisfied with the size, cleanliness, and amenities. On our return visit, our standard queen was actually upgraded to a suite! It was definitely a pleasant and unexpected perk! Although the hotel is located in the more quiet museum district, there is a Safeway only a few blocks away, as well as gas stations and fast food options within a mile radius. If we visit Phoenix again, we will stay at the Clarendon again, without question.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean, nice surprise in the city”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastvet
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to fiind, good parking options, clean, unique, friendly staff, and very comfortable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: NilesR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a staycation at the Clarendon Hotel. We have never stayed in a hotel beside a national chain and were quite pleased with the "boutique hotel" experience. The hotel advertises itself as not your "cookie cutter" hotel and it most definitely is not! It is much, much better. From the unique, eclectic decor to the bonus perks that papmer you (flat screens, philosophy bath products, Keurig coffee machines, free late night snacks, comfy bathrobes) we had a great time. The bed in our room was beyond amazing. We had no issues with the A/C or internet. The customer service could use some work, however it wasn't bad enough to detract from our stay. Thanks Clarendon for our mini-getaway!

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel that could....”
Reviews.Author: wisewitch1
Reviews.Content: Recently had the pleasure of staying here twice within the last month. In both instances, each time they had something different going on. The pool area is beautiful, the cascading waterfall in the background, illuminated at night..you won't see this at the Hyatt. They had flamenco dancers in the lobby, putting on a show for almost 2 hours for free. Small, but lively crowd. Enjoy the Phoenix views, either sunset or sunrise on their cozy rooftop. Each of the rooms have great amenities. Even if you don't partake in the ongoing activities at the hotel, the rooms are comfortable, some have great views of the pool below and best of all, quiet..I had a great night's sleep both times. The restaurant ...Gallo Blanco is amazing..I had Chilaquiles w/chicken & veggies..yummy. No place is perfect, so I would say the fitness room, although its open 24 hours, i didn't fit my needs, but thanxs to the staff. I took a walk a couple of blocks and took the light rail downtown and took in some of the downtown nightlife as well @ Cityscape. After all this & going back to the room, I realized that I want a little snack. (there is bottled water in the room already) went to the front desk and they had some candy (Snickers is my favorite) for free. Upon checkout, you get a $20 coupon for your next stay. Sign up on Facebook for promotional offers and surprise deals. All of this was under $100. Check out the website, the pictures don't do it justice

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fun - good for younger adults”
Reviews.Author: Asmaradana
Reviews.Content: There's lots to love at the Clarendon Hotel. It's got a great atmosphere -- lots of character in the decor, definitely not designed by committee but by someone with personality. My room was nice, colorful, comfortable. The pool area and rooftop patio are great places to hang out. It just has a great atmosphere. It's a little uneven, however. My room lacked a clock/radio, which I just thought was standard practice until I visited my friend's room on the way to check out and observed a clock-radio in that room. The free WiFi also did not work in my room. Small things, but key to the difference between a good place and a great one. This is definitely a spot for younger adults (20-30s). I arrived on Saturday afternoon; the pool and bar were full of revelers and pretty much stayed that way all afternoon and evening. The hotel does not cater to those on an earlier schedule, however. I went up to the rooftop patio at 7 a.m. Sunday -- which is a prime time to be up there, when one can enjoy the spectacular views in the cool of the morning. Unfortunately, all of the tables were full of dirty dishes (including glasses with dregs of drinks and extinguished cigarettes) from the previous night. When I stopped by the front desk at 8 a.m. to get a towel to go for a swim, I was told that all the pool towels were in the wash and it would be 30 minutes before one was available. After a long wait, I was brought two hand towels. So is it impossible to do some of your laundry during the afternoon or evening so that your morning customers can have towels?! Or to have someone on the waitstaff at least clear away the wreckage when the roof bar closes at midnight? That said, the staff was very friendly and affable. I think they are just catering to people who are oriented toward the end of the day, not the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “I'm giving this place another chance”
Reviews.Author: phoenix8599
Reviews.Content: So I originally stayed here back in 2008 (it doesn't give me the option to go back that far in tripadvisor) and was VERY turned off by the nasty decor in the rooms. As others have said, it appears as this is 1970s subsidized housing or possibly even a former hospice without it being a ~hospice~ home. It was the little boutique hotel that wanted to be something else. Good price, but not "boutique" by any means if you've every been to a true boutique in San Francisco or New York. The blue paint was peeling due to being several inches thick. The bathroom was a joke. No fans, it looks worse than my grandmother's shower in her RV (not kidding). My stay was on a week night, and the hotel, bar, rooftop patio were not busy, however it took over 2.5 hours to get any extra pillows (only 2 down-ish pillows provided) brought up to my room. The place was empty, so that was strange or either poor management. Flash forward to 2011 - I have frequented the Clarendon since my 2008 stay and brought out-of-town friends here (for drinks only, I would never recommend someone stay here) and they LOVE the rooftop view. I have also had better experiences with the front desk. My most recent visit was in March of 2011. The guac and margaritas downstairs were **AMAZING** as was the new decor downstairs! I've booked a room at the Clarendon for this week (can't wait!!) to give them another chance...according to other reviews the guest rooms have been updated. I will definitely report back on my findings, but for now I can only give this place a 2.0. i look forward to having an awesome experience this time and will update my review accordingly!

Reviews.Title: “Very cute, very quaint”
Reviews.Author: AZian520
Reviews.Content: Very retro/modern feel in the heart of downtown. Convenient location and wonderful pool area. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as good as the pictures look.”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaKBR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night last week at the Clarendon. We had a layover in Phoenix and we like Boutique hotels and the pictures looked great and boy were we dissapointed. We've stayed in a lot of Boutique hotels and have to admit that the consistency can vary on things like cleanliness, etc. What I was most dissapointed about was how incomplete the renovation of this building is. The bathrooms in the rooms have not even been professionally painted and the tub and toilet were at least 20 years old. This building appears to be an apartment complex from the 60's that someone had a limited budget to turn into a hotel. Not great. I can only assume from the awards that this hotel has received that there isn't much competition as far as boutique hotels go in Phoenix. The carpet in the rooms is dark and it is easy to tell how unclean it is. The rooftop patio is a joke. The colorful tiles in the pool area are dirty. Bottom line is that there just doesn't seem to be a lot of pride of ownership here. This hotel will be a wreck in another 5 years. Too bad because there was a good idea here at some point, but it lacked the budget to complete it properly and the know how to keep it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel for a surprisingly low price”
Reviews.Author: littletree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarendon for two nights and I have nothing but positive things to report: The entire place is really well designed, if aesthetics are important to you -- the rooms, the lobby, the little cafe, and even the artwork on the walls all feel modern and slightly playful. The bed was really comfortable, and the towels plusher and softer than at any old chain place. Aveda bath products were a nice touch as well. The room had one of those Keurig individual-cup coffee makers, with a few different types of coffee/tea available. No, the free munchies aren't in your room, they're at the front desk, and only from 10:30pm til 7:30am, but if you remember and are around to get them, it's a great perk. The restaurant has slightly upscale Mexican type dishes and were very good and very reasonably priced. The pool was gorgeous, though I didn't get a chance to use it, as I was there for work. But I'm scheming for ways to go back so I can enjoy it next time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: Miloman10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only hip and trendy, but it's one of the friendliest places I've ever stayed. I stayed during the week and arrived at the hotel late at night, after their cool restaurant and bar had closed. The lady at the front desk upgraded my room, then offered me ice, free soft drinks and snacks. The rooms are huge and very retro. Mine was on the 3rd floor, facing the pool. The deck and pool both stay open until midnight and are great places to hang out. The pool is beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant is wonderful. I ate both dinner and breakfast there. The orange cake is one of the best things I"ve ever tasted. The bar area has great happy hour specials on both food and drink. The hotel has a very happening vibe and on Wed. night they had Flamenco dancers in the lobby. I wished I could have stayed longer, for leisure and will definitely return. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “a rgeat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: madbanana
Reviews.Content: our room wasn't ready when we checked in so we went to the bar and waited good drinks good food good service let the time slide by and when i went to check on our room it still wasn't ready so no hassle they upgraded me/us to an one room suite. room was on third floor,over looking great pool, that is one of the decidedly different pools and area I've seen in a while,it was just like the pics on the website.Being on the 3rd floor only put us 1 floor from the rooftop gathering , partying area ,this was were my wife and I caught every sunset each night i/we were there. at night we (if not down at the restaurant or bar) would look at the night lights of Phoenix if not the stars ,very comfortable chairs and couches .While they only had 1 elevator (and it was slow) we typically walked up the stairs,we found this was a very nice place to stay , I booked this on hotwire.com so I had no idea what I was getting for 50$ a night but i was going to phoenix for spring training and my wife was only staying for a week,so it really didn't matter( I stayed another 5 days).we were a little apprehensive as after we found out where we were staying (hotwire) and reading reviews that said this was a gay friendly ? hotel. So we weren't surprised when we seen gay couples and singles in the hotel,and some of the staff maybe ,and it was not uncomfortable, there were even a few (3-4) families present with younger children.The A/C worked real good in the living room,but the bedroom one seem to be in a different world ,it worked most of the time ,but I couldn't figure out how to use the remote correctly .the restaurant and the bar both close @ 10pm -11pm on fri./sat. a little early for me but I could go up to the roof ( BYOB )and not have to retire for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it as always”
Reviews.Author: absolutejen
Reviews.Content: Great stay-cation, affordable but with great amenities, food and beverage. No other rooftop view like it.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I stay here this place get's better...”
Reviews.Author: Chesworthmd
Reviews.Content: I love the Clarendon Hotel!!! Comfort + Style in the best part of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: 123Travel-a-lot
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place to stay, if I could give it a "0" star rating I would. When booking this hotel it showed as a three and a half star (not true) Arrived for a late check in at 10:45pm. The room (#228) was very outdated and it had been painted to look updated with bright blue paint. The furniture was chipped, and the bathroom sink did not fit properly onto the vanity. The power strips under the TV were strung together by electrical cords. There was something disgusting on the carpet between the beds, told the kids to keep their shoes on. The restaurant/bar service door was below our single paned window and each time they would open the security screen door it would rattle our window. The WORST PART was awakening on Saturday morning at 6:00am to a contractor wearing crocs on a ladder outside our window sawing/grinding a metal structure. Smoke was coming in our room through the unsealed window. I called the reception desk to report this loud noise and smoke, she said she thought she smelled something too and would investigate...nothing was done. When I called for more towels (room only had 2) at 6:40am, no mention of a resolution. The guy was still sawing outside the window. When the towels were delivered at 7:10am. I inquired with Michele who was told of the problem from the off going night receptionist, but had no resolution. Said she was told by the guy that by city ordinance that he could start work at 6:00am. I showed her the smoke in the room and she said she would see what could be done...I told her we were leaving. Upon checking out at the front desk (7:40am), she gave me a photo copied coupon for 20.00 of my next stay....like I would want to go back there. We drove to the side that our room was located at to see smoke stains going up the wall outside our room window. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY....

Reviews.Title: “The Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: aoltersdorf
Reviews.Content: Quite honestly I can't say enough about the staff at The Clarendon during my recent stay. My wife and I planned a romantic weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Prior to our arrival I contacted the hotel regarding some special requests to make the weekend special for my wife. I was amazed at Mackenzie's willingness to go out of his way to accommodate all of my requests over and above my hopes, right down to his willingness to shed petals form the 100+ roses I delivered to blanket the room in rose petals. James at the front desk was also very helpful as well as Doug among several other staff members who hand delivered individual roses and anniversary wishes to my wife. Thanks to all of you. The rooms as well as the hotel gave off the trendy hipster vibe you'd expect from a urban retreat. The on-site restaurant fare was amazing whether you were dining there or in your room, turn around of orders was a little slow but understandably considering the volume of patrons. Once again the smiles and pleasantness of the restaurant and bar staff was equal to the level we received at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You guys are our place in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ucriverside98
Reviews.Content: Rolled my girlfriends business trip to Phoenix into a personal trip as well. She ONLY stays at the Clarendon when in town. The place is hip without being pretentious or stuffy, and they went out of their way to make our stay awesome. The restaurant is great (although this time the service was unusually slow) and the rooms are sweet. The beds were spotless and mattresses were divine. The hotel is a little tricky to find but that is a good thing. . . a real retreat from the ugly side of Phoenix. Spend a little extra money to stay at a place like this. . . . you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: kristad314
Reviews.Content: I would have never guessed that Phoenix was such a pricey city for hotels. The Clarendon was on the lower side of the cost scale and with free parking I was sold on it. Once we arrived I was pleasantly surprised at how cute the hotel was. The front desk staff was great, helpful and always very friendly regardless of time of day. I loved the fact that at night you were able to get some free snacks and soda. Forgot suntan lotion, no problem, you can borrow some of theirs. We had booked a Jr. Suite, but upon checking in were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. We headed up to room 308, which was on the end, so it was a good location. The room was spacious and decorated with a modern trendy type flair. The bed was extremely comfortable. The air conditioning units...the one in the bedroom was fine. The one in the living room made an annoying noise every now and again. Unfortunately if we shut it off the bedroom just got too hot, so we lived with the noise. It wasn't constant so it wasn't so bad. The rooms contain bottles of water, that you don't have to pay for as well as a mini refrigerator. Big pluses in my book. The bathroom is a little small and could use a bit of an update but it was fine. The only issue we had was that our room wasn't cleaned 1 day. After being out all morning we returned about 3pm to find our room had not been touched. We asked the front desk and were told they were still cleaning, so we headed for the pool for a couple of hours only to return again with the room not being cleaned. The next morning our room was cleaned while we were at breakfast. Not sure what happened, but it wasn't anything to get real upset about. You pay an additional $15/night for use of pool and wifi, etc. The pool is great as is the large whirlpool. Gallo Blanco located in the lobby is delicious as I mentioned my review for that. The rooftop was a nice place to sit an watch the sunset or enjoy a drink at night. Pay attention to their recommended restaurants in the area and trust them. We tried 2 (Tuck Shop and Local Breeze) and they were both fabulous. All in all, I thought the hotel was great and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “As a business traveler, efficient is mandatory...”
Reviews.Author: 1jewelrywoman
Reviews.Content: And, that's what you'll find at The Clarendon Hotel along with accuracy, good food in the hotel's restaurant, knowledgeable and friendly staff, business services, meeting rooms, all the luxuries, and just a short ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved. It.”
Reviews.Author: AmyFeds
Reviews.Content: Often when travelling I'll try to stay with friends, trading the comfort of a hotel room for savings. My stay at the Clarendon reminded me why hotels are luxurious and worth every single penny. Firstly, this place is very hip but without feeling "sceney." Hotel personnel were extremely friendly and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Secondly, the rooms were spotless. What a great comfort and great relief to come back to a sparkling shrine of cleanliness perfection after a day walking around and seeing the sights. Were I to define my stay, I would sum it up as flawless relaxation embodied.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to spot in PHX”
Reviews.Author: BarryEgan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now and I recommend it highly. Its vintagey feel that others have referenced is a HUGE part of its charm. And they've done an amazing job on the redesign of the space. The rooms are cool, yes, but they're super-comfortable which is the most important thing. I find hotels that are going for "hip" often come off as oppressive. I don't feel ANY of that pretense in the decor, the staff (example: we had to change some plans on our last trip, and the manager we spoke with, Kendall, was amazingly helpful with us), the overall vibe -- it's just a really nice stay. I think that's why I've always seen such a variety of guests when I stay there. It has a great pool/courtyard area, nice rooftop space, the rooms are well-designed (I've stayed in a few different layouts, and liked them all), full of light, comfortable beds, big TVs, artwork that doesn't offend. Can't beat it. And also important: I think they could get away with charging way more than they do. This is kind of a steal at the prices I've booked. Oh, last thing: Gallo Blanco, as many have mentioned, is a legitimately good spot to eat. Great for breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “CUUUUUUUUUUTE!”
Reviews.Author: Larper4Life
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Clarendon was one of the most unique hotel experiences I have EVER had. The decor is vintage looking with a super hip twist, just hip enough to be interesting and just vintage enough to be comfy. Every interaction with an employee was strangely pleasant, I feel as though while on this vacation I was staying at a friend's house. Courteous and knowledgeable, The Clarendon staff always seemed eager help. -Plus, they gave us free chocolate! This was definitely an experience I will not soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with our stay from the very start!”
Reviews.Author: VKtraveler_10
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in PHX on a flight delay, found this when we googled "Retro Hotels Phoenix" and on Hotels.com - first listing in both cases. We checked in early, went straight to the pool and enjoyed it well into the evening. Everything about this pushed our positive buttons: young friendly staff, good mix of families and hipsters, retro decor and music (Deano by the pool), fun bar, gorgeous room, all at a fair price. We will definitely return, and with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: anomy6
Reviews.Content: If you want to go somewhere and feel welcomed the entire time during your stay--definitely stay at The Clarendon. I have never had all my concerns taken care of so quickly. The staff was always ready and willing with suggestions for places to see in the area and if they didn't know off hand they didn't mind printing out directions. It seems like they were always busy but never too busy to help out. The bedding was superb and I have never slept better and housekeeping did a great job every day keeping things tidy. I had some of the best food at the restaurant attached to The Clarendon hotel Gallo Blanco. While the hotel is a little older it has fresh trendy decor and without the attitude that you usually find in newer trendy boutique hotels. The Clarendon holds its own with outstanding service and willingness to make you feel welcome with outstanding amenities. They do have a Hotel Service Fee which is $15 which covers parking, internet and phone calls which isn't too bad considering what I have paid double that in the past for just overnight parking. I would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMovie500
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what I was going to get when I booked at the Clarendon but I decided to give it a try after reading the reviews. I was still a little unsure when I entered the neighborhood, not much else around but I was determined to keep an open mind. The lobby of the hotel was nothing much but the person at the desk was very helpful and offered me a bottled water or soda. This is an example of the small nicities that make this hotel unique. The rooms of the hotel are arranged around a central courtyard containing a decent sized swimming pool and huge hot tub. There were many lounge chairs, outside speakers playing music and a cool water wall at the far end. This pool area is open to midnight, which is cool considering the heat of Phoenix makes outdoor living after dark a must. Because this hotel caters to a more adult clientele there is not the mad chaotic pool scene that is often found at the chain hotel's pools. The only thing missing was a poolside bar but the restaurant bar is not far from the pool and are happy to put your drinks is a platic cup to be enjoyed poolside. Also several times when enjoying the pool area the manager walked by and asked people if they would like a water or soda. The rooms were spacious, the bed was comfortable, the room had a refrigerator and a 42 inch LCD TV. The bathroom was clean but nothing special and the room was a bit dark. There is also a cool roof top deck that had tables, comfy chairs and large umbrellas for shade. This is a great place to enjoy a drink, surf the Internet and watch the sunset. top Pros of this hotel: service of staff, great on site restaurant, roof top deck, people watching, covered parking, large TV, free wi-fi throughout the property, location close to many area attractions. Top limitations of this hotel: wi-fi spotty at times, no poolside or roof top bar, one small elevator makes using the stairs the preferred method, $15 a day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home...”
Reviews.Author: michellemm22
Reviews.Content: So the Holiday Inn overbooked and sent me to the Clarendon. I was a little nervous, had never heard of it. What a blessing!!! FANTASTIC experience all the way around. Doug was on nights, so warm and welcoming, made me feel right at home. Every time I went in or out, very warm staff offering any help needed. Great room. Eclectic, contemp, a little retro...just really neat, and CLEAN! Great housekeeping everyday. Art from many local artists...beautiful! Rated best mexican restaurant next to the lobby....DELICIOUS - ate there every night. Just a fabulous experience all the way around and can't wait to go back next year! Oh...and they hook you up with the best (most reasonable) cab driver "Bill" too!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Every!”
Reviews.Author: MattyGray
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at The Clarendon Hotel this past weekend, but the hotel was oversold and even though I had a guarantee room I was out of luck. I travel quite a bit for work this is the first time I have every been left without a hotel room. To make matters worse the night manager made no effort to help us find another room in the city. Buyer beware if you are booking a room at The Clarendon you might have to find a place somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very happening place with a nice updated hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: MathewMariani
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay here - was comfortable and the rooftop deck and pool are great amenities, resort like. The updated interiors and finishes are quite refreshing and the staff were very good! The best part of this place is the restaurant downstairs. Although i dont think its affiliated with hotel, it is accessible from the lobby and the food and atmosphere there for both dinner, drinks and breakfast is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: syntheticsweets
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the great reviews and was very pleased by the hotel. The staff was super nice and the room was really big, clean, and had character. It's not the typical box hotel that looks the same no matter where you are, it has a very fun and had a hip vibe with free munchies. The roof top patio was a nice plus and so was the huge hot tub! The roof top didn't look as nice as the pictures, but it wasn't far off from what the web page showed. All other pictures are exactly what we saw at the hotel. I had a great birthday week/spring training experience. We plan to come back and stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel with a "south beach FL vibe" and very inexpensive. Great staff, rooms, and restaurant. All ages :)”
Reviews.Author: sandiw69
Reviews.Content: Really unique hotel for downtown Phoenix. Beautiful pool area, plenty of different style lounge chairs and palapa poolside beds. Great rooftop for intimate couples and big parties. Rooms are big, clean and fun with a funky retro decor. Restaurant is fabulous, everyone is super. Fun, professional staff but not stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, service, room quality, and value”
Reviews.Author: nationaltraveler
Reviews.Content: My company held a 3 day conference at the Clarendon with 20 attendees. They upgraded their meeting room chairs which were very comfortable. They're privately owned and take customer service as a serious priority. Rooms are spacious, beds are the same as Ritz Carlton, free mini bar, in-house restaurant with locally, organically grown and purchased food items. They immediately responded to any special requests and treated everyone as if they were VIPs. I highly recommend the Clarendon for your travel and business needs or if you want to hang out and chill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place; Great Stay; Filled with Character;”
Reviews.Author: eaglespirit77
Reviews.Content: If you like a place with atmosphere, adjacent to a wonderful restaurant with all kinds of extra goodies, you will be thrilled by the Clarendon. Relax with a drink by the pool, gazing at the various water themes, lights and stars. Don't stay here if you like chain hotels. The Clarendon is everything but bland The beds are super comfy with duvets and there is every amenity you can think off. the staff are great and Ben the owner, will make you feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Caiter_Bug
Reviews.Content: I did not care for this hotel at all. My room was right above the on-site restaurant. The first night the noise of the dining room was tolerable. However, the second night there was a live band playing until 9pm. I called the front desk to see if I could change rooms and they said I would have to pay for an upgrade! The room was clean but a little run down (there were dings in the walls, the mirror in the bathroom was chipped and the shower wasn't very clean). The hotel looks like it was previously an apartment building. The walls were all concrete and it felt like I was staying in a jail cell. Do not stay in room 234. Pros: They didn't make me pay for the third night I had originally booked and the beds were VERY comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Feel with Traditional Service”
Reviews.Author: gftdblndchx
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon had a contemporary and modern feel with the most down-home traditional service. A great place to stay at the heart of Phoenix. I had a great night's sleep on the mattress, saw gorgeous views from the pools of the metropolitan area, and had a level of comfort unparalled by many other hotels in the area. A definite must-stay for locals and visitors!

Reviews.Title: “nice staycayion!”
Reviews.Author: tiffers82
Reviews.Content: Took my boyfriend here as a surprise for Valentine's Day. We had such a nice relaxing time that we ended up booking another night! The bed is amazing! Soooo comfortable! We booked a junior suite for $99 as a groupon deal and the hotel staff was nice enough to let us book a second night at the same rate! I loved the jacuzzi....it's so big that it's nice to be able to cuddle up in and not have some stranger sitting right next to you.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Urban Vibe”
Reviews.Author: TheOracle_7
Reviews.Content: This is a great place, probably built in the 1960's but updated nicely and still retains the retro feel. I appreciate what they are trying to provide here, there is a good restaurant onsite, a roof top lounge with great views of downtown and the surrounding mountains. Diverse clientele, lots of younger people seem to be around on weekends. Rooms are large with a bedroom and separate area with seating, desk, refrigerator, etc. Close to the light rail system and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! Friendly AND Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ljsmith6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! Would definently book here again in a heartbeat! They work hard to put YOU first. Great overall experience-hotel was very clean, and service and staff were FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “A former apartment building trying to be a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne54_11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, no record of reservation (via Priceline). Worked from my printed confirmation and accommodated my daughter and I accordingly with a Jr. Suite. We were booked for 3 nights but room had only one pant hanger and one regular hanger , definitely needed more. Safe did not work so we had to cart our computers with us at all times. Never got housekeeping as we didn't realize the door sign said "Do Not Disturb" on both sides. One bar of soap for sink area and shower. Staff nice but a little too cool - sweatshirts to beanies to sundress. Living room area so dark we didn't use (one very small window adjacent to door). Empty mini bar appreciated but no glasses if you brought wine, etc. - would have had to go to restaurant to ask if they would provide a glass. Used paper coffee cup for wine. Ironing board hanging outside of closet adjacent to t.v. If you need ice, you get handed a bag of ice. Door knobs original to when it was an apartment (70's), shower knob the same and very difficult to adjust temperature. Pool area very nice - restaurant food very good but separate from hotel and you cannot charge to room. Rooftop lounge, nice view but heavily painted exposed pipes a distraction. Overall hotel heavily painted to try and cover up that it was once an apartment building. Concept has potential - just needs some "growing up" to truly achieve "hip alternative hotel". Would I recommend this hotel? As long as you're not expecting too much and hotel site photos don't necessarily measure up to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great management staff.”
Reviews.Author: quinnys87
Reviews.Content: Had a super fun time with my girlfriends in this place. It was a great hotel for some friends to share a room together, clean, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dbowerso
Reviews.Content: The Claredon is extremely beautiful. All the staff members are so kind and generous. I am happy that my family decided to spend part of the holidays there this past year. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and extremely clean. My family LOVES pools, and the Claredon's definately passed the test. I would highly recommend the Claredon to anyone coming to the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Sheeter_11
Reviews.Content: A nice leisurely, romantic trip for my boyfriend and me for our two year anniversary. It was everything we could have asked for to spend a pleasant weekend together. The pool is fabulous and the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Breezy231
Reviews.Content: The Clarandon Hotel is as generous as it is beautiful! They always put you -- the client -- first, and will do their absolute best to fulfill this! The scenery is just jaw-dropping, and the customer service will make you feel like a princess, and let's not forget the delicious food and spa! I highly recommend the Clarandon Hotel and am making sure to tell all my friends and sisters to come on by! They are in for a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: TMIMITW
Reviews.Content: I had a very good time at this hotel, but I'm from Arizona and live in Phoenix so I wasn't as surprised as out of towners might be at things that some might see as flaws and that others might find charming or a comforting reminder of AZ's 70s seediness. The room was just fine, a top floor junior suite that was clean and well appointed. It had two new beds, a very nice, large flat screen TV, and hip furniture. The radio was set to some sort of in-house sound system that put out very cool music that was perfect for chilling in the room. I slept very well in the bed and didn't want to get out in the morning. Fortunately, the staff obliged my request for a late check out. The pool is very pretty, with nice furniture poolside, but I didn't spend much time in it. The lobby is fun, with a nice sitting area to people watch, a bar with good local beer on tap, and the exceptionally good Gallo Blanco Mexican restaurant. I've now been there twice and had excellent food both times. I recommend the chilaquiles and the Bloody Mary they serve. My only disappointment with the place was that the much vaunted rooftop bar was closed before its advertised closing time, on a Friday night no less.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable But Inconsisten”
Reviews.Author: BoltzMan
Reviews.Content: There's so much to like about The Clarendon; if only they thought the place through, and then were consistent about it. They bill themselves as a 'boutique' and in many ways this former small hotel (105 rooms) is, with truly wonderful staff, quirky bold colors in rooms, high quality bedding, Heurig coffee maker, fridge, safe, flat screen TV and other nice touches. The virtually unlimited free "munchies" after 10 PM (candy bars, chips, sodas, candles) are cool, the courtyard large pool and huge hot tub are gorgeous with a massive water wall, and the restaurant is truly popular, and it's truly dog friendly. What's not to love? Well, the day without water due to a leak, the frozen elevator, the burned out light, a defective clock alram that lacked instructions, and the constantly dropping WiFi, along with missing Kimono Robes, led to a day's credit (granted without too much grumbling). The machine-gunned oil drum sculpture outside the statue of a journalist killed here 40 years ago is a bit out-of-place even in a culture that allows guns to be carried by everyone (particularly at this point in time) including a few mentally ill types. The room we had - 320 - has only a small unopenable window, so it felt a bit like a jail cell despite the attractive wall art. The $15 "resort fee" (access to the pool, the munchies, and a few other things) was also a surprise, and it is stupid, since it's mandatory, and distorts the price by making it appear $15 cheaper than it is, which is, frankly, insulting to customers' intelligence. Overall, it's a nice place, but they might want to think about why Holiday Inn used to be so attractive: Despite being bland, the slogan was "No surprises." There were too many surprises here, many unpleasant, but if The Clarendon makes some changes, they'll be both gently quirky AND enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel... very loud party going on.”
Reviews.Author: travelbrain3343
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good part. This is my second time staying at this hotel and I love that they have remodeled this building into an extremely unique hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when I had a question (I will come back to this later). The room was spacious, comfortable and fairly clean. The restaurant is great and has a menu that you will not find in any "run of the mill" Mexican restaurant. In order to fairly give you the not so great portion of my review, I will give you the reason why I was is Phoenix and why I decide to stay at the Clarendon. I drove to Phoenix (5 hours) to visit my grandmother who was in the nearby hospital recovering from major brain surgery. I had my mind set on staying at this hotel because of my experience in the past and it was close to the hospital where my Grammy was. When I arrived, tired from my travels, I noticed a lot of activity in the lobby of the hotel. I did not ask why there was so much activity because I was anxious to drop off my belongings and get over to Good Samaratan hospital to visit Grammy. I ask for directions to the hospital which were given to me by a very nice front desk employee and departed for the hospital. When I returned to the hotel at 8 pm there was a rather large party going on in the pool area with many people and a DJ. This was a Saturday night and this seems to be a hotspot for nightlife. When I returned to the room my door was not shut and after further investigation the latch seemed to be faulty. I would not have been to worried about this until I realized the amount of par tiers so near to my door, I also had a laptop and iPad sitting on the desk that could have easily been lifted. I really don't mind that they were having a party since this seems to be the way this hotel makes money on occasion, but, it would have been nice if the front desk employees let me know that this was going on, especially since I told them why I was in town. The party didn't go on all night and I was able to fall asleep before it had end (I am not woken up easily). In closing, I would say that this is a great place to stay if you are traveling with friends or a loved one that is interested in a little excitement. I would not recommend the Clarendon if you are visiting and ailing family member. If I use this hotel again, I will make sure that I ask questions when a roadie with a 15" speaker walks through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to sterile corporate hotelia”
Reviews.Author: incyst
Reviews.Content: This was a refreshing change from the same old same old hotel. There was personality from the time I opened the front door. I especially enjoyed the beautiful pool design and water wall. The lobby and rooftop were both buzzing with activity, and it appeared as though this is also a hip local hangout as well as a favorite traveler''s destination. Minor issues with my room were attended to in record time, and I was impressed with how the service staff took care to use my name when helping me out. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great food, great bed, good room....”
Reviews.Author: azrayne10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night after an all day meeting in PHX, not wanting to make the 3 hour drive home that afternoon. I had investigated the property prior to arriving so I was looking forward to my stay. The on-site restraurant lived up to my expectations. Happy hour specials included $5 all wines, $1 off all tacos (they range from $2-$3 ea), and reduced prices on appetizers. Completely enjoyed the food! Staff was ok, not very friendly, more concerned with gossiping between themselves about weather someone working with them was gay or not. I don't care, but don't talk about it so everyone has to hear the conversation. Loved the bed!! It was so very comfortable and I was surprised when I woke up that it was after 7am. I never sleep so long. Thank you for that. Great tv for unwinding with wonderful channel line-up. Was disappointed with the Wi-FI. It kept disconnecting trying to switch to different wi-fi networks all evening and the following morning. Was very frustrated with this as I was hoping to get some work done in the evening and then the following morning. Wished the room had a clock in the room, I hate waking up and not knowing what time it is. The room was also missing the hairdryer and I had to wait at least 30 minutes before one got to me. Loved the shower products a nice change from the cheap stuff they usually use in hotels. Aveeda products smell awesome!! Wish that I could have taken a hot shower in the morning. The water temp never got hot, it stayed lukewarm. Goose bumps through the entire shower. Was really upset about that. But, despite the few negatives stated here, the pool was awesome, the on-site food was awesome, the bed over the top awesome and I will stay here again if I, looking to stay in PHX again. Bear Down Ben!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun, uber hip but informal”
Reviews.Author: Bircharama
Reviews.Content: We stayed for New Years Eve and had a great time. The hotel is v stylish; the decor might not be to everyone's taste (although I loved it) but at least it's unique. The staff on the desk cam across as a little too cool for school on occasion but they were perfectly friendly and helpful. The little extras are great - free snacks and coke after 10pm. The rooms we had was one that hadn't been refurbished yet judging by the bathroom, which was very clean, but a little worn, but overall the quirky decor, cleanliness and funky blinds (plus a massive plasma TV with loads of channels!) were great, and the bed was divine - they use some special orthopaedic mattress I think. Really cool sound machine alarm clock too. We tried the mexican food downstairs and it was yummy. Overall, enjoyed our stay very much and when the hotel gets done up all over I bet it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to arrive at the Clarendon after a long drive from San Diego and felt very welcomed by the friendly receptionist. The Clarendon is a breath of fresh air from chain hotels and the little touches of an independent hotel were much appreciated (such as Aveda toiletries and a real hairdryer!). The $15 "resort fee" is great value, and includes a free evening snack bar (much appreciated after our long trip!) as well as wi-fi and free local and international calls. We loved being able to call our family in Australia without worrying about the cost. The only downside to our stay was that our room seemed to be quite noisy, including the window rattling in it's frame throughout the night, which woke me up a few times. I was too tired to follow this up at the time. The pool area and rooftop deck looked great, and it was a shame we didn't have the opportunity to use these on our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wish the hotel looked as good in person as it did on the website”
Reviews.Author: travel12389
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the hotel via the internet because it lloked like a beautiful, trendy hotel. Although the hotel looked great on-line, in person it looked run down and dingy. The area in downtown where the hotel is located is also not the best area. We ended up cancelling our reservation and booking another hotel in Scottsdale. I wish the hotel looked as good in person as it did on its website!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on a Long Trip”
Reviews.Author: Downsouthdave
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an oasis of excellence in a long cross-country trip punctuated by mediocre to disgusting overnight stays. The Clarendon stood out from the crowd so distinctly that we stayed an extra day in Phoenix just to savor all the amenities of this boutique hotel. At first the service fee hit me in the face, but you get a LOT for it. Free parking, snack bar, turn down, free internet, bottled water, and on and on. You'd spend more than the service fee for even half of what it includes. Go for it! A good many hotels hit you with, "Oh by the way, parking is $XX a night" - and every little thing adds to the bill. Not at the Clarendon. Best night's stay on the whole trip - best value, too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: susanjane_10
Reviews.Content: I found the Clarendon to be a wonderful hotel for business or leisure. The suites are beautiful, and the beds are the best! Never slept so well!

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic ecstatic romantic hip and just right there”
Reviews.Author: jessicanne08
Reviews.Content: I JUST ADORE THIS PLACE!!! I live in the city and it's still a great place to go have drinks, lounge by the pool, or hang out on the rooftop and listen to good music. Couldnt be better :)

Reviews.Title: “Great low-key stylish place - I liked The Clarendon”
Reviews.Author: duessitussi
Reviews.Content: This place is lovely, cozy and inexpensive - just the opposiote of boring chain-hotels. I like The Clarendon in Phoenix, AZ very much: they have a cool pool with a huge hot tub, the design is very tasteful, the staff is friendly and helpful. There is a yummy Mexican-themend rastaurant, cool music everywhere, the rooms are spacy and comfortable. Don't expect it to be luxurous (the baths are a bit old), but it is fantastic value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Clarendon. My room was really spacious, although I passed others that looked smaller. comfy bed and linens. Staff is super friendly. The restaurant on site is DELICIOUS. The pool and the rooftop deck are the best parts. The gym was horrible. really the worst I have seen in a long time. tons of equipment, but it was all about 20 years old. or older! stay here if you want to eat good and lounge by the pool or enjoy the rooftop deck, dont if you must get in a great workout!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting property but beware of extra fees.”
Reviews.Author: this_is_me96
Reviews.Content: I always look for independent hotels that are going to offer more of an experience than the big corporate generated properties so was excited to try the clarendon. At check-in the staff was friendly but I was horrified by the $15 service fee that I could not opt out of. They said it was to cover my parking, internet, and pool use as well as a glass of wine at check-in and chips or sodas at night. In AZ parking should be free, pool use should always be free for guests and its hard to find a hotel in the u.s. that charges for internet but even then you don't pay for it unless you want it...this is a cheap tactic employed by the hotel to raise the price of the room under your nose. I say just charge 15 extra and be an all inclusive hotel, then at least we know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Locally owned modern treasure for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: bigpurplepeopleeater
Reviews.Content: First thing was as i got to the front desk they offered me wine, red or white, while they checked me in, the service staff is warm and dedicated to giving you a great experience, now the hotel itself is a treasure, locally owned, an older building renovated to post-modern style: beautiful pool area, incredible rooftop bar, comfy bed, big LCD tvs, modern amenities, great restaurant, close to the metro, hoppin' nightlife on the weekends, free mini-bar (candy, snacks, soda) at night, and so much more...every time i go to phoenix, this is where i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Southwest casual glamour”
Reviews.Author: gregorypeebles
Reviews.Content: When we travel to Phoenix my colleagues and I always look forward to staying at the Clarendon. The friendly staff, the pool, the delicious food in the restaurant, and the fun rooms make us feel like we're on vacation even though we're at work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Winning415
Reviews.Content: Lovely. Good food downstairs, beautiful pool, and easy to get to and from.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit? Just as awesome as the first. Loved every minute at the Clarendon.”
Reviews.Author: benjonesnyc
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is a gem in the desert of Arizona. From the outside, it's unassuming and blasé. But once you're inside, it's a mecca of hip but relaxed comfort, food and ambiance. The staff is amazing and the accommodations are pristine. Large suites, great views from the rooftop patio, and amazing cuisine in the Gallo Blanco Restaurant make this a perfect place to either unwind or conduct business with important clients. We stop in every year.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be hip but missing some of the basics”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMac
Reviews.Content: At just under $140 per night, it was about 30% more expensive than the Radisson around the corner but did not present itself nearly as well. Although I called ahead and requested an earlier check-in, I had to wait 45 minutes for the room to be readied and did not get in until 2:30. When I entered the room, the maid was still finishing. It was obvious she had not vacuumed. I picked up four different pieces of garbage from the desk, coffee table and floor. Amazingly, the maid came back twice between mid-afternoon and bedtime to remake the bed! Why I have no idea. I'd rather she had vacuumed! lol The carpets in the foyer and elsewhere show signs of wear (a lot of staining) and sections of the exterior have paint peeling off the surfaces. The roof deck needs a barrier to block the view of the mechanicals that cover the non-decked area. (The Saturday morning yoga class on the roof did not happen.) The independently run restaurant serves better than average food but unfortunately doesn't open for breakfast until 8 which is late for those of us catching an early flight. Front desk staff didn't seem to know the area and directed us to a coffee shop far from the hotel when in fact two other outlets of the same chain were closer. A friend left a message on the telephone in my room but the phone gave no indication (flashing light) that it was there, and to the best of my knowledge it wasn't. Don't get me wrong. I was basically satisfied with my stay, but the impression the hotel leaves is that it is trying to be hip/different but just doesn't have the money to keep up with the wear and tear. The owner needs to ensure the basics are in place before dreaming of building the spa that is talked about as coming in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Truth in Service!”
Reviews.Author: mh999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with a friend who was visiting on business from Canada. She was very concerned about bedbugs and asked several times about them (she'd just come from a trip to NYC). The staff was wonderful in handling her concerns---in fact, she learned that the owner of the hotel's MOTHER had just come on staff to head up HOUSEKEEPING in order to really caretake this and any other potential housekeeping problem. Now, how often does THAT happen? We had a very enjoyable stay at this lively, interesting, friendly hotel. There is a little bit of magic here---people are all "working right." Thank you for the comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: JohnMatthew69
Reviews.Content: Lovely, good looking, great design, locally owned, kind (and good looking) people. Great pool. Had a great time and am particularly appreciative of the affordable parking, wireless, free printing in the lobby, etc. Great stuff. The lower stars on here are just nitpicky peeps. Good mattress and awesome service. BEST location too.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice, but”
Reviews.Author: btv3
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived in my room, I noticed there was hair in the bathtub that was also stained. The next day I left my room at 6am and returned after 5pm. I found that my room had still not been made up. I called down to the front desk and asked for my room to be made up. They said they would send someone right up. I left my room to allow easy access for the housekeeper and noticed a housekeeping cart down the hall. I returned an hour later and noticed that while the housekeeping cart was no longer there, my room was still not made up. After additional phone calls my room was finally cleaned. At the pool I noticed several cigarette butts littering the area, even though the pool is posted no smoking. When a front desk staff member was out in the pool area, one guest lit a cigarette in front of her. Rather than asking him to put the cigarette out, she simply said hi to him. At the same time there were a group of people in the pool drinking a pitcher of beer. This did not create a pleasant environment to be in. I left a note asking to be contacted by the manager and never received a reply. I would not recommend this hotel for families or anyone looking for a relaxing getaway. The restaurant on the main floor had good food at a reasonable price. The service at the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible locally owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyWerk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on business. Fantastic staff, comfy beds and amazing rooftop lounge. Complimentary glass of wine at check-in was a nice touch. Overall it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Smaller Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: eandjwein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Clarendon. The first night was quite satisfactory. The building has obviously been around for awhile, but the rooms were nicely updated with designer touches and a nice flat screen TV. The turn-down service person came by shortly after we checked in was very good at supplying a few extras we wanted. We were not able to use the pool on this visit but it looked inviting and the pool furniture appeared comfortable. There is a nice waterfall in that area and a very large jacuzzi at one end. The restaurant looked like it was doing good business and many customers appeared to be locals. In all honesty, we had some problems on the second night of our stay there. However, we were contacted at home by the owner of the hotel, Ben, and he assured us he was not happy either and would be addressing our issues with his staff. We believe everyone is entitled to have an off day every once in a while, and we just happened to catch one at the Clarendon on our second day. We are very impressed with Ben and wish him success.

Reviews.Title: “room with style”
Reviews.Author: unhipcat
Reviews.Content: Work suggested a chain hotel. I looked online and found the Clarendon nearby. Clean, comfortable room. View of open courtyard and pool. Rooftop bar with view of city and mountains, very nice around sunset. Great little bar with good microbrew selection next to the lobby, with good restaurant attached. Friendly staff. Convenient location Reminds me of Jupiter Hotel in Portland and the Motor Lodge in Prescott. Places with a little style, not the run-of-the-mill rooms in most hotels. Recommend highly. I'll definitely stay there my next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown's Best”
Reviews.Author: MLarson61
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarendon Hotel on September 25, 2010. Still hot as Hades in Phoenix, so we were thrilled with the sub-zero air conditioning and the awesome 42" flat screeen TV. Check- in was seamless and staff was extremely knowledgable about the area. We took the light rail (a 5 minute walk from hotel) to Sun Devil Stadium as recommended by staff. Room was clean and well apportioned. Plenty of towels and great hot shower with plenty of water pressure. We will stay again and will recommend to all our friends and family. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Suite room was spacious and clean...”
Reviews.Content: Suite room was spacious and clean restaurant had healthy choices and great happy hour. They have covered parking great for summertime heat only thing they have loud functions on weekends on rooftop and pool area. Music was just too loud hotel rooms all open to the outside, old style.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were fantastic, service was wonderful, amenities were...out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: AuntTeeQuilts
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Clarendon was long, long ago. Different age, different owners. Over the years I've seen this property evolve into the shining gem it is now. When in Phoenix, and our travel budget says yes, we're all about staying at the Clarendon and enjoying the "down time" after working long days. Thanks to Ben and his staff, it's THE place to stay when in the Big City.

Reviews.Title: “This has become my home away from home while in Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: aemarr
Reviews.Content: My admin set me up in this boutique hotel last spring and I have been more than happy to return as a guest twice since then, The Clarendon is central and close to good eats, night life, and cultural venues. My rooms were all spacious, cool, and artsy with large flat screen TVs/good wi-fi/i-Pod docking stations. Also, as a bodybuilder their in-house gym rates as one of the best I have seen anywhere- and I've pumped hotel iron on 4 continents- they squeeze a LOT of equipment into a small but very well laid out space. Their pool and whirlpool area is very hip and a good place to relax tired muscles and to watch people. Lastly, the Gallo Blanco restaurant, attached to the hotel, serves healthy, excellent, and locally sourced food. The hotel staff has been almost universally helpful, congenial, and responsive to my particular needs and requests . I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun, cool, and with a great restaurant - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JohnJSmallwood
Reviews.Content: My wife came across this interesting hotel online, and we were really glad she did. Everything was fun, interesting, and just right. The rooms are spacious, with extra large flat screen TVs. The wireless internet was strong and worked perfectly. The towels were large, fluffy, and absorbant. Accommodations were just fine and everything felt right. The restaurant serves very tasty Mexican food (not New Mexican). Try the guacamole - it's just about the best we've ever had. The restaurant is full of young people having fun, and it's obviously a hip place to be. We went to see some D-Back games, and the hotel was 10 minutes from the park. Stay here - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business or the mature, but if young, hip or gay then try it!”
Reviews.Author: aboyernc1
Reviews.Content: This is an old motel casually remodeled into boutique style on a budget. It is clean the staff curteous, but you are basically in a cinder block room with bare amenities and rolling plywood sheets (adorned with hand painted artwork) for window covers. MAjority of rooms open into the main center courtyard or pool, although some rooms have interior corrider access. Wireless access points abound. I arrived around 4PM and my "suite" wasnot ready, they (or she) was still cleaning. Free bottled water in room, but ice comes from front desk. The staff really was good and a turn down service replenished the rooms at dinner time. The rooftop bar/garden is OK, but is also home to lots of individual air handlers. Although it is a great place to sit with a drink from the bar and watch the sun set! The pool is small but adequate. The restaurant is terrific. The style of Mexican food being served can satisfy the small or large apetite and the menu is creative. The variety of Margaritas are endless. Weekend nights the restaurant and lobby becomes a bar, even had a very bad DJ one night while I was there. Not for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff!”
Reviews.Author: PDXgirl4life
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and Restaurant/Bar staff is amazing, friendly and easy to talk with. I enjoyed my stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “LIKE STAYING AT A ROCKY POINT HOTEL ON SPRING BREAK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShayTucson
Reviews.Content: Horendous. These people need to decide if they want a hotel or bar. Everynight 20 something people all over drinking and picking up eachother. They let people come off the street to use the pool and drink for $10. Drunken people all over. Yelling. There was a big party in a room down from mine with people yelling, slamming doors and smoking, smoke made its way to my room. supposed to be a non smoking hotel. They evicted these people but too late for me no sleep. I was there for a medical conference. When I cam in Saturday night the pool was full with people who were not staying there. as I walked to my room a room with cutains open showed a girl in a swim suit getting it on with a guy in her room. The hotel is old and reallt needs some work like the plain concrete floor in the lobby. It is not boutique chic!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky & Fresh”
Reviews.Author: lilchef1007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the last night of our vacation, as we returned from other places to catch a D-Backs game and our flight home. Even the exterior of the hotel looked funky, with the unevenly spaced stripes. We all loved the pool & hot tub (though the tub could have been hotter), with the glowing stars, underwater music and changing colors. The rooms are hip and inviting, in an informal "ikea" way. The staff was very nice and helpful. All in all, a great value just minutes from the heart of downtown Phoenix. It's very cool that the owners have given new life to what was, I'm sure, a sad property when they bought it. BTW, if you stay, or if you are in the area, have a meal at the restaurant in the lobby, Gallo Blanco. It was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I've stayed in while in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: mmeyer26
Reviews.Content: I have been to Phoenix a number of times because my son went completed his undergraduate and law degrees there. I wish I had been staying at the Clarendon during more of these trips. I cannot say enough good things about my time there. The bedroom had a remote control a/c unit so the Phoenix summer was not a problem.
