Also, there was an empty mini fridge in my room, so I was able to put my own beverages in there and not pay charges for overpriced candies. The flat panel tv in my room and the pool go unmatched in Phoenix. The rooms were quiet, but there was a DJ near the pool, which seemed like a lot of fun. Next time I stay in Phoenix, I will definitely be staying at the Clarendon! -M. Meyer

Reviews.Title: “Gal pal weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SuzannePhx2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Clarendon with my adult daughters. It was a perfect venue from which to hit the First Fridays Artwalk, the Farmers' Market, and a Diamondbacks game. My daughters loved the pool, the funky furnishings in the room, and the rooftop bar. Kudos to this locally-owned and operated boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to meet people and hang out”
Reviews.Author: DesignEye
Reviews.Content: You can't help but relax and enjoy yourself at The Clarendon. Poolside, rooms, the folks that come by. The rooftop, the residents of Phoenix who hang out here... this is the place to stay if you like to socialize when you travel. Or if you live in Phoenix, to chill by the pool and have a drink. The service is good, it's unique and clean. Has a great story too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to get away- My first review ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kirtwell
Reviews.Content: My GF and I wanted a place to go for the weekend. We found this place online and decided to try it. The place seemed a little older than in the pictures...HOWER! It was a nice little place. They upgraded us to a suite..it was late 80's decor but it was clean and had everything we needed. I like the pool and hotbub...we spent the majority of our time in the pool area as did many people...it was fun....... and the resturant had great food...reasonalbly priced. We had a great time and would definately go back..

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - and lack of management follow up”
Reviews.Author: grosk063
Reviews.Content: Wrote the following email to the management of this hotel on May 5th after our stay in early May. We were promised a prompt reply to our email. Now, more than a month later, we still have not heard anything. I normally do not write feedback on Tripadvisor. However, this will now go out to the tripadvisor community, so you can make up your own mind about this hotel. Here is our email to management: Hi, I usually do not leave feedback for hotels, but thought different in this instance due to the fact that you do seem to be an owner that do care about your business. I also travel to Phoenix fairly often for business, and may consider coming back if some of the issues mentioned below are changed. Overall, we were pleased with many things about your hotel. But there are things you have to address in order to continue being successful long term in my opinion. This time my business partner and I brought our girlfriends on the trip, and with this in mind, I will give you some feedback directly, as opposed to putting it up on tripadvisor. I think it's easy to bash businesses on tripadvisor. I would rather deal with this directly with you, so you do not receive a bad rating on this (which bottom line I believe our overall experience does warrant). Our reservation was for two nights. If I did not happen to look at my paperwork when checking in, we would have only had the room for one night, since this is what the clerk put us in for. She fixed this on the spot (blamed the computer system), but I believe this may have cost us down the road, since we had to move rooms so they could accommodate our two nights instead of one. We dropped off our luggage real quick in the room, and went to the roof top bar to catch the sunset. You have a great set up there. Friendly bartender from Denver too. We also dined in your restaurant that night. Top notch service, drinks, and food. Also had a few drinks in the bar after that, same experience. After that, went to bed, great beds by the way. Your carpet is stained though in room 308 though. Not sure what was in there, but it was not a good first impression for us when we first opened the door. Looks like you can fix this with the type of square carpets you have smartly put in. Got woken up at 5:15am in the morning by the ipod player in the room. Previous guest must have set this alarm. Had no idea how to turn it off, so unplugged it in the dark. But five minutes later it started again. So turned on the light, and figured out how to turn it off. By then it was hard to go back to sleep. Suggestion: Have your maid make sure ipod alarms are not on for future guests. Minor details, but I believe this should be standard in any maid education. We realized when we woke up that we did not have any robes, extra pillows, only two small towels and one big one, and no ironing board. Batteries in the remote control did not work either. One would imagine this is standard in all rooms (from what we could see through the windows in other rooms), so we went downstairs to get this fixed. No problem, friendly service, they would take care of it. However, eight hours later when we returned, we still did not have this taken care of. No idea what happened, must have fallen through the cracks. Not good for a hotel that does try to compete with other nicer hotels. In addition, when we got back to our room, we realized it had not been cleaned. We did have the "do not disturb" sign up while my girlfriend was taking a shower in the morning, but that was it. When I called down, I was told the cleaners "finished early today, and are not here anymore". Huh?? This is below par service for a two star hotel, let alone someone at your standard. The turn down service guy did give us extra towels and did take care of getting the ironing board and robes. Props to him for that. But still.....wow.....this needs to be fixed for other guests. There worst part was not even an option available. We were just going to "have to deal with it" kind of attitude with your front desk, who also put me on hold for five minutes before I just decided to call back. We spent some time in the hot tub in the early evening Saturday night. Nice work on this. Looks great. Also, nice pool party with DJ on Sunday. Really enjoyed this. Your pool side waitress gave us lemon juice though when we ordered a margarita at one point. When we asked the inside bartender about this, she quickly fixed this and mixed us a real margarita. No idea what happened here. But happy to report this got fixed. When checking out I told the front desk person I was not going to pay for the extra service charges. Told her I was not comfortable with this, considering we did not in any way receive resort level service this weekend. She did not like this, but finally agreed to take these charges off. In my opinion, this should have been taken off, no questions asked. I could probably have gotten a full refund for all charges, including the room, at places like the Hampton Inn or Hilton down the street. So, there you have it. I would never leave a message like this with a chain hotel. I would just not come back if I was not happy. Being an entrepreneur myself, I see the value that you bring to the table, and want to give you some constructive feedback to help your business. As I said, we fly into Phoenix pretty often. We may consider coming back if some of these issues are fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Super fun and kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: hippychick73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get the kids (11,3 and 1 1/2) out of the house and heard the pool at the Clarendon was the place to go! We stayed in a King Suite behind the waterfall on the bottom floor. The room was bigger than I expected and the bed was so amazing to sleep in! I think at one point we were all in at the same time with room to spare! There is a GIGANTIC flat screen in the bedroom and a bar area in the "living room" with a fridge and coffee maker. Plenty of room for the kids and I never felt crowded. They played all day at the pool and had a blast. Very fun and happening atmosphere for all ages! The waterfall is so beautiful to look at and the tile around the pool is very colorful. Not just your average boring pool tile. For dinner we ate at Gallo Blanco. The food was better than expected. I am a Mexican food junkie and not easily impressed. We had the ceviche, guacamole and beef tacos; all amazing! When the kids were asleep with the nanny we made our way to the rooftop bar. Very laid back and such a nice breeze up there. You can look down on the pool and see these star lights, it's really cool! We lounged at the jacuzzi for a bit and drunk in the peacefulness of the evening. For breakfast we ordered pancakes for the kids and burritos for us. Pancakes were inhaled and burros were perfect. Took the kids to the pool for a bit before nap time and relaxed on the outdoor beds. All in all it was a great experience and the kids had fun which is super important to us. We will definitely be heading back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: bekah623
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to The Clarendon for his 30th birthday. We actually live in town but really wanted to get away for the weekend. It was the best weekend we have had since our honeymoon. The hotel was beautiful and very modern and clean. We enjoyed the pool as well as the atmosphere on the roof top. The rooms were very well designed and I found myself never wanting to get out bed because I was so comfortable! I have already planned two more staycations for my husband and I and have been telling everyone that I know about the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Mid-town Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: abbietravels
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at The Clarendon over the weekend so that we might enjoy some downtown Phoenix fun and I have to say, the time spent at the hotel was the highlight! Definitely a unique laid-back and fun atmosphere and a great value! Our favorite things.... -Extremely friendly and cool staff (helped us locate some late-night snacks) -Delicious Sangria at the bar -The most comfortable beds and pillows EVER -Awesome outdoor beds/ lounge chairs by the pool -Walking distance to the Light Rail (for restaurant/bar access) -Free parking

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MaiaWailana
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix on business and I stayed at the Clarendon from Sunday to Wednesday - I love this place! There is a sense of arrival and relaxation in the middle of the city. The pool offered a place to relax and enjoy some cocktails. The culture is trendy and chic. The restaurant Gallo Blanco offered a welcoming atmosphere. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally attentive and they were at our beck and call. The staff at Gallo Blanco - God bless them - they are great! There are so many places to eat - but if you want a great Mexican Cuisine - don't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Ask and ye shall receive!”
Reviews.Author: johnmontagna
Reviews.Content: Firstly: let's talk about Gallo Blanco, the restaurant in the Clarendon. Some of the most delicious Mexican food ever, served up by a courteous, friendly, and good-looking staff. Reasonably priced as well. But here's the real reason I'm writing this review: It's a Saturday afternoon, and I'm chilling in the lobby with some friends. A few hours later, I notice that my expensive sunglasses are missing. Last place I remember having them? The lobby. I stupidly left them sitting on the big coffee table. I ask a woman at the front desk if there's a lost and found; she checks it, and there's no sunglasses there. I search all my bags; no sunglasses. I go back to the front desk, where I meet Ben, the manager. I desperately ask if there's "another lost and found" in the hotel. He quickly offers to review the lobby security camera tape from the time I was there, to see if anyone recovered them Then he gives me his card, and says to email him if I need anything else. I go upstairs and turn my room upside down; no sunglasses. Back downstairs I mention this to Ben; he says "Hmmm...wait here a minute," and goes into the office. Comes back a minute later, asks me to describe the sunglasses, which I do. That's when he hands them over, saying that they were somewhere else in the office and not in the lost and found. A hotel manager willing to review a security camera tape to help recover a pair of lost sunglasses? Never heard of a big chain doing that! For the most part, The Clarendon is definitely a place for dazzling urbanites and hipsters to hook up: very trendy-looking, slightly funky (rooms could be a little cleaner and better maintained), but the staff will go the extra mile for you when asked. And the rooftop lounge offers a fine view of the city at night. Would definitely look to stay here again next time I'm in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Boutique Hotel with the Friendliest Service"”
Reviews.Author: macstraits
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight so I could leave early to get to the airport. I've stayed here before and will again and again. The beds are wonderfully comfortable and the staff is always alert and ready to take care of your every need. New turn-down service is really appreciated, you almost never find this at an independently owned boutique hotel. The adjoining restaurant has great early morning breakfasts and a patio to enjoy the early morning hours. The extra large hottub is wonderful and the waterwall is so relaxing. This will always be my hotel of choice in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “They've double charged my credit card and haven't solved it a month later!”
Reviews.Author: CMMurray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on March 28th. When we checked in, two lights weren't working which made it pitch black in the bathroom. The caretaker was not on site so we had to move our stuff to another room. The guy at the front desk said, "I'm sorry, but you booked on Hotwire so we can't give you any kind of discount". I understand that, but no discount in the restaurant (which we gave our dinner and breakfast business to)? The stay was.... okay. I wanted to like it, but it kind of had that "We're a boutique hotel because we're sparse and paint the walls crazy colour feel" rather than "We're a boutique hotel because we're actually really nice and unique". The worst part... As mentioned, I booked this trip on Hotwire so it was pre-paid in January. A few weeks after coming home, I find on my statement that the hotel has charged me $103.38 for who knows what!! Since then, I've left two messages with their accounting department with no response. It may have been a simple error, but I would expect them to clear it up much sooner. All in all, this stay was full of inconveniences (including a major financial one yet to be settled) that nobody has offered to compensate me for. The restaurant was good, though.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: cjc65
Reviews.Content: This was the most horrible hotel I have ever stayed at. I would equate it to a Super 8 or Motel 6. This hotel is extremely over priced. I found it to be filthy, especially the roof patio and the bathrooms in the main lobby. The decor was terrible. This hotel did not even have a formal sign on the outside, the sign was a banner hanging on the building. We had a refrigerator in our room that didn't work. We called the front desk and reported it, however, no one ever came to fix it. If you are considering this hotel, don't.

Reviews.Title: “does not reflect website”
Reviews.Author: rknMontreal
Reviews.Content: I selected the Clarendon having seen their website and liking "boutique" hotels. They have a great photographer and a great web guy. I was not pleased with what I saw when I arrived. The hotel has many rough edges. I like "industrial " bare walls and concrete... but not economy industrial, unfinished/broken industrial. For every upscale touch (great bed, linens, ammenities, TV), there was a downside, ripped garage sale furniture, ill fitting doors and exposed wires. I like " indie" but there was a slightly seedy undercurrent that had me considering a move. Having said all that, the restaurant suffers the same decor but has wonderful food...highly recommended. So if you go, just do not expect it to be like the site. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, fun hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamontoastgirl
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and myself) stayed at The Clarendon one night for a friend's on-site wedding. The positives: great location-right on the light rail line, walking distance/ quick light rail ride to good non-chain eats and bars, awesome hotel pool with a hip, young crowd (pool closes before midnight, so you get your beauty sleep..) good on-site bar/restaurant, comfy beds, well-appointed rooms with fashionable decor, nice toiletries, lots of public areas for gathering and visiting, including outdoor areas, great PHX views the negatives: no extra pillows in the room; we were only given two standard sized pillows for a king bed, and there wasn't an extra in the closet (I know, I could have asked, but it was late when I realized it, and I didn't want to bother the desk). window shade didn't completely close flat over the window, so super bright morning light comes streaming on in the sides. If there is activity outside, you hear it (thin walls). Small bathroom with little counter space. Expensive if you're paying rack rate ( we had a "group rate" which made this hotel a great deal) the negatives are minor. I'd happily stay here again, and would recommend this hotel. This would be an especially great hotel if you're traveling for business or with a conference, and you're on the younger side, and want to have some fun while you're in Phx. You can get around via light rail easily, the hotel pool and bar attract their own fun crowd, and there are hip restaurants right around here.

Reviews.Title: “Treated me like royality.”
Reviews.Author: Fibersprite
Reviews.Content: The service is superb. Staff very good. Any request was handled immediately. Pool and hot tub (it's huge) were great. Beds very comfy. Restaurant inside hotel had wonderful organic/local food. The hotel is slightly off the beaten path which was nice...no busy/noisy street to deal with and/or listen to.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTVL
Reviews.Content: This is very out of the way, of the beat and path hotel. It is not in downtown Phoenix as its website indicated. Was extremely disappointed with the quality if the clientele that stay at the hotel. First off, there is a very loud disco on the roof which can be very annoying especially since I arrived after a 16 hour international flight and just wanted to sleep in a quite room. Also, it caters to a less than professional clientele and I witnessed bath-house like behavior which was less than appropriate. And, the hotel's restaurant uses a wood fired grill and the smoke exhausted just under my window so my room and all of my clothing smelt like a campfire. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Renovation but a few faults remaining”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: This is a recently renovated and re-branded "boutique" hotel. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The hotel's restaurant and bar appear very popular, which in Phoenix means they are good. Many people came to the restaurant and bar during the evening who were not staying in the hotel, another sign that they are good. A bit noisy but the noise doesn't make its way to the rooms. There is a very nice pool area. The jacuzzi is one of the largest I have ever seen. A very nice thing about it is that it's in a central courtyard and protected from the weather and the sun. I guess you could call the decor "retro 60's." Attractive and stark in a good way. My room was very spacious and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable. The furniture was well-placed and useful. Good toiletries in the bath. Good lighting. Great TV. Everything was very clean and well-maintained. For most of us the primary reason for staying in a hotel is to have a comfortable sleep. I have 3 basic requirements for that: comfortable bed, quiet and dark. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately you can hear people in the hall quite well and room doors opening and closing, until very late. And the room was far from dark for sleeping. The window had two shades .... one for filtering light and one for "blackout." However the blackout shade did not block light from outside. The door to the room lacked weather-stripping to block light as well as cushion the closing to prevent noise. It would be accurate to say that the room doors "slammed" when they closed. And a lot of light came into the room around the edges of the door. I think people who design hotel rooms should have to sleep in them .... particularly at night. And they need to be frequent travelers to understand travelers' needs. The hotel has some rough edges. A glass-sided elevator which gives a view only of concrete blocks and wiring. The elevator's call buttons don't always work and require several tries. An area between the front desk and the bar/restaurant where the block walls are rough and unfinished. Pipes sticking out of the wall in the room where there used to be kitchenettes. The hotel charges a $10 daily fee which was stated by the front desk staff as being for high speed internet and parking. A very nice feature for Phoenix, where your car can bake inside in January, is that most of the parking is covered.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NikkiesPrescottaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend. The pool and spa were perfect. Rooms were clean and well kept. Hotel staff couldn't do enough to make our stay great. The food, atmosphere and staff at the new restaurant were the best. Loved every minute of it and can't wait to go back. Thanks Clarendon for helping to make our mini vaca perfect

Reviews.Title: “Our Coolness Factor Increased After Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: whereisjennifer
Reviews.Content: With all the traveling we do, I have to say that this hotel was a funky breath of fresh air in a big, big world of relatively unmemorable mid-market hotel offerings. The Clarendon probably isn't for everyone (e.g., perhaps, the older set), but we enjoyed the fruits of some very creative and talented decorating/designing minds. The first impression, from the exterior, is of an old 70s apartment building with a colorful paint job, but stepping inside, our eyes got a little big and we felt like we'd landed in a cool corner of Hollywood. None of this, frankly, is a real priority to us (traveling with a toddler), but nonetheless, the real art on the walls (most of which appeared to be for sale), the funky wallpaper, creative light fixtures, & other unique design touches, the awesome rooftop bar, and the extremely friendly staff all made for a truly pleasureable stay. The pool area is surely the centerpiece of the hotel, with a gorgeously & colorfully tiled walkable divider between the 'cool pool' and the very spacious 'hot pool'. The backdrop to all this was some very modern and diverse pool furniture, and a stunning 'wall of water', fronted by cacti. The night we were there, there was also flamenco on the rooftop (only until 9pm, which suited us fine). Our room was the 2-room suite, ground level, poolside, and we had no noise concerns, but perhaps that was partly a function of our midweek stay, as I could see the pool being a real hotspot on the weekends. Our unit was spacious, the bed comfortable, and the interior decor made the best that can be done with an older building, adding character and a feeling that a real person, a real COOL person, designed the room and decor. Not fancy at all, but fun and different. Front desk service couldn't have been nicer. we also appreciated the computer out front where we could print boarding passes. Overall, a refreshing and unique visit at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Ideal for the price”
Reviews.Author: GJPort
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, we booked for 3 nites. Our room was the Executive Room, sort of a jr. suite. Nice, attractive room, but didn't have much furniture (1 desk chair for small desk, 1 lounge chair) for the space provided. A small comfy sofa would have easily fit into the room to better enjoy the nice flat screen TV. So, if we were to stay again, we would save a few dollars and take the regular room. If more space is really needed, go for the 2-room suite. All the services were fine. Front desk was helpful, the internet worked perfectly, and the lite rail was just a couple blocks away. The pool was quite nice, as was the hot soaking pool. And we liked that it was open late in the eve. The fitness center was nicely furnished with quality equipment. The restaurant, which I understand is under separate ownershp (as is the roof top bar) is pretty good. But it is noisy in the eve when busy. The food (dinner and breakfast) was quite tasty. A hint for lunch, suggest going by lite rail or car to the Heard Museum's cafe which we found to be special.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of personality, a great vibe with history & a really great pool.”
Reviews.Author: Todd C
Reviews.Content: Recently on a week long business trip with 10 other colleagues, this hotel was pre-selected by the Travel Agency. We had associates coming in from as far as London, Chicago, Miami & New York who all agreed that this was a perfect "blend" of hotel for all of us ! It was great, comfortable, very BUSY, and had a boutique ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “wanted to love it but ...”
Reviews.Author: JP39
Reviews.Content: I am a very detail-oriented person, and this hotel falls way down on the details. For every pro there was at least one con, and I ended up being just too annoyed to want to stay here again. Great room, very spacious. Only one robe for 2 people, 2 bath towels (thick as they were), and only 3 pillows. Yes, I can call down for more -- but, really? I expect to have enough in my room. Asked for an extra pillow the next morning, and had to ask again that evening because we didn't get it. Room was cold the first night; the AC unit blows a draft on the bed. It has complicated controls we couldn't figure out (the front desk explained it the next morning, but something actually in the room would have helped a lot, especially since the stop button didn't do anything) and no extra blankets, so we were cold the first night. Lovely sheets on the bed. Light switch by the door turned on the light next to the bed, so when you turn it off at night next to you, the switch doesn't turn anything on the next time you enter the room. Switches were on the cords of the lamps, which were tucked behind the furniture, so you have to pull up the cord each time to turn them on or off, which was irritating. The elevator was broken at least twice -- we gave up and just walked up the stairs each time which was okay except when I was really tired and it was still broken. Walked our luggage down the stairs at the end of our stay. Didn't go to the roof deck, not in the mood to walk two more flights to see it. The extra $10 fee is ridiculous; they should just add it onto the room rate since it's not optional. Ate in the restaurant and it was great; recommended twice by people not affiliated with the hotel. The thing that was the last straw for me was that our room was not cleaned one day. Come on, that's a basic! I was furious. We came back late and I called down. The front desk said, "Oh, sorry. Um, housekeeping is gone for the day, but I can bring up some clean towels if you like." Yes. No further apologies. When he brought them up, he offered to take the other towels away, but the bathroom was occupied, so he said I could leave them in the hall. I did, assuming they'd be taken away, but they were still there, in the hallway, the next morning. I would have kept them in my room if I'd realized they'd just be there all night, gross. Told the front desk the next morning that our room hadn't been cleaned and to make sure it was -- no apology at all, he just nodded and made a note in the computer. When I left, I commented on this on the envelope where they want you to leave the tip, which has place for comments, and no one has gotten back to me still. I would not stay here again. Being an independent boutique hotel is no excuse for not enough robes, pillows, and towels in the rooms and especially not for skipping cleaning a room and apparently taking it in stride. I'm still pissed off.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, nice hotel, great manager, needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: Bbkfinn
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical hotel. Modern, cool design, unique rooms, nice pool, rooftop lounge, and hip design. Only problem is it's a little worn down. Needs a touch up to be first rate. Caters to the younger crowd, especially with its pool and rooftop lounge. Actually, in our stay, the rooftop was just a sitting and viewing area. No services. Rooms look cool, but are a little spartan. Nice beds, large flat screen tvs. Staff are nice, and manager, when told my wife and I were on our anniversary, upgraded us to small suite room. That was a nice touch. Restaurant in hotel is good. Overall, nice place, and certainly unique. Would I stay here again? Only if cleaned up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but with hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: eruditetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night, booked online. Generally when booking hotels I look for a safe clean place with reasonable rates and wireless internet. Extra amenities don’t usually interest me. My room was listed at $149 online but found it for $109 through one of the numerous online hotel sites. The hotel is an old building that’s been revamped into a boutique style hotel with modern colors, furniture etc. The room was clean and the area seemed safe. There is a really annoying point that bothered me though. After receiving my room key and handing over my credit card I was given a form to sign saying that I agree to a mandatory $10 daily fee to cover facilities, wireless internet, telephone usage etc.. It basically makes their online rate look more appealing by adding the extra charge on check-in. So if you find this hotel online add $10 to the nightly price. Reviewing there website the $10 charge is listed in tiny print within a very wordy paragraph. What added to my frustration is that the wireless internet was down during our stay and the pool was being drained and serviced so neither were available. There is a bar and restaurant attached that looked nice and pretty hip although I didn’t eat there. The overall look of the hotel was nice. I would probably stay there again if I could find a room available in the $100-110 (including the $10 fee) but it is definitely not a $160 hotel by any means. I assume that others have been surprised by the fee because there are signs posted in the elevator explaining how they charge you an extra $10 a night. It’s not a ton of money, but it would be nice to know the real rate upfront and have the facilities actually in working order.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: matchboxx23
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with the Clarendon. Last minute trip and didnt have a reservation. The hotel staff was very helpful. Loved the rooftop with a great view of the city and the pool! The bed was very comfortable! Will definatly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel with a lot going on!”
Reviews.Author: dag16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for several nights for business in mid feb. the hotel was perfect. the rooms were clean and nice. the pool area was hopping. there was something going on almost every night in the restaurant and bar area (band one night, flamenco dancing another). the food was yummy, the drinks were good. we were able to walk to numerous restaurants and the metro within a mile..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: rob417
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding and rooms were quiet and clean. Could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard, but failing at every turn!”
Reviews.Author: jacksnana
Reviews.Content: Checked into hotel with my 18 mo. old grandson, was told that I had to carry everything by myself as there was only one person on the front desk. After stacking luggage and grandson on luggage cart, was helped into the front door and elevator by other guests. Front desk man simply glared at me. In fact, he glared at me when I requested pool towels the next morning. There were no pool towels, we were brought a damp one and told the rest were in the dryer and would be brought to the pool asap. An hour later at a dirty poolside (catsup on the deck, drink glasses on the tables) no towels. At 1:30 pm requested that room be made up asap so I could put grandson down for a nap. By 3pm had to give up on room cleaning for the needed nap. Never did see housekeeping that day. The requested tub plug was turned down with, "I still don't think we have any of those..." It was ridiculous having to go to the front desk every day for coffee, towels, water, etc. that were not replaced by housekeeping. The room's lighting was a disaster, it was too dark to do anything unless directly under a lamp. The tub re-surfacing was pocked and peeling. The throw on the chair had multiple cigarette holes in it. The smell of paint (with the toxic VOC fumes) permeated our whole stay. Having stayed at "boutique" hotels around the world, this one rates with 1 star on the French scale. I've seen cleaner places in many developing nations. The restaurant was FABULOUS; great service, food and attitude. Too bad it is not a part of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in az”
Reviews.Author: Akitty
Reviews.Content: i love this place! the gm and owner even greets you at the desk! wow. the staff amazing the roof top gorgeous and the rooms GREAT! they had a band staying here while i was here! omg so cool.

Reviews.Title: “still hip but service declined”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: I was here a few years ago and loved it. Since then the lobby and pool area have been updated. Pros: The rooms, staff and clientele are still hip, and that counts for a lot in Phoenix. Pool area is very nice. Adjoining Mexican restaurant and bar are excellent - really fresh, tasty food. Nice amenities and free samples. Cons: Condition of rooms has declined a little. Service declined, also. Though we had arranged for a late check-out, we were awoken at 11 a.m. by the phone and asked to clear our room. (After talking, they re-agreed to the late check-out.) No bathtub plug, and when we requested one they never did find one despite a follow-up call. The jacuzzi was being serviced Saturday when we arrived. We had counted on using this to recover from the flight before a performance - couldn't they clean the jacuzzi on a Tuesday morning or some other low-use time? I would still stay here since I felt comfortable being with unconventional colleagues; the environment in Phoenix can be a little scary.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing change from hotel chains! Made my business trip a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: RALChicago
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the convention center and wanted to stay away from the usual conference hotels. The Clarendon Hotel was a real treasure! This hotel is a great alternative to the standard hotel with great style and flair. The front desk staff was always helpful with GREAT suggestions. They directed me to a terrific running trail not too far away that I otherwise would not have found on my own. They guided me to the light rail system that took me right to the convention center and saved me tons of money on parking! The restaurant is excellent. If you are looking for a perfect meal...go have a margarita, guacamole, and the NY Strip Steak. It was so good I came back two nights later with friends and ordered the same meal! All the people were fantastic. Guests tend to be younger, though I am 50 and enjoyed it immensely and felt at home. I WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “What. A. Disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: dixienana
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Just the facts . . . 1. Staff friendly in general, but desk clerk was 'clever with an attitude'. 2. Strange transition from elevator to our floor, having to go back outside to get to our wing, via rickety walkway with creepy carpeting; 3. Interior of room: bathtub had bad skin disorder or something -- the finish was seriously decaying with big dark splotches all over the floor of the tub; very reluctant to even shower in there . . . and no bar soap, btw, and when I went downstairs and asked for some (how do you wash your hands in the sink???) the previously mentioned desk clerk said they provided misc. 'samples' in place of bar soap, i.e. 'body wash' and the like. Okay, there was a small sample of MEN'S body wash, infused with those pore-scrubbing bits of crystal sand or whatnot, and that was IT. All the other samples were either facial moisturizer, hand lotion, disposable razors, shampoo/conditioner. NO HAND SOAP. And there was only ONE bath towel, for a room reserved for TWO people; had to go get one downstairs . .. and another thing: I had requested NO DOWN OR FEATHER BEDDING as I am allergic, and there were feather pillows in the room when we arrived: the same desk clerk brought up replacements after notifying him of the mistake, and was going to just leave the original pillows in the room on the only chair (as there was no other place to store them), so I asked him to please just take them out of the room, and though he gave me a funny look he did take them. . . but later that afternoon, after returning from a brief outing, we found those feather pillows BACK in the room, on the only chair!!! Okay, enuf about the pillows . . . this room was NOT economy-priced, either, at $179 for a Tuesday night, with no 'extras' like breakfast . . . and NO BAR SOAP. Also, the window shades did not work, and so were forever open so one had to find a dark corner to disrobe in. Lighting was strange and ineffective, as well as puzzling to figure how and where to turn it on. Each lamp/fixture had it's own bizarre personality, as well. All in all, it's just a creepy place, with that added roadside attraction of being where that news reporter was murdered back in the 80s or something. It has a 60's motel-attempt-to-morph-into-upscale-boho-inn feel about it . . . I'm sorry, but I believe Trip Advisor was created to be a site one could go to for an honest, non-edited traveler's review, and that's what I always submit, good and/or bad. I trust the website, consult it ALWAYS, and hope it stays reliable. P.S. The female bartender was very pleasant, helpful, and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel our company has stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: arizonareecemoss
Reviews.Content: Our company just returned from our stay at The Clarendon and I have to just say "THANK YOU!" To the staff for making our trip such a success. I handle all the travel arrangements for our company and the staff made everything so effortless for me from Reserving to confirming, from Check in to Check out, the whole process for me was the smoothest I have had with any hotel in my 10 years of making travel arrangements. Not to mention this is the first time I have not had to deal with complaints from anyone internally about the choice of accommodations. Everyone was generally happy with the hotel and the location. But I really think the Staff makes this place! Thank you, Thank you again Clarendon Staff and keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Can I live there!?”
Reviews.Author: paulnabor1981
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Clarendon in Phoenix while on a business trip. My colleagues and I enjoyed the atmosphere, it seemed like the roof top deck was big for the locals, and we met a lot of people the nights we were there. The rooms were very nice and I think I got the best sleep I have ever gotten outside of my own bed! 4 days was not enough at this place, I look forward to going back next year during our next convention!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Youth Hostels in Australia that were similar to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Malgosha
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon appears to "Hip and Happening" but I didn't find it so. Check in went well (except for the $10 a night per person Hotel fee) and the room appeared to be decent with funky decorating and new age music playing. After our first night's sleep we found the bed uncomfortable, the pillows thin, and the room stuffy - as the fans didn't work ( your supposed to use the air conditioning unit), the windows didn't open and the walls had chips and holes in them where the shower curtain had been moved several times. Considering the cost of the room I would recommend this hotel to people who like hard uncomfortable beds, noisy halls, and a "Hip" but unfriendly atmosphere. On the positive side, the restaurant is pretty good for dinner and the roof top patio is a great place to watch the sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in Phoenix; Can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: TonyFromTheBronx
Reviews.Content: I booked one week at the Clarendon Hotel while vising Phoenix with a friend on vacation. I was impressed after not only reading the positive reviews on Tripadvior, but the fact that the hotel manager individually responded to most comments and complains. Everyone I spoke with at the front desk was very friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The hotel is located in the museum district of Phoenix. There is covered parking for a fee, but I was able to find parking on the street right outside the hotel each night which was free. The room I booked was a junior suite and it included a large HDTV and a small single seater couch. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable and were comparable to 5 star Hilton, Hyatt, and Marriots I've stayed at. The walls were painted blue, with a multicolored rug and artwork hung on the wall. There was a very modern Fujitsu air conditioning / heater unit that was controlled with a remote and did not restrict you from making the room as cold or hot as you pleased. The hotel featured a bar and Mexican restaurant in the lobby, which was pretty tasty but a little pricey, especially for cocktails. There is a rooftop bar, which was great for taking photos of the city. Also, there is a outdoor pool and hottub, which I did not get the chance to use. Unfortunately, the noise insulation between the rooms and the hallways is not very great, so I could hear conversations in the hallway and every time a door opened and closed it made a loud noise. I stayed on the 2nd floor and the first night (Saturday) was relatively quiet as the hotel was nearly empty but by the second night (Sunday) it had filled up and it was difficult to sleep with all of the noise in the hallway. I spoke to the front desk in the morning and they moved me to another room on the 3rd floor which had much less guests. However, this room had an older style window which did not provide noise insulation from the street so I could hear cars going by, and also there was a terrible draft. In addition, the bathtub looked like it was in the middle of being renovated and there was uneven coats of paint on the bottom. I spoke to the front desk and requested that I could check out early, and they were happy to accommodate me. Even though I prepaid the hotel through hotels.com, and the cancellation policy clearly stated I would not be eligible for a refund, they simply told me they would refund the money to hotels.com and I would just need to call them to get my refund. Sure enough, I made one phone call after returning home and had my refund for the nights I didn't stay on my credit card. Overall I feel this is a great value hotel that is trendy and has a unique feel to it. The staff did everything they could to make my stay more comfortable. However, if you are sensitive to noise, you should consider bringing earplugs as you will hear everything in the hallway. Also, be sure to ask for a room that is fully renovated, if you don't want to hear street noise and have a draft in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Should be the number 1 rated hotel in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: ASBMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great food and bar area, excellent pool and even better hot tub. Unbelievable rooftop that looks over the whole city of Phoenix. Great location with walking distance to many places. We never once walked in or out the door without having someone smile and say hi or bye! Have and will recommend it to all family and friends when traveling to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - Locally Owned”
Reviews.Author: KaliMau
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The rooms are spacious with nice amenities. Beds are very comfortable. The pool area is unique and the rooftop bar is the perfect spot for watching the sun set over Phoenix. The restaurant is just okay. A short walk away is Fez on Central. Great burgers and drinks. For any GLBT travelers, you'll feel very welcome at the Clarendon and Central Phoenix. The hotels is within a short cab ride to several clubs - Amsterdams, Charlies, Sanctuary, Cash, Girl Club, Roscoes etc. Pick up an Echo mag for locations. For non-GLBT travelers, the hotel is a nice family place, too. The larger rooms have pull out sofa beds and kids love the pool. It was quiet enough that I never heard the neighbors. It's also safe and not off any busy roads. All over great local hotel that far surpasses the big chains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a beautiful pool and rooftop view of the city skyline.”
Reviews.Author: stevo3985
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very polite and professional. The rooms are very modern and elegant. Comfiest bed I have ever slept in. All around great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trangh35
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in the Museum district, not too far from downtown. I didn't try their roof top lounge, but everything else was spectacular. Was there in the middle of August so had to keep AC on 24/7. Room was clean, nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. THE place to stay in downtown Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: Livinghead
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cool. Sort of a downtown LA Standard feel to it including a rooftop bar, however, it is in the staff and level of service that the Clarendon excels. Thank you. I will be back. David Nichols

Reviews.Title: “A New Tradition....”
Reviews.Author: RonnaSue
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Clarendon and will be making it a yearly tradition with visits in between. The entire staff was pleasant and very helpful throughout our entire stay. The rooms were very comfortable with a warm appeal and we slept restful in the comfy, cozy beds. We took several trips to the rooftop for beautiful views of the Phoenix area and to experience the atmosphere of such a unique feature. It is not often that food is memorable to me but I have not stopped thinking about the amazing menu, tastes, presentation and freshness of every bite from their restaurant, the Gallo Blanco. We feel as though we've found a little gold mine and will certainly be telling our friends!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a personality? Yes, please!”
Reviews.Author: vwjou
Reviews.Content: I live in Wyoming but am really attached to my dentist in Phoenix, so I come down every 6 months or so for a visit/checkup... I always stay at the Clarendon. No, it's not some cookie cutter, sterile Hilton... it's the Clarendon. I love it because it's homegrown and different, and because it's warm and happy. The lobby (recently redone) is so FREAKING cool, I would take any of the design elements and put them in my own home if I could. They've really put a lot into making it sparkling and pretty. The staff is exceptional in terms of friendliness and promptness when I need something. The pool area is also rad, though if I had my way, I would knock down an entire side of the building so I could get longer sun... but, yeah, that's not really an option. It's in a very middle of town location, which some might find difficult to maneuver ... to that, I suggest those people look up Public Transportation. Yes, Phoenix has it now, and it's really convenient to get to from the Clarendon. The rooms themselves are perfect. Spacious and comfortable. I think that's exactly what I want and need to get some rest. The beds are outrageously comfortable, like a big cloud. I would stay in those beds all day if I could! Yes, try the Clarendon. Unless you're the corporate type who wants the same old, same old... this place is pure Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Elvisbg
Reviews.Content: Quick review: Room - clean and spacious. Internet - intermittent access. Pool area - great hot tub. Pool was not open as heater was broken. Great lounge area. Roof top - make sure to take a trip to the roof. Great views. Nice reading area. Parking - at check in I was told that it was $10/night. At check out it was free. Location - not bad. It is quite a distance from downtown. You really need a car when staying in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: joeb1212
Reviews.Content: I will keep it factual. Upon check-in I was not told that my credit card would be pre-approved for "any incidentals that may occur", I was told the bar would be open until 12am, it was closed at 10pm, by an undertrained bartender. Wi-fi was only available in the hotel lobby, it would not connnect in my room or at the pool. The heat in my room did not work. Very few outlets available in the room. There were half-empty shampoo bottles left in the bathroom. The shower knob fell apart, the attendee offered to repair it himself or change my room, which left me with no time to shower before my flight. The food in the restaurant was good. The bed was comfortable and clean. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware undisclosed post stay fees!”
Reviews.Author: wcabq
Reviews.Content: Loud buzzing noise at night, never figured out what it was. Air conditioner did not operate properly. Light by bed burned out. Fitness Center was just two small rooms crammed with weight machines, for the most part. Looked more like a storage facility for equipment. Treadmill was cheap. WiFi did not function. A few days after returning home I checked my credit card online there is a charge for $10. Called hotel and was informed it was a "lodging fee", not a parking fee, not a charge for lost towels, just a "lodging fee".

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Hot Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: suemac79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Clarendon for 2 nights during our Arizona honeymoon and even a year later, a couple of things stand out. We stayed there on the recommendation of a friend of mine who lives in Phoenix. She told us that if she were to visit the city, she would want to stay at the Clarendon. First, the pool. AMAZING!!! Great atmosphere created by cool lighting, tiling, and fabulous poolside beds/lounges/chairs. I hope whoever designed it was well compensated. It was so refreshing to have a dip after a hot July day in Phoenix. Next the room. Well updated, the huge TV was a treat and the bed was very comfortable and clean. My best sleeps of the whole trip were at the Clarendon. Because they don't have comforters, but rather a third sheet over a duvet, I didn't feel that icky-ness I usually feel at most hotels. The internet was okay, and I loved the fact that they had free long distance. We were disappointed the rooftop bar wasn't open the days we were there, as we were really looking forward to it. Also, the hotel should really think about getting double glazed windows. The rooms were really hot even though the AC was on all the time, and it was all because of those awful single paned windows. Coming from a place that has very hot summers and very cold winters, modern windows will save the hotel money in AC costs by helping it work better, and will keep its guests in greater comfort. Though it should be noted: we were in Phoenix in July. It's supposed to be hot!

Reviews.Title: “Different, for sure”
Reviews.Author: Steinbock2006
Reviews.Content: Colors: For sure, psychedelic to say the least, but in the end the colors just mask an attempt at poor renovations. Pool: Cold, cold, cold and full of colors, (see above) Room: Dark, poorly renovated but clean. Weird window coverings, did I say dark? Bed: Comfy, headboard making noises at any time with ANY movement, not necessary “THAT” movement, clean sheets. AC: Barely adequate (October!) hate to think about June or July. Room service: Just Ok, did not replenished many of the items like coffee or cups Roof top: Spectacular, use it!!! Drawback, you have to use the slowest elevator on earth to get there. Restaurant: Stay away that is all I have to say. You have been warned. Overall: At about $80 a night it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place, but...”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July and again in September. My stay in July was great, I was so thrilled to find a "cool" hotel in this part of town, where I like to stay to be close to my client's location. The rooms are stylishly decorated with some funky touches, large and comfortable. I loved the pool area and the small bar is great. I didn't eat in the restaurant, but enjoyed fish tacos for only $2 each at the bar - very fresh and delicious. Nice bartenders and patrons as well. My stay in September was marred by being awakened at about 6am by loud talking and banging around by a maintenance crew in the hallway next to my room. It was so loud that I got up, put on my robe, and stepped outside to ask them to be a little quieter. They said OK but within 5 minutes it was back to noisy rattling around. I spoke to the front desk on my way out that morning and they told me that there would be work going on again the next morning so I asked them to move me to another room, which they did. Honestly, the hotel seemed like it was half empty, so why would they book people into the section of hotel where maintenance would be happening at 6am??? That turned me off a bit. But with that said, I will definitely stay there again. It really is a great option if you're not keen on the budget-level chain hotels located in the middle of hospital parking lots that seem to be the only other choices in that part of town

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fialta
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel and would highly recommend it. It was reasonably priced and had a great character and very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: tmontg2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to stay at The Clarendon during Phoenix Fashion Week, m client was showing and we wanted to be close to the venue but not too close so we wouldn't have to deal with traffic. It was recommended by a friend of mine who also recommends it to his family and friends. When I first saw it I was not expecting the hidden gem inside. It looked like a regular hotel with basic amenities from the outside but when you stepped inside you kind of got taken by surprise. It's stunning and definitely has a personality of its own thats hip and trendy. Everything was decorated with thought...The elevator, even the room had original art inside entitled "storms and snowflakes" and little artistic images of the city. Other pluses included flat screen tv, a comfy bed, free wifi (3 different wifis depending on where you are at the hotel..so try all three to find the one thats the best reception), and 2 pools...one pool was on the roof! and it was stunning. The other pool was on the 1st floor and it had a mosaic catwalk down the middle.. My only con would be the air conditioner made a noise every few hours that got to me a little at first, but other than that I plan to stay there every time I need a hotel in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Not your cookie cutter chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wildcatfan69
Reviews.Content: It's not a diamond in the rough but its a gem just the same. Very convenient to the light rail, a short walk up the street with access to some great eating/drinking spots (Pane Bianco for a sandwich) Renovation consists of a LOT of paint of varied colors in all public areas. Rooms are somewhat minimalist - hate the bathrooms with only one switch for vent fan and light - if you like to read while soaking in a hot tub - forget it! Very limited vanity space to hold the basics like a toothbrush and razor. Great bed, bedding and oversized HD tv. Appears that former wetbar area now just houses a refrigerator with two $5.00 bottles of water. Warning notice not to bring your own alcohol to the hotel was a little tacky. Front desk/reception staff were friendly - not so efficient. I had prepaid my room on Expedia, upon check in they presented me the registration card with the rate they charged Expedia, not the rate I had paid. They said the restaurant, Blanco Gallo, would open at 7 am for breakfast - I called a client to meet for breakfast at 7:30 the next morning. A little surprised when we entered the dark bar and restaurant to find out they had changed their opening time to 8 am. A little awkward as there was no place to even get coffee until then unless we left the hotel. Pool area is attractive with a waterfall wall providing animation and pleasant background noise. Rooftop deck was a little to windy and warm to enjoy. Elevator is ancient - with no ventilation, don't use if its 90 or above as its like an inferno! I'll stay again but call the hotel directly for best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience! Great staff! Exceptional value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdefrates
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful, from check in to check out! Staff was very courteous, and very knowledgeable of the attractions in the area and even the new light rail system! The pool was brilliantly lit, even had tiny lights at the bottom!!! The suite we stayed in was spacious and had a HUGE TV in the bedroom. When I'm back in Phoenix I will come again for sure! I can't wait!!!! The attached "Mexico City" style Mexican restaurant was without a doubt the best food I had during my stay! Absolute first-class meal at unbelievably reasonable prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great design, cool staff!”
Reviews.Author: chatnoel
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Clarendon by pure chance, and I loved the hotel, the design is absolutely fabulous. What they did from a normal motel is original and quite unexpected. The staff was very nice, the room also. I liked very much and recomend it to trendy people!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: skippy964
Reviews.Content: I travel toPhoenix for work on a regular basis. The hotel is awesome! It has a great pool and all the small things to make the stay a 5-Star experience. The staff is friendly, the food is delectable, and the location in central PHX makes it easy to hit all the hot spots. The owners are very personable and amazing hosts who will go out of their way to make sure that your stay is top notch. I'm looking forward to staying there during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oklalou
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the lobby I knew my stay at the Clarendon Hotel would be an experience. The retro/mod style was refreshing. (Especially after several poor hotel/motel chain experiences this past year.) The building has been upgraded with many ammenities (free international calls for one --- if only I had someone to call!) and is quite quaint. It is loctated near the light rail system (3-4 blocks) and near several good eating establishments. Despite being an older building, it was very clean and as a single traveler I felt safe and secure in the facility. I stayed in one of the poolside suites and loved every minute of it. Comfotable and clean are two words that come to mind. The decor is old school meets modern retro. It was this uniqueness that added to the enjoyment of the stay. Oh, and the bed...wow! Where can I get one of those!!! The pool area is fabulous with a full-length wall waterfall and fountains shooting into and out of the pool. The seating around the pool area and in the pool provide a relaxing getaway feel. There was a nice mix of singles, couples and families enjoying the area. The rooftop bar has a great view and atmosphere. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating and were definitely glad I was there. I can't say enough good things about the Clarendon except, I can't wait to go back with a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: kateboever
Reviews.Content: From the retro/modern decor to the breathtaking rooftop to the unsurpassed pool with the most beautiful waterfall...we were overwhelmed by our stay. Staff was friendly and knowledgable. The room! Oh the room was fantastic. Bedding and bath materials were perfection. We come to AZ every spring and will make this our second home!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hadjii
Reviews.Content: This place is inexpensive & you get a lot for what you pay for. The restaurant downstairs has been refurbished & runs very efficiently now ( much improved from last year!) The amenities are pretty nice.. comfy bed, great TV, iPod dock on the alarm clock and just a generally pleasant place to stay and it won't ding your wallet like some of the comparable places nearby. I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: skapera
Reviews.Content: I am a professional art and fashion photographer and The Clarendon is a great place to relax and enjoy a beautiful experience. It is visually pleasing and soothing to the soul as well. I recommend spending some time by the pool and checking out the rooftop view! Enjoy! Sean Kapera - SeanKaperaPhotography.com

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a more pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: RapidEyeMvmt
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is both hip and comfortable! They have a gorgeous pool area with food/drink service, the beds feel like they were made for angels to sleep on, and that corn on the cob with cheese on it - I don't know the technical name for it, but I'm addicted. I stayed three nights, had brunch (fresh mimosas!) and dinner there, enjoyed the pool and felt really at home in the room. The furniture in the living room and bedroom was modern and cozy enough to snuggle up in with my honey. I would definitely stay here again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona's Great Escape in Comfort and Style!!!”
Reviews.Author: MonyMonyMony
Reviews.Content: I loved every minute of my stay at the Clarendon. It was good times with good people in an awesome environment. The pool and spa is relaxing and clean. The room was decorated nicely with a nice bar and sitting area. They even have a lovely waterfall feature on the first floor. I highly recommend the Clarendon for future Phoenix stays.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and eclectic”
Reviews.Author: hawa38
Reviews.Content: 1st of all Ben, good job with the Clarendon, sometimes you just cannot please everyone. we were allowed early check in at around 11 am, wow! i was almost dying of exhaustion after climbing the camelback and the friendly staff kindly let us checked in 5 hours earlier than the regular check in time. i was going to whine about the AC (or lack of) in the room and the "elevator of death" as the previous reviewer put it but knowing that these problems are being looked into tell me that i am going back to Clarendon my next visit to Phoenic :) i was extremely pleased to find out that the bed doesn't have the dirty useless bed spread because i am very likely to throw them on the floor as soon i see them anyway, and the sheets and pillows are very good quality, i had a very good night sleep despite not having the sheet on me (room was hot). my husband had to remind me to mention about the out of order ice machine, and the craziness of the existence and non existence of the tv channel, they seemed to be disappearing. we had to switch room after checked in for 3 hours because there was no wifi in the room, the staff made it very easy to move us to another room. have to mention about the shaded parking area, that's a big plus considering the high was 111F when we visited last week. what you see is what you get from the hotel website, if bold colors and contemporary are not your cup of tea, you should probably check into a resort. oh yea Ben, love the carpet! even considering getting something similar for the study.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: dickie98
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Clarendon before - it is convenient for where I need to be in Phoenix, stylish and relatively cheap. When I checked in the room I was given was quite warm and the a/c didn't seem to be doing much - I put this down to Phoenix being 110F at that point and the a/c units struggling. I presumed it would function better as the outside temperature fell overnight. However I found myself in bed at 4am with the room temperature at 90F. Not being awake enough to go to the desk at that point, I spent an uncomfortable night and went to the desk at 7am. When I commented on the problem I was told that the a/c was being serviced so there was no room to move me to that would be cooler. It may be an obtuse question but who thinks that servicing a/c in Phoenix in the middle of summer is a good idea? I asked the desk clerk to confirm that every room in the hotel was at 90F and was told that it probably was. I then said I would be checking out (I had my bags packed and with me), when, miraculously a suite with fully functioning a/c suddenly was available. The suite was blissfully cool and perfectly comfortable and from that point my stay was calm and uneventful. I had breakfast in the new Mexican restaurant on the premises which was very good, fresh and reasonably priced. Generally the Clarendon is a nice hotel, rooms are good for the price and the staff are usually very helpful. So at the moment I put this experience down to being a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Modern motel but worn and dated”
Reviews.Author: Jchgo972
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Clarendon as a recommendation from a client since we were meeting them for happy hour at the bar. Upon driving up, I can tell that this really was an old motel that was renovated but still needs a LOT of work - OLD windows, obvious paint peeling, and what looked like boarded up windows were the back sides of paintings (that are cleverly used as curtains but really should have shades) Room was cute but not the coziest - interesting design elements but still felt like a motel with some new paint. Pros: GREAT location, good bar, friendly service, very good price, cute pool, free wifi and parking Cons: very worn (and pool bed cushions were still ripped and faded), could be cleaned up, elevator has no A/C and at 110 degrees - it was HOT...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: rothampster
Reviews.Content: We came here on a quick overnight just to get away. The restaurant, though limited in menu, was incredible. Everyone here, from the front desk staff, the wait staff and the managers, were friendly and helpful and eager to please. Loved the pool and large spa, and the deck chairs. Very impressed with the room too--the finest of linens made for a very comfortable night's sleep, and the flat screen tv was an unexpected wow. All in all, a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Clarendon Hotel Puts the "Fun" in Funkalicious”
Reviews.Author: MemphisRose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a hotel room for one night only after a trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona, AZ. Luckily for us, he picked The Clarendon Hotel. The decor is sort of like a mini-Phoenix MOMA. The hotel and rooms are decorated throughout with funky/fun art. Our king-size bed was super comfy and plush. The swimming pool is the most fab one that I've ever seen. One side of the pool deck is a glass waterfall with cacti at the border. As a bonus, the friendly bar staff mixed up the best margaritas I think I've ever had. Although it took us a little while to figure out the restaurant menu, the food was awesome. We are now looking for an excuse to go back to Phoenix just to stay at The Clarendon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: sarathena
Reviews.Content: During some particularly hairy home renovations, I decided to book a room at the Clarendon to give my 9-year old son and a visiting friend a bit of a break. I've spent many fun evenings on the rooftop and restaurant, but had never been a guest - and I am glad I listened to my impulse! The room was very inexpensive but quite posh, with lovely bedding and lots of space. We had a 4th floor junior executive suite with a view of the pool, and really I couldn't have been happier with the room. After I explained my renovation hell, we were permitted to check in several hours early, which was very kind of the front desk staff. We spent the day lounging by and playing in the pool, watching people, and snacking on tacos from the restaurant. And hooray for free wifi! Everyone was incredibly nice to me, and I was really pleased to see how nice they were to my son. It's a very friendly place, not perfect or predictable, but exactly what I want out of a hotel. We had such a great time that we're planning on doing this every couple of weeks as a fun local getaway. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Where are Hef and the Bunnies?”
Reviews.Author: mvdljca
Reviews.Content: It's 107 degrees in the shade outside. The pool here at the Clarendon is rocking, but you don't what to go out there. You don't even want to LOOK out there. The green water. The pasty flesh. The cigarette smoke and tattoos. Groooovy, Baaaaaaaby. I haven't been here long, but the Cliff's Notes are as follows: I've done a better job dressing up my garage for Saturday night poker than they have with the lobby/bar/restaurant area. And you had better like their music, because you're going to hear lots of it. The elevator that takes you to the death chamber at San Quentin is better than the elevator here. They should have cyanide capsules under glass that you can break and gulp down in the event you get stuck inside for longer than 60 seconds. The architecture is trailer-trash-meets-hip-wannabe. As for the rooms, I just KNOW that if somebody flipped on a fluorescent light, the entire place would illuminate with the telltale glow of bodily fluids. Oh, and don't forget the pet hairs. The room is the temperature of a place you don't really want to be. And if that rooftop bar is the best in Phoenix, I'll stay home and drink. Maybe I'm just getting old and cranky. But the world is full of creeps and germs, and I'm getting the feeling this is their annual convention. Maybe the place will grow on me. Or is that mildew? Can mildew grow in 107 degree heat and 10 percent humidity? We'll see. I'm here for four nights, courtesy of the draconian cancellation policies at Orbitz. To wit: Total penalty(1 room): $231.24 Cancellation policy: Cancellations or changes made more than 1 day prior to 12:01 AM local hotel time on the day of arrival are subject to a $25.00 charge. Cancellations or changes made within 1 day prior to 12:01 AM local hotel time on the day of arrival are subject to a $80.54 charge. Cancellations or changes made after 12:01 AM local hotel time on the day of arrival are subject to a 100% charge. We are sorry but refunds are not available for early check-out. The hotel is not authorized to make an exception to this policy. If the Clarendon had room service, or even if you could charge your drinks at the bar to your room, I may be able to find it my heart to warm up to the place by Thursday. I stay in hotels 50 nights a year and I'm not a fussy guy: I've stayed in places with fewer than four walls and more leaks in the ceiling than the Prostate Shrinkage Institute. But the stuff that's written about the Clarendon -- Hip-Cool-Funky -- makes me wonder who's writing this stuff. On a positive note, I'm reasonably sure you could drink the tap water, and I did flush paper without incident (two lodging standards I will not compromise on domestic soil). Trip Advisor, you've never led me astray before. Maybe I'll find the charm of this place yet. I'm heading down to the bar to take a look.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect and more”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixCyn84
Reviews.Content: I live in the Phoenix area and anytime I want a "staycation", I always choose the Clarendon Hotel. I've always gotten excellent customer service and the rooms and pool are wonderful! It's modern and classy, but not pretentious. As others have said, the downside is that it isn't really near anything too exciting (shopping, nightlife, etc) nearby. Aside from that, I have no complaints. A huge plus for me is that the hotel is not a chain--hotel chains typically just have "okay" customer service and the design, layout and rooms are rather mundane. The hotel has a personable feel to it, yet has four star ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Clarendon embodies the soul of Phoenix - awesome.”
Reviews.Author: hzp
Reviews.Content: There are two kinds of Arizona visitors: those who want a real flavor of Phoenix, and those who want to shop and buy ceramic Chile peppers. If the latter is you, stay in Scottsdale. If you want the real deal, complete with true Mexican food, downtown culture and sipping margaritas poolside, the Clarendon is for you. Located dead center in North Central Phoenix, a short skip to the new light rail that can take you up to Camelback or all the way to Tempe, the Clarendon has undergone a complete makeover. Filled with colorful spaces and niches, the Clarendon is the ideal midweek business stopover. You could spend the day in the lounge of Gallo Blanco, sucking the free wifi and meeting with clients. They'll take you more seriously on their own grounds. The free wifi continues upstairs in the rooms. I was impressed with the size of the bedrooms, offering enough room for me to bring 8 of my friends back to the room with me and for us to comfortably sit out, looking over the pool. A few of them commented on the design and spaciousness of the bathroom and WHO can say no to high end amenities? I loved the free wifi, have I mentioned the free wifi? Also- CD clock radio, incredibly comfy bed and sheets, and a huge flatscreen on the wall that honestly, I never even turned on. I DID love the in room fridge and working space. But lets go back downstairs: over two days, I hosted about 12 different clients in Gallo Blanco. At no point did any staff member even question us. They were warm, friendly, and Gallo offered us the perfect meeting spot. The prices of the menu items were perfect for snacking all day long and the quality of the food is phenomenal. I'd come back here even if I was staying elsewhere. One of my favorite things about the Clarendon is the people watching- the pool is a frequent spot for locals, and even the people getting on and off the elevator were worthwhile watching. I know a number of rock bands stay here, and I believe it. It was too hot during my stay for a visit to the rooftop, but on a spring night? I bet its magnificent. And I haven't mentioned it, but how great is the covered parking? From the reasonable room rates, to the food, and especially the service, Clarendon is my going to be my pick for accommodations anytime I'm back in Phx.

Reviews.Title: “The Coolest Hotel in Downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: joepinstripe
Reviews.Content: Phoenix is a city of resort hotels -- grandes dames like The Biltmore, The Royal Palms and the Phoenician, and downscale "family" places which are no more than a bunch of nondescript rooms around a pool. As such, a critically important segment of the hotel market was ignored in Phoenix -- the interesting design hotel that had no claim to grandure, but saw itself as more interesting a destination than the typical Marriott familyplex with free eggs and bacon for the kids. Ignored, that is, until the Clarendon came along. This is a well-designed hotel with all kinds of interesting touches -- from the sliding light screens on the windows to the quality and quantity of the in-room magazines. Chic lighting? Check. Plenty of closet space? Yep. Awesome outdoor rooftop lounge? Oh yes. And the pool! Large, cool and smack-dab in the center of it all. Also recommended -- by locals I was visiting -- is the restaurant. Interesting art in the public spaces, comfortable beds, strong showers and quality toiletries finish off the superiori physical attributes of this property. Last but not least is the excellence of the staff. Friendly, young and always eager to help -- including the late night shift, which is typically staffed at most hotels by junior-junior, inexperienced and not-all-that-helpful sfaff. I was pleasantly surprised from the friendly "Welcome!" to the "Thanks for staying with us!" I can't recommend this hotel more. I am a many-miles-traveled businessman and would be pleased to call the Clarendon home at the end of a long work day -- luckily, though, this trip was all fun and the Clarendon was a large part of that outcome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and kitschy”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Missy
Reviews.Content: It's obivous the owners who re-did this hotel didn't want to spend tons of money re-doing the facade or updating the physical look of the hotel to be more modern. But that's what I loved about it! The rooms were modern and clean. The pool and hot tub were amazing. The decor was really cute, without being exclusive. The roof-top deck was a great place to just chill in the evening. The restaurant was super affordable but the food was really good and fresh. The staff were so helpful and friendly. There was free WiFi and free covered parking. The majority of the hotel was non-smoking. I loved this hotel!!! The only reason I would hesitate to stay there again is the location - it was more in what I'm guessing is the business district. The neighborhood wasn't terribly exciting, although it felt safe. We had to drive everywhere we wanted to go, which is to be expected in Phoenix, but there were no strip malls, or cute little shops within walking distance (in 98 degree weather, that is!). All that being said, I would definitely consider staying here again. If only they were located closer to Camelback Road!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here!”
Reviews.Author: msmata
Reviews.Content: I had my 2nd 35th birthday at the Clarendon...From the moment we checked in I knew I was going to love it. Their employees are so friendly and outgoing, and the room we got was extremely cool. The furniture they picked is trendy but also comfy, even the pull out bed was comfortable and inviting. I've never stayed anywhere where everything was great, the room, the pool, the decor, and their amazing restaurant, lowkey but with the best fish tacos and guacamole ever. I think that the best thing about this place is whether your an out-of-towner, or a phoenician looking for a mini-vaca, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and cool”
Reviews.Author: ILMCY
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon Hotel is the best. Funky, cool, hip, edgy & fun. Great food, better beer, cool staff.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay - Still great”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to PHX and decided again that the Clarendon offered a great central location.
