There was some sort of entertainment industry party going on when I arrived late Friday night. Beautiful types mixed with people who looked like the guys from Flight of the Conchords. Parking was convenient (just beside the building) and check in was quick. I headed straight to my room. I was happy to see that the rooms were still pretty much the same as my last visit. I like the funky art and interesting touches. The bed is still awesome. I slept like a rock and in the morning I headed to the roof for a nice cuppa before starting a day of shopping. I headed to the lobby and used the gym then stopped by the free computer/printer to print off directions to the place I wanted to go... a store that serves as the last stop for Nordstrom's. Full of junk, mostly, but it is THE place to get New Balance shoes for dirt cheap! I spent 3 days/nights at the Clarendon and plan to go back next time :) The people make the difference. I agree with the comments about Ben and the rest of the staff. How many hotels do you actually feel like you know the manager? I have a feeling there are people all over the world that say they 'know' the manager of the Clarendon. There is just something about this laid back, small place that makes me feel welcome and comfortable. Next time I plan to lay around the pool and maybe watch a Phoenix sunset/sunrise on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Misskittygreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our annual trip for Phoenix Pride. As always the staff was amazing, the rooms are clean and the pool was fabulous! Keep up the GREAT work!

Reviews.Title: “Rock-n-Roll Sensation!!!”
Reviews.Author: ACDCFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarendon for the AC/DC concert back in December and it was the coziest stay ever...the beds are HEAVENLY!!! Clean and uncluttered with fluff, the simplicity and style of these rooms were fantastic...with nice flat screen tv's as well. But worth the stay as much as the room was, the pool area and and bar service, and food were awesome! All around, the Clarendon is an absolute sensational property with the most helpful and friendliest staff ever!! It's location to dowtown arena(s) is perfect with the easiest access to parking and other local ammenities. My faves were Denny and Kenny!! Thanks so much for making the stay memorable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funnest B-day Party ever!”
Reviews.Author: totalamarchy
Reviews.Content: For my 28th Bday, I got a room at the Clarendon and had the freakin best time! We had dinner at a nearby restaurant, then headed over to the Clarendon for drinks, hot tubbin and cake! First, we went up to the roof top, had a few drinks and enjoyed the beautiful view of downtown PHX, then we all went up to the sweet suite, and got changed into our swim gear. After that we hung out at the hot tub. All of my friends were really into the under water speakers in the pool! Finally, we went up to the suite again and had cake. There were like 10 or so of us, so I was glad that the room was so spacious. The things that I really like about the Clarendon is that we were able to mix the night up all in one place (bar on the ground floor, rooftop bar, great room, beautiful pool and hot tub) and the vibe there is awesome and fun! It doesn't feel like you are at a hotel. It feels like a really fun bar, with a pool and hot tub, and after all of that, no one has to drink and drive because it is a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Clarendon”
Reviews.Author: CooperTravels
Reviews.Content: Not much else to say! It's innovative, definitely different, friendly staff that accommodate any request. The style is modern but not cold. The pool and rooftop are pretty amazing. Haven't been in the peak of summer but the rooftop is great in January! I travel to Phoenix every few months and this is my Phoenix address. The owner definitely shows pride in ownership and is present and approachable all the time. Looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AdamPHX
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff! Convenient location, close to the new light rail and business centers.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay - best boutique hotel I have experienced. Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: BCTravelDude
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 weeks at the Clarendon Hotel and had an experience that goes unmatched. I have traveled to over 40 countries, stayed in any and all hotels, hostels, B&B's - and Clarendon Hotel ( www.theclarendon.net ) is something special. Clean, contemporary, reasonably priced - a great pool / spa. Staff is wonderful, food is great (and again, affordable). Staying at the Clarendon will bring your time in AZ to another level of enjoyment. Comfortable and accomodating. This is my first and probably only review I will do....but The Clarendon deserves it!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel an wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam48
Reviews.Content: I just want to say if you are visiting the phx area stay at the claredon. My parents just visited an i put them up there for a few days. It is amazing from the staff to the rooms to the amazing layout of the pool an if you want a sunset view to remember go up to the roof top for dinner or drinks or just to lounge. Its romantic its relaxing its everything to be honest. Most of all its affordable. You will be blown away by the Decor throughout the room to the award winning food. JoJo

Reviews.Title: “Great (really great) Hotel, Awful (really awful) Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ShaneInLV
Reviews.Content: The best part of my stay was having a drink on the roof. What an amazing setting. Once it got dark there were twinkling lights in the sky AND in the pool. The room was comfortable and I was all about the toiletries they offered. The check in guy was very friendly. I am sorry to say the restaurant was a major disappointment. It was empty both nights I was there and after I tasted the food I understood why. But on the bright side, we found so many great options less than five minutes away! You will enjoy this hotel, but do yourself a favor, do NOT eat here

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Trendy Midtown Phoenix Property - Not a 'Beige Box' Resort”
Reviews.Author: rpaltman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Clarendon is a recently renovated hotel located in Phoenix midtown area, not far from the light rail and the art museum and adjacent to a quiet residential area. The hotel has been decorated in mid-century style -- giving it a hip and trendy appearance similar to the Ian Schrager boutique hotels. However, it's not the sort of place for people who enjoy Marriott, Hilton, or Starwood-flagged sanitized 'beige box' resort properties.. you have to accept and appreciate the quirks that come with an independent boutique operation in an older (although thoroughly renovated) building. The owner strives to incorporate local businesses throughout the operation -- from decor to food offerings. The GM and staff genuinely appreciate your business and are 'make it happen' types who will go out of their way to make sure you're completely satisfied with your service and accomodations. (They've personally responded to several reviews here and offered to resolve any complaints to make things right.) The rooftop bar offers one of the best views of the Valley at sunset; the pool area is amazing; and the hotel restaurant serves tasty and inexpensive cuisine with terrific service.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel, You pay for the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MegAndDan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I ended up here on a whim. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. We were not familiar with the Phoenix area, and the front desk staff made great recommendations and even printed us out maps and contact information for the attractions we were interested in. It is located in the museum district and there were a lot of options and things to do in the little time we were there. The hotel is decorated very well, in a very trendy style. Lots of great photography, wall paper, paint schemes and modern/sophisticated furniture. We stayed in the Jr. Executive Suite and it was kind of a let down. There was only a bed with side tables, a chair and a desk, all in one space the size of a standard hotel room. No separation of rooms or designation of areas. The trendy light fixtures made it difficult to put on makeup or get ready without opening the blinds (not a great view, I think it was a parking garage we were facing). There was no way to adjust the temperature in the room either (as far as we could tell). The bathroom was also pretty tiny, but again, well decorated. Overall a fun hotel to stay at. There is a cute rooftop lounge with a great view of the (very well decorated) pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sheek!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edmonds069
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Arizona and this is where I stayed!! If you do not enjoy sunshine and happiness this is totally not the place for you!!!! The owner and the staff are great!!! The rooms are very retro. The whole atmosphere of the place is great!!! Thanks so much Ben, Nick, Kimberly,Kenny, Denny and all the staff at this wonderful establishment!! No matter where I am in Arizona, I will only stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Class-Act At The Clarendon”
Reviews.Author: travelcricket
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity of staying at The Clarendon two times before. Each time I stay there I know I want to keep coming back. Ben Bethel the GM is absolutely great. He cares about each of his guest and has an electric and professional personality. He is a BIG part of why I want to return not to just Phoenix but this hotel. The swanky pool area is amazingly beautiful and the bar lounge area is very modern and chic. I have to stay that the entire staff is so gracious, helpful and sweet. I did not meet every front desk staff person but "Nick", "Analisa", "Joel", "Jimmy" are some of the few that went over and beyond assisting me and my guests. I find that The Clarendon is centrally located to Scottsdale where a lot of the nightlife and nice restaurants are located, as well as downtown Phoenix. I have to say that you must go to the rooftop of the hotel. The lounge is great at sunset. Without question, The Clarendon is a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose this hotel again ...”
Reviews.Author: Crewdog13
Reviews.Content: The staff are absolutely great - and they about the only positive thing I can say about the hotel. The Clarendon is located in an industrial area about a $10 - $15 cab ride from downtown, if the cabbie can find the hotel. The lobby is fine, and the front desk people really nice and helpful. The bar/restaurant downstairs was good, and poured a good margarita, but we never made it to the roof top. There is a bust and memorial to a reporter who was murdered out front of the hotel a couple of decades ago that was interesting. The hotel had to be something else in an earlier age, either an old Holiday Inn or maybe an office building. We were (gratefully) upgraded to what I would have expected to pay about $150 a nite for at a Hyatt or Marriott, but I paid almost twice that. I cringe when I think of what we would have been given for my original reservation. Our room was inside a building, but the doors of most rooms faced an outdoor hallway and the (very nice) pool area. The hallway was musty smelling. The room was large and decorated in a pop western film motif. Those are the nice things I can say about the room. The air barely worked and was so hot and musty smelling that my wife and I could barely sleep. The window shades did not open, the desk chair was ready to fall apart and bathroom needs a refurbish. The linens were very nice, but the $5 water in the room was a little steep. When we travel on pleasure my wife and I normally like to stay in the room until late checkout and leisurely make our way back to the airport. At the Clarendon we couldn't wait to leave. To it's credit the hotel was busy (maybe because the NBA All-Star game was in town which is why I couldn't find a room downtown), seemed to have a nice local trade, and the staff was terrific. However, we would never stay there again and could not recommend it. I would stay near the airport first and take a taxi back and forth to downtown instead of staying at the Clarendon.

Reviews.Title: “A Hip Retreat in Phoenix! Who knew?”
Reviews.Author: UrbanGal65
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Clarendon from a hotel downtown, after the business portion of our trip. As soon as we walked in, we were so happy we had moved! This hotel just oozes urban chic, from the snazzy pool area with a "wall of water" and humungous hot tub, to the hopping bar, to the cool artwork throughout the hotel. The entire atmosphere was like a breath of fresh energy - especially as compared to the typical "box" hotels I stay in for business. While we've stayed in boutique hotels before, the experience hasn't always been good. Here, the service was spectacular from the moment we walked in until the moment we left. People there seem to genuinely like their jobs. The room itself continued the trendy feel. I loved the painted window shade that glided over the window looking over the interior courtyard! I also loved the fact that we could open our exterior window to get fresh air. (This is usually a pet peeve of mine with newer hotels - that you can't open the windows.) The true test was the bed. I can't remember when I've slept that well in a hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable. Now I understand why they make a big deal about the bedding on the website. It was the first time in a while that I've been away from home and not longed for my own bed. The rooftop deck was cool, both literally and figuratively. We went up to see the sunset the first night we were there. The view was gorgeous (I posted pics), but it was cool and windy (hazard of the time of year). The staff valiantly lit portable heaters and placed fleece blankets about on the sofas. We bundled under them, thankful that we could stay up there until the sun was gone. Minor issues: free wireless signal was weak from our room, but we could access it from the lobby. Saturday night private party in the pool area looked/sounded really cool, but the music could be heard in our room. Thankfully, it ended by 11pm, which is a reasonable weekend hour, I think. Nice touches: free phone calls, room fridge where we kept our leftovers from dinner and some waters, pretty complete gym (and my husband's very particular), free sunscreened lot parking, gorgeous flatscreen TV, in-room coffee service. On the whole, we were extremely happy with the experience and would definitely recommend it to friends who want something different than the every day boring hotel. I would hesitate to recommend it to travelers with young children or who go to bed very early.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: liverpool85
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon holds the promise of being a great little find, but in the end it falls short of being a recommended place to stay. A reconstituted motel, the center pool and rooftop bar certainly gives the hotel a flairs of style, but bad paint, odd lighting and poor housekeeping impedes its success. I paid for an upgrade, and apparently that got me a room overlooking the kitchen exit with doors slamming continually, no screen for the window and a Hi/Med/Low fan that rattled constantly. Housekeeping cleared away my jammies, never to be returned...in fact, I received no service on my second day. My room was cleaned on the third day, but no shampoo or conditioner was left. I found security to be a little scary, as a side door was continually propped open allowing anyone to access the guestroom floors without walking by the front desk or key access. The restaurant/bar needs a good scrubbing, and dance lights that change colors while you are trying to eat dinner are unappealing. Breakfast and dinner was well prepared, but service was sketchy...well intended, but without a true sense of timing. The comp wireless worked great, the free phone was a nice treat and location was great for business...but in the end I felt like I was staying in a motel vs. a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what an incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: resqking
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel is unique. i have never stayed in a more comfortable hotel room before. the entire place is amazing from the rooms to the rooftop bar to the increbible pool and spa area. the best is the staff, every hotel should strive to treat their guests the way i was treated during my stay. i definetely will book another stay at this great establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful, great bar”
Reviews.Author: cccccccccccccccc
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel in downtown phoenix. Loved the decor and the bar had really great, healthy, and affordable mexican food - which really came in handy when our flight was delayed and we got in well past the closing time of most restaurants. Being able to grab a yummy dinner with friends (despite it being almost 11pm) was an awesome bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Intimate, Friendly Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_Maven
Reviews.Content: Even though I live here in Phx., I've treated myself to a few stays at the Clarendon. Why do I do that when I live here? Because it's fun, sexy, intimate, and close to everything! I feel like I'm on a mini-vacation away from here when I'm there! It's almost like being out of town! I've stayed there a few times when friends are visiting and we all want to be together. The rooms are clean, -- the beds are the best I've ever been in! -- and the rooftop bar is the bomb! If you're looking for a great view of Phoenix, this is the place to be! I love the Clarendon! The staff is wonderful -- from the front desk to housekeeping! Personally, I love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: lckeys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarendon Hotel so I could be close to the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport, as I had an early flight the following morning. The Front Desk agent at check-in was totally professional, friendly and courteous, couldn't have been nicer. The room decor was very cool and trendy. The room had a great minibar set up, and the bath amenities are top quality. Before dinner I went to the rooftop bar for a glass of wine, there's lots of comfortable seating, the view and the Phoenix sunset from the rooftop was amazing, the hotel's owner was mingling with guests, the atmosphere couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming and everyone was having a great time. The rooftop bar was open late, nice touch for a night cap. Dinner in the restaurant was perfect. I'm vegetarian and sometimes meatless entrees are non-existant in hotel restaurants, but the server pointed out several selections, I was impressed. Loved the food, great service, the staff was very attentive, Wish I'd had time to use the hotel pool, again very trendy, with a unique waterfall and fountains that spray into the pool, eclectic and fun. Check-out was fast and efficient. Great experience, I will DEFINTELY be back.

Reviews.Title: “what a hip place”
Reviews.Author: SydneySally
Reviews.Content: We stayed just the one night on our way to LA. The hotel is really modern and very hip. We ere there on a saturday night and a band was playing in the pool area. Really different place but lots of fun. The bar and restaurant on site are good and the rooms large. We have free overseas calls included which was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little stay!”
Reviews.Author: terrij1116
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Clarendon November 5th and 6th for a conference I had in Phoenix. We arrived and check-in was smooth and welcoming. We took the elevator to our room on the 4th floor. I did not realize it was the type of hotel you enter your room from the outside. All of the rooms face in to a center courtyard where the pool is. The room was cute and trendy. I was a little disappointed by the carpet which was office/industrial like carpet. The bathroom was clean, the large plasma was nice and the bed was VERY comfy. We were helped the first night by the front desk staff in finding a place to have dinner. She made a great recommendation and printed out directiosn for us (Barrio Cafe on 16th is very good!) We also sat on the rooftop to have a drink both nights (although it was pretty cold). I must warn you, that you have to go up a flight of stairs to get up there as there is no elevator to get there. The view was nice and the seating and ambience was nice however the bar selection was quite limited and there were no heaters which I would have expected since it was so chilly and they really advertise the bar on the roof. We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel. Our AC worked fine although it was a little loud and the shower was clean and the water was nice and hot for me. The wifi was spotty at best and it was disappointing because I had a lot of work to do. The staff was very friendly and we had a nice time. I don't know if I would stay there for a relaxing weekend trip but I would stay there if I had a business trip again. I would not suggest it for kids or families though.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a reasonable price in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler014
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews good, bad, neutral and given the price we received from Expedia.com decided to take a chance for our one night in Phoenix. We are glad we did. The woman at the reception desk set the tone when our credit card was denied (out of town travel--not over use!) when she calmed us down and talked us through another credit card (jet lag is my only excuse for the nerves--my husband was calm). Check in was smooth after that and we got to our room to find music playing. It was a biggish room, very clean, with a nice sized, clean bathroom. One little glitch, the air conditioner was not working at 100% as some people have stated in their reviews, but there was a fan in the room, it was early evening so cooler than the heat of the day, so we were comfortable and didn't complain--so we didn't really give management a chance to respond to our concerns. It was dinner time so we asked about Delux Burger which I had read about in other reviews. The woman at the desk quickly printed out directions and gave us her review--great! We had a wonderful dinner at Delux which is about 10 minutes (by car) from the hotel on Saddleback (I think). It is open until 2:00 a.m. and is apparently popular as an after evening eatery, but it was pleasantly busy and very attractive. Upon our return to the hotel we went to the rooftop bar and enjoyed a wonderful view of the Phoenix sky line and the stars. Slept very well, had a nice breakfast in the dining room (we were the only ones there for the most part). I would recommend the Hotel Clarendon for a moderately priced stay and the clean, modern rooms. We took a beautiful picture of the view from the roof top but it came out blurry! Sorry I can't share it with you.

Reviews.Title: “Motel, NOT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piperrr
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is NOT what its website would have you believe, and it does NOT deserve its star rating. The décor is hideous – the walls were painted a dark blue/red/purple, and the furniture was shabby. Instead of achieving the mod feeling that they were so obviously trying to achieve, it just looked ugly and dated. The crappy carpet squares didn’t fit correctly against the walls, and felt sticky underfoot. The shower was not clean and the water was lukewarm to cool. The toilet basin was not properly attached, and slammed into the wall every time you flushed. The air conditioning didn’t work very well at all (kept our room at about 80 degrees when on High), and blew hot air directly at the head of the bed. Additionally, the AC controls were on the ceiling, so you had to pull up a chair to adjust them (not that it did you any good). The bed linens were nice, and the mattress was fairly comfortable. BUT, rather than paying for a duvet cover for the comforter, they simply wrapped it up in two sheets. The sheets, of course, didn’t stay on the comforter well at all during the night. The end result was that you were sleeping with 3 bunched sheets and one dirty comforter – not at all pleasant. The Clarendon Hotel is, quite obviously, a gay hotel. Not a gay-friendly hotel, which we would have welcomed. Instead, we were made to feel very uncomfortable as the only heterosexual couple in the hotel. It didn't help that I am 5 months pregnant, and had to endure "God, I HATE breeders!" and like comments in the elevator and lobby. The clientele was obviously on the prowl for a one-night stand. The neighborhood is sketchy. There are two doors from the parking area that ought to be locked at all times, but were always open and unlocked during our 5 day stay here, leaving the hotel totally unsecure. When we checked out at 4:00 am, there were 5 different men wandering the halls. One of them even followed us out to our car. Were they guests? People off the street? Who knows? It was very, very creepy. When we got to the front desk to check out, no one was there. We ended up waiting more than 25 minutes for the front desk attendant to arrive, which made us late to the airport. So much for customer service. Do yourself a favor, stay somewhere else. This hotel ruined my romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Some really good, some really bad”
Reviews.Author: heatherdazy
Reviews.Content: Okay, so first, the good. The staff is really friendly and nice. The rooms are large and the decor is really cute with a huge super comfy bed, a giant full length mirror and a big screen tv. Also, you should definitely eat at their restaurant. I had the unusual sounding chorizo mac and it was great! So, then the bad. First of all, there is only wi-fi in some of the rooms and they won't tell you if your room doesn't have it when you check in. The bathroom is tiny and all white and looks like a motel 6 bathroom. They put no thought into it. There's a nice sink/mirror area, but there is absolutely no lighting. Even after I moved an extra lamp over there, I had to keep going outside as I was doing my makeup because I couldn't see what I was doing and kept getting streaks all over myself. So the first night I got there, I thought I'd check out the rooftop bar that was supposed to be so great. Well it would have been great if the staff had told me there was some kind of lesbian party going on up there! Some big woman came up to me and pulled my hair REALLY hard! None of them were hotel guests, they were all just a big group that was together so they figured I was one of them and it was okay to assault me?!? So then all I wanted to do was get away from all the people and hang in my room for the night when I discovered they put me in a no wi-fi room and I would have to hang in the lobby to use it. I guess it would have been a better hotel if I were a guy, since men care more about tvs than makeup lighting and would probably be thrilled to have some strange scary woman pull their hair.

Reviews.Title: “You can't not like the Clarendon - Seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Wirey_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The C is a great place to stay in Phoenix. My wife and I really enjoy the atmoshpere. It is conveiniently located in such a way that short cab rides will get you anywhere you want to go. We've never been to the C when every single person we meet, both staff and customers aren't happy and pleasant. The pool is great, the hot tub is better, the roof top bar is a gem and the bar and restaurant inside are fantastic. Our room is always clean. Sheets, pillows, towels are white and bright. We are innkeepers ourselves and understand the huge amount of work it takes to maintain this level of customer service, cleanliness and accommodation. Good Job Ben!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWgolfer
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! I can realy recommend this hotel. Very friendly and very helpful staff. Very nice and clean room, with coffeemaschine. Nice big Flatscrean TV. Good WLAN connection. Great swimming pool for relaxing. Well equiped and good Fitnessroom with all resistance and cardio training maschines you need including free weights if you like to work out. Ideal location if you do not want to be downtown. We had a great time. Rolf

Reviews.Title: “Mid Century Modern Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: andrewk1177
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon hotel perfectly embodies the desert modern aesthetic that I miss so much about Arizona and (parts of) California. I lived in Arizona for seven years before moving to New York City and then Boston. I still come to Arizona for business and when I do I stay at the Clarendon. I wish we had something like this on the east coast. The decor is modern and in perfect harmony with the surroundings; it all just feels right. The rooms are well-appointed and comfortable and it's the nice touches like the big flat-screen televisions, the comfortable beds, the very creative and artistic "curtains" and the quirky selection of snacks in the rooms that make this place really stand out. In addition, I think this has to be the best value in Phoenix. Not only is it fun and unique but the prices are extremely competitive and they're centrally located; close to everything! On top of this, the pool and water wall and lighting are simply amazing. It sets a tone that cannot be beat. I haven't been to the hotel since the opening of the roof top bar area, but the bar and restaurant at the lobby level are also very awesome. This is the type of place where you want people to meet you because it is simply beautiful and your friends will think you have great taste. Admittedly this hotel may not be for everyone, but if you are a fan of Dwell or DWR this is the place to be in Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: gabysf
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this hotel and it certainly was a great find!! Both the exterior and interior are very fun and clean. The pool area looks adorableee!! The rooms are very spacious, I have a big bed with incredibly comfy pillows, a huge flat screen, mini bar, a long desk and bathroom. They really paid a lot of attention to detail, adding little accents here and there that make this place special (including the super relaxing ambient music they have playing in the room when you come in - nice detail!). I just got back from two supposedly 4 star hotels that didn't even have showercaps, it's refreshing getting to the Claredon and seeing a message that says everything is complementary (toothbrush, toothpaste, shaving kit, sewing kit... even international phone calls). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but in a Groovy way”
Reviews.Author: wenrosie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older property that was refurbished in 2000. It is downtown Phoenix where there are no other eating establishments within walking distance. The hotel has a very good, moderately priced restaraunt on site which is open at 6 am for breakfast and stays open for late dinner thru 10pm. The buildings themselves are situated in a big square shape and in the center is an amazing pool and jacuzzi. The pool is well stocked with all kinds of water toys including water guns that all the teens seemed to enjoy. Music is piped into the area and there is even an underwater speaker in the pool! The nice thing about the pool being in the center of the property is that the sun goes behind the buildings in the late afternoon and one does not have to worry about sunscreen... I checked in for a medical conference arriving the evening before it started. Check in was smooth--luck of the draw, I had been "upgraded" to a two room suite. The rooms are enormous! Lots of funky furniture, a well stocked minibar, and crazy window coverings. The room itself was clean and the bathroom amenities nice. There are two robes hanging for use during your stay. Pool towels are available at the front desk. There is a HUGE flat screen television set in the bedroom. About the only complaint I have is the breakfast service in the dining room. There was one young, extremely overwhelmed gal who was trying to accomplish more that what one person was able to manage. Service was slow. Lunch and dinner weren't a problem. I would recommend Orbitz as a booking site since they had a price that was 1/2 the properties web site.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Style”
Reviews.Author: dickie98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days whilst seeing friends in Phoenix and chose the Clarendon for its location and price. It seemed a total bargain at £40 a night and indeed it was! The building looks kind of 50's aside from the jarring copperplate typeface for the restaurant "Clarendon Kitchen". There is a decent size car park with covered parking which is pretty essential when its 110F. The check in staff were pleasant and trendy young people and I was advised that "as we are at only about 50% capacity we've upgraded you" - so I was given a larger executive room. Apparently this has about 75 sq ft more space, which to be honest seemed to be dead space..it was spacious but there was nothing in that space. The room overlooked the pool and it's true that in the evening you coudl hear music and peole til late, but personally that didn't bother me - all part of the trendy and buzzy atmosphere. The aircon was a wee bit noisy but despite te heat outside the room never got so hot that it was on that ofen anyway. The bathroom was clean and sufficient size for me - although I always bemoan the absence of a shaving mirror. One thing of note was the great water pressure. The pool area looks great and whilst I was there was barely used. I totally loved that there is water played underwater in the pool - entirely different from the music playing above water - swimming underwater while the theme of Hawaii 5-0 plays is quite invigorating. Overall for the price this hotel was marvellous, it's not five star but the staff were lovely, the bed comfy, the room cool and the pool is a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor!”
Reviews.Author: NeedM0reVacati0nTime
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels, but usually don't want to pay high prices and instead stay at a plain old chain. But the rates at the Clarendon were very reasonable and the decor was fantastic! It's modern and sleek and colorful, I just wished my own house was decorated like this. Also had a great martini menu in the bar. I had vegetable enchiladas in the restaurant, and you could actually tell what all the vegetables were, and they were delicious! Not like some Mexican restaurants were everything is smashed together and not very fresh. The beds and linens were amazing, much better than a high end resort I stayed in a few weeks later. Again, how do I get my own house to be this great? I was in Phoenix for just one night for business, so I only got to view the beautiful pool but not experience it. Loved that people were up swimming early the next morning, and wished I'd thought to set my alarm earlier! I also liked the feel of being near downtown Phoenix but still having parking and not being in the middle of all the traffic. The neighborhood is super cute, lots of older homes being updated, just like this hotel. If you like fabulous beds, great service, and bright, modern decor, you will love this place. It made my business trip much more interesting than when I stay at plain chains that are nice, but nothing exciting to look at or talk about when I get home.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: RobertoSilVal
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit for my wife and me. We stayed at The Clarendon a year ago. Since the price was reasonable, we thought that we'd give it another try. As other guests have mentioned, the staff is very friendly and courteous (although in our experience not always effective.) The colorful decor is interesting. There have been some cosmetic changes, but the condition and maintenance is poor. When we arrived after midnight, very tired from a long journey, we moved into our room only to find that when we turned on the faucet in the bathroom sink the drainpipe burst and water flooded the bathroom. We had to pack up our belongings and move down the hall to a new room. In the morning we discovered that the privacy shade on the window facing the hallway was missing. We had to put a towel over the window, so we could let in a little light, or else it was as dark as a bat cave. We were promised that maintenance would fix it, but that didn't happen during a 4-day stay, even after repeated (5) requests. At the end of our stay we were told that the maintenance man was on vacation. Other issues: hotel security is somewhat lax with the side door to the parking lot unlocked at all times even though keyed entry is available; no locks/closer on bathroom stalls in women's room near lobby/restaurant; bathroom door lock was on the outside not inside of the door; broken glass on pool patio from the aggregate which our son stepped on and cut his foot; no security chain on room door; voice messages on telephone contained 9 old messages for previous guests with personal information stored. Upon check out we asked if we could have a fee adjustment for the inconveniences. We were told that it wasn't possible since we had booked through a third party (Expedia). With so many hotels in Phoenix to choose from, even though the location is great, we won't stay at The Clarendon again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: timrhps
Reviews.Content: My fiance booked this hotel to surprise me with an evening away from Flagstaff. I had to be back at work the next morning, so this really was just a quick trip. I loved it! I am from Phoenix and generally hate going there but the view from the rooftop bar was wonderful. The bar was not crowded, but started to get busy as we left, really expensive, but worth it. I have worked in hotels for years and am attempting to get into hotel management and this place is doing a great job. The staff is corteous and I can tell from the number of times the management has responded on this site, that they really care. Rooms are very different. Our bed was incredibly comfortable and the big screen TV was wonderful. It would be nice if they had in room movies, but it was fine without them. I loved the set up of the hotel. I have a phobia of roaches, which can be a big problem in Phoenix, so I am always paranoid about Phoenix hotels. No problems here, which is good for me. We got desert from the restarant and it was very good, but expensive. The evelvator is really slow, stiflingly hot, and it kind of feels like it could kill you...but I'm still here. We forgot our suits so we did not get to use the pool, but it looked wonderful...hopefully next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but very friendly”
Reviews.Author: thj001
Reviews.Content: On our way back from our Route 66 Road Trip from Texas to California we decided to stop by in Phoenix and take in a D-backs game. I want to first start off by saying (with the utmost respect) that Phoenix is friggin hot. When we got there it was around 110 degrees and my breath was taken away when i stepped out of the vehicle. The outside of the Clarendon is not a great sight but once I got on the inside I was really impressed with the whole "ikea" looking style. The pool area looked inviting and the rooms were decorated very nicely. The problem occurred when we went to our room, the AC did not work very well at all. The staff downstairs was very helpful and they told us they would give us a new room. The new room wasn't any better but once again the staff was very helpful and allowed us to switch rooms again. They also said that we would be comped for anything we wanted to eat out of the snacks/drinks in the rooms. Once again the third room was still hot and the air didn't work again. I think we were a bit more agitated during the whole incident because we were hot and the baseball game started in about an hour. We finally decided we would just leave and look for another hotel nearby. The staff was still courteous and refunded our money right away. Even though the we didn't stay I would still say that the staff at the Clarendon is very friendly and will help you in anyway they can. Also another downside was the construction and the non-working elevator. I found it hilarious though that in our last room we tried there was a huge painting of the scene from National Lampoons Vacation where Chevy Chase is standing ontop of their car in the middle of the desert. That basically summed up our whole evening in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Make Your Worst Enemy Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJaime
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity and got double charged. Once from Travelocity on my business credit card and then again on my personal credit card. Neither company is easy to work with to get a refund for the double charged amount. The hotel was "cool" but dirty, in a low-income neighborhood, and nothing worked properly. All the air-conditioners in the rooms were broke (which is what the front desk staff said when I called to tell them my AC was not working properly) resulting in me turning my AC to 55 degrees just to get it to turn on, then running louder than a train wreck all night to spit out a measly amount of cool air on a 100+ degree night. When checking in they gave my reservation away which was a double bed room, and made me stay in a single bed room, with my co-worker - which as a married woman was an extremely awkward situation. And when I bring it up to them today after I called about the double booking charge they first told me that both the King rooms and Double rooms are "standard" so Travelocity can't tell the difference when making a reservation, and that they did my a favor by "upgrading" me to a king room. Obviously that's a contradiction (first a king bed and double room are standard, then the king room is an upgrade?), and I still have my Travelocity email confirmation which clearly stated a double room with 2 beds was reserved. + I remember clearly being able to choose which room type I wanted online. I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel or having to go through this experience to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for fun travel, a little less great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: surlyshirley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarendon during a business trip that included a little free time. The staff was super-friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, the bed comfy, the bedsheets and pillows heavenly! Great TV, excellent pool. There was lovely local art in the restaurant and lobby. A few small negatives - the pool is open until midnight and so my second floor poolside room was a little noisy a bit later than I was expecting. I asked to be moved to a quieter room the next night and all was well until I discovered that the free in-room wireless Internet wasn't working there. Seems it works better in some of the rooms than others, but was always available in the lobby (where there's a computer and a printer for general use). The restaurant food was good but service was a little slower than I had hoped as a business traveler. One day there was an issue with the air conditioner and the rooms were warm overnight - luckily they had it fixed the next day. Business travel amenities were absent (no daily papers, no bill under your door on the last day, no notice of the checkout time in the room, no breakfast buffet). I would definitely stay at the Clarendon again for personal travel (rate was $84!) but for business I might go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Try something different - go Clarendon”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly1975
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Phoenix yesterday. We were there for a long weekend. We stayed at the Calrendon for 4 nights. When we checked in we were upgraded to a suite which was awesome. We didn't request an upgrade the hotel just gave it to us. Check in was easy and fast - front desk staff is very accomodating and friendly. The building is old but the decor and atmopshere is great. Everything is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Fishinmagician
Reviews.Content: Springtime in Phoenix March 2008 The Clarendon Hotel Grade B+ Pros: Fairly inexpensive, large bed and TV. Cons: Odd area. FULL REVIEW: My girlfriend and I decided to get away from not so “spring like” conditions from northern Colorado and spend spring break in Phoenix, Arizona. It was mid march and the weather was fantastic, around 75 degrees during the day and 57 at night. THE HOTEL: The hotel is 15 stories tall with a rooftop lounge that allows the occupant to watch the glow of the Arizona sunset. Two elevators carry passengers from the lobby to the top floor and back. The room was easy to find and access as ours was on the third floor room “312”. The elevators require a keycard for access to the rooms for personal security. OUR ROOM: This was the best part! The room included a huge California King sized bed, a 50 inch big screen HD television, along with a nice sized bathroom and Jacuzzi/bathtub. Also included was a complimentary refrigerator and a mini bar. LOCATION: The only thing that put a ding in this hotels services is its location. The closest restaurant is nearly 4 miles away. This hotel is located at 4134 W. Clarendon St. Phoenix, Arizona, 83510. In the middle of the business district is where you will find this hotel, about 13 miles SW of the airport. AMMENITIES: - Pool and hot tub - Restaurant and bar - Rooftop lounge and bar ( open mar-sep 5-9 pm) - Room service - Cable TV - Free Internet - Clean sheets, vacuum and tidy room by 11:00 AM - Fitness Center - Conference rooms COST AND VALUE : The room was $121 per night, and to me, just having the big bed and TV was enough to convince me to pay that or more per night. The overall quality was good, and the free continental breakfasts weren’t too bad either. Overall the stay was highly enjoyable, and the cost for what the rooms provided was a nice change. The amenities in the room worked perfectly like the toilet and sinks and the room was always cleaned immaculately every time we left. Recommended: YES

Reviews.Title: “A unique, hidden hip hotel...”
Reviews.Author: salseradanzcat
Reviews.Content: I found this unique hotel listed on Expedia and after checking out their website decided to stay there. Could not beat the price! Enjoyed my short stay there. Staff was great and so not stuffy. Very laid back, but in a good way. It's a little oasis - pool area great. Definitely a young crowd. Rooms were funky and then there's the flat screen tv. The softest bed!!!! No charge for parking, always a plus. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome "boutique" hotel”
Reviews.Author: OGuyz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel while in AZ on business. I got a GREAT price on Hotels.com (almost 1/2 price on a 24 hr sale). I have to admit that when I first pulled up outside my responce to my GPS saying "you have reached your destination" was...LIKE HELL I HAVE! But, then i went into the lobby and any concerns I had were washed away....It was awsome. (but get someone in to finish the marble installation on the Front Desk...It really does look unfinished) Amenities were great, Room 228 was CLEAN, mini fridge was froze over butno issue with that, Great huge flat screen TV's, pool beautiful staff was friendly (even the one house keeper who could only say "I no speak english". My only negative....I do not mind that you have all of your rooms nonsmoking, I even understand it. BUT, Allow people to smoke on the balcony or near the pool. It really isnt fair to make someone go down 2 flights of stairs, out the front door nd across the street to smoke. Had you description said this was a NONSMOKING PROPERTY i probably would not have choosen it. But I am glad I experienced it once.

Reviews.Title: “Simply cool and very good alternative to expensive chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: Therisha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarendon for 6 nights. I had first considered the Hyatt downtown downtown (that's not a mistake, that's what it's called). Why the Hyatt? Because the conference I had to attend took place there. I'm glad I stayed at the Clarendon! It all depends on what you want I guess. If you want to know in advance what to expect, go for Hyatt, Hilton, etc. If you want to foster local American economy and help a guy who started from scratch - Go Clarendon! This is not 4 star standard I must (unfortunately) agree. But if you are not ready to hop in your grave yet (i.e. you don't feel old), can dig a certain level of noise from the aircon and c) dig that sometimes things break (like the elevator and the On Demand Movies when I was there) this is a cool place to stay. Were these breakdowns bad? I don't think so. Using the stairs is healthier anyway and you can buy movies on DVD. What disturbed me a bit at first was that the Wi-Fi didn't work in my room - or was it my laptop? Well, it worked with my laptop in the bar and outside and I really enjoyed sitting there typing mails and sipping on a beer or a cocktail (both were excellent). What really distinguishes the Clarendon is its staff. That's if you like cool people and don't expect stiffness and butler like behavior. Stacy, who took care of my breakfast, is a class of her own. Her life loving attidude makes it easy to start your day. On three evenings I enjoyed their South-Western kitchen (no it is not Japanese anymore, but the cook can probably do anything for you). I liked the food, and I'm from Europe,i.e. I don't eat fat stuff like burgers. I also liked the comfortable bed and the cleanliness of my room. The pool is as good (and better) as the other reviews suggest. Having seen the pool of the Clarendon and then that of the hotel I named above I'm glad (again) that I went Clarendon. I don't do work out too much, but the facilities seemed alright to me. Some people were concerned about safety (the Clarendon is downtown). Well, the area where the Clarendon lies seems safe to me. You can always be unlucky, especially in the US. Get rid of them guns and your social wellfare sorted out right and don't blame it on the hotel you are staying at if someone breaks in your car. The Clarendon is an ideal alternative to downtown downtown big chain hotel prices and deserves that you treat it fairly: If you pay below 160 bucks you should not expect the level of exclusiveness of the Ritz. What you can expect at the Clarendon is that people care and try (within their limits and resources) to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. I would come again (and hope that they modernise the aircon)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag - Some Things Great / Some Things Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: sandalfon
Reviews.Content: That they took a nondescript, boxy '50s motel and turned it into a desirable place deserves credit at the get-go. It's kind of like W meets Hard Rock -- in the desert. (The hallways are painted purple!) But it's quirky, and the service levels are spotty. I'm guessing that the owners are young. Apparently a number of the rooms have both the air conditioning and, only coincidentally, the hot water reversed. That means you turn your thermostat to "hot" to get cool air; and you turn the shower control to "cold" to get hot water. They've had cable problems (for quite some time, apparently) so there's no movie channels, and there's no pay-per-view. Mostly, take note that there's a gay-hipster-young "scene" at the pool most every night, whether it's happy hour or a private party. It's interesting - for about 15 minutes. The staff seem to be oblivious to the noise in the parking lot, the noise from the restaurant, and the noise at the pool. I'm here on a special rate, so it's hard to complain, but if I'd paid $160+ for this room, I'd be annoyed. This is not a good hotel for families. It is a GREAT hotel for young scenesters who want to stay up late and drink and carry-on. I'd stay here again, I'd just make sure I asked for a quiet corner of the hotel. This place is obviously very desireable to a certain demographic, and I continue to be thankful they've fixed up what was probably only an eyesore -- they get big points for urban renewal!

Reviews.Title: “Marketing genius!”
Reviews.Author: Platypus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and the hotel website. The owner is a marketing genius! We would admit that the pool and hot tub were very nice, but that is the only thing that makes these outdated motel style rooms bearable. The hotel has tried to put in cool artwork, flat screens and modern furniture, but it really does not make up for the outdated exterior, cinderblock walls, open air rooms which must be very hot in the summer and the need for some serious new carpets. We had a suite and our bathroom was literally too small to turn around in, the cooling system was very loud. We visited the roof top bar which was advertised as the new hip place in Phoenix, there was literally no one there at 10:00 on a Friday night. The hotel is not near anything of interest, and it is about a 20 minute drive to the airport. I have to say that the staff was very nice and helpful, but the most impressive thing about this hotel is how the owner has found a way to market such an outdated property! We live in a city and are used to city life, but my son thought the best way to describe this "boutique" hotel was "sketchy."

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kcaringer
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Claredon and I was very impressed! I am a Phoenix local, and stayed with a group of girls (we are all 24-26 in age) for an event. The room was spacious and clean and had great decor. The pool area was awesome-it looked very hip with big sun beds and a giant hot tub-really could fit 20 people easily! We had the same server at the pool and the restaurant and she was beyond excellent! All the staff were very friendly and we had a great time. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: pt_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after reading glowing reports on this and other sites. I can't say it was worht the $200+ room multiple sites requested. We stayed for a under $150, including vouchers for breakfast. This price is about what it should be. Clarendon isn't quite downtown. It is not within walking distance to attractions, shopping, restaurants. If you won't have a car, you may want to stay elsewhere. The hotel boasts a free driver service, but I didn't look into it. The room we had (king suite) was large, with limited furniture. The floor coverings were noticeably dirty and needed cleaned. Large plasma TV. Bathroom was nice size, but the tub needed resurfaced or replaced. Paint was very scratched, with some weird blue tint. They did not have "extra toiletries" such as toothpaste or shaving creme when we stayed. They have a nice pool area, including a hot tub the same width as the pool. Very comfy furniture in the pool area. Roof top bar isn't impressive. Breakfast buffett isn't that great. I wouldn't recommend paying extra for it. FYI -- juice isn't included. If you need to stay in the downtown Phoenix area, you may want to consider Clarendon. It is a nice break from chains. Location is not wonderful for tourists. If you are visiting Phoenix area, you may want to stay in Scottsdale or another area where there is more to do in the immediate vacinity.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Bibar
Reviews.Content: Over in Phoenix for a quick business trip, I will admit I was at first put off by the front entrance and the fact that the hotel seemed a bit far off from attractions, shopping centers and restaurants. But quickly and in many ways The Clarendon Hotel made up for the secluded location... rooms are vast and clean, the pool is gorgeous, atmosphere was casual, service was impeccable, convenient free wifi access, free excellent breakfast. No hidden fees, a great price/value deal. There was a hard to define "cool" quality to the Clarendon... It just felt very good staying over and the business trip thanks to the Clarendon felt like a 3-day holiday. I had never posted a review on trip advisor but felt this hotel deserved I spend 5 minutes of my busy life doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: mtngolf
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Phoenix for one night and booked a deal on Hotwire. It was a good value for what I was charged but this is not, in my opinion, a 3.5 star hotel. The good. The beds are comfortable with high quality linen and nice down pillows. The room was clean and the bathrooms were well stocked with nice plush towels. Nice large screen TV in room. The room had a small refridgerator and was also stocked with some snacks. I did not use any of these so do not know what the hotel charges for them. The breakfast buffett was limited in offerings but was well done. Eggs, ham, sausage, and potatos were all good and the service was attentative.The bad - this place is LOUD. It is a refurbishished building probably dating from the 50's or 60's and the construction is cement block. Cement block construction alone would make it loud but the the rooms are also built around a courtyard containing the swimming pool. That combined with the the rooftop bar made this a noisy room. If you do stay here make sure you have ear plugs. I picked some up when I went out to dinner and got a good nights sleep on a comfortable bed. Good value at the Hotwire deal price but I would have been upset if I had payed full rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazining Roof Top Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: Martncls
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time to be in Phoenix! During my trip this February in part for work but also for fun, I had an opportunity to stay at the Clarendon again. I don't know how they do it but they have certainly improved on their already spectacular service and ammenities. Two of the "Must Do's" during your stay at the Clarendon. The awesome roof top sunset exeperience is one. I got a chance to enjoy a beer while watching the sun set from this amazing roof top vantage point. The roof has been recently remodled to give the guest a incredible panoramic view of uptown and downtown Phoenix not to mention the incredible South, Estrella and White Tank Mountains. The roof top seating provided for guests and vistors of the Clarendon certainly hold true the Hotel's creative and unique high end decore. The second must do while at the Clarendon, have a meal at their new restuarant, C4. This restuarant has certianly molded in to the hot spot for the hotel guests and locals. C4 is working with their local vendors and focusing on gearing their menu to reflect the produce and animals raised in the Phoenix Metro and surrounding areas. What again ties all of this together is the attentive employees at the Clarendon. This group certainly knows how to make guests feel how much they value you; from the nice lady who cleans your room and says, "Good Morning", to the person who brings you room service in the evening. Thanks again Clarendon Hotel & Suites... Nick Almendarez Regional HR Manager Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “Young and Hip”
Reviews.Author: swami12
Reviews.Content: I was really curious about how I'd like this hotel after reading the variety of reviews here. I almost cancelled but decided to give it a shot and try it for myself, which I am glad I did. I am the kind of person who's willing to have an open mind! The Clarendon is a cool place - and I also fully agree with aem49 that its not for everyone. The staff is young - but good, and the whole place has a fun attitude, from the background music to the Employee of the Month photo wall ( you have to see it). The pool area is great and the rooftop happy hour (with DJ) was a lot of fun (at this time of year, anyway). Rooms were large and the bed was very nice, & it had a sort of living room that made me think it would be a great place for a few people to get together and party. My only criticism is that for the price I paid ($219) I would expect a little more attention to detail in the remodeling than they did. You can tell its an older place that's been restyled, but they didn't 100% hit the mark with the quality of certain small things. Nevertheless we had a great time, the free breakfast was good, and I would def. recommend it to the younger crowd. I'd stay there again if I could get a better price next time.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ikeagrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarendon for Super Bowl weekend and found the staff friendly and attentive. The restaurant staff went above and beyond serving meals to all the fans when we returned from the game. The breakfast was terrific and their menu was eclectic. The decor of the hotel is modern and fun. We generally stay at hotel chains, and the Clarendon was a nice change of pace for us.

Reviews.Title: “Start with the positive then go on with the rest read below beware”
Reviews.Author: jalanared
Reviews.Content: first off, the hotel is old but looks nice and unique, the restaurant is nice, the beds are super comfortable. Now for the rest. They don't tell you that there is no air conditioning in the "off season" it was like a sauna. There was NO HOT WATER, NO TOWELS and when asked for it we were YELLED at by the rude staff. When I say rude I mean bipolar mean and scary. They are nice until they get your money but leave out a lot information until they do get your money. They are defensive and obviously used to many problems. Good news is we disputed the charge on our credit card and won, they didn't really fight because it was so awful. You are attracted to this property because of the price. You can do better at a Wingate or mid-end hotel, like I said at first, the best thing is the comfy beds and the restaurant - otherwise you are throwing away your money and asking for a lot of abuse.

Reviews.Title: “The Clarendon is Tops”
Reviews.Author: luckyclovers
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at Clarendon hotel, I am a local so from time to time for a little getaway I take off to this hip hotel. I absolutely love the new pool and restaurant so I don't have to go out for my meals when all I want to do is relax. The staff is always helpful and extremely friendly...big plus for me! I look forward to my getaways at Clarendon.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: dwnsalzr2002
Reviews.Content: Had a awsome time. Staff was always helpful and smiling. Josie who worked late at night went above and beyond! Will definatley go back

Reviews.Title: “Third time unlucky!”
Reviews.Author: jcpilgrims
Reviews.Content: Visited the Clarendon on 2 separate dates in May 2007 and for a free week by way of compensation over Christmas 2007. 17 May Given Room 110. Restaurant closed. Painting didn’t cover the window space and as first floor we had to improvise with hanger and long garment for privacy from car park outside. Sink didn’t hold water and toiletries from previous guests were down the back as there is a gap. Toilet not fixed to the floor and cistern barely fixed to the wc and seat loose. Toilet paper holder also loose and roll kept sliding off onto the floor. Main door to suite had no door stop and hole in wall from impact. No plastic or glass drinking glasses just ‘perfect touch’ coffee ones. Plastic glass brought with us for husband to take medication was thrown out by the housekeeper. Coffee, shampoo and tissues not replenished second day ($2 left for housekeeper). I had to ask at reception whether the items left in the fridge/room were complimentary as no list of charges left in the room. When we pointed out our concerns regarding the room to the girl on duty she was surprised to see the room as she hadn't realised there were still rooms being used which hadn't been upgraded i.e. granite tops to avoid water damage from ice bucket condensation etc. She also stated that the room rates had been reduced since our direct booking with the hotel and this should have been spotted at the time of check-in. Our bill was reduced by 50% and we were assured that on our return for the night of the 26th we would also have 50% reduction but would be upgraded to a nicer room. 26 May We were charged $267.85 for the 2-night stay. We returned with high expectations of our upgraded room. It was 99 degrees in Phoenix and on checking in were told that there was a leak in the hotel's air- conditioning system but that plumbers were coming to fix it and should have it up and running within half an hour. We were first given keys to a room on the second floor but by the time we'd brought in our baggage the 2 staff at reception had changed it to 308 as they thought it had a better view. We clambered up in the very hot elevator to the third floor and took our bags into the room. On entering the bathroom we were horrified to see the stains on the floor. Apart from the stains on the floor the strip light over the sink did not work, there was no top to the pop-up waste in the sink so sink could not hold water, the lights and TV in the sitting area were oddly plugged in so that no lights could be turned on or off from the wall switches but the wall switch by the bedroom door turned on the TV! Although there was a second TV in the sitting area there was no remote control for it. We had the light over the sink replaced after speaking to reception but it was some time later in the day that another fan was brought up as AC still not working. As there is only one ice machine it is quite a hike to go down from the 3rd floor to get ice. The elevator makes a rather unnerving judder on the 3rd floor and so stairs were used when not carrying baggage. We went out to dinner and when we returned the AC was still out but we managed to get to sleep. We awoke at 2.40am and it was cool so turned off the fans. We were told at breakfast that the AC had been fixed at midnight. I didn't want to post a long list of gripes onto tripadvisor as the place as a whole is great and the staff are very nice indeed but it is let down by small niggles (and the amount of them) which on the whole I felt could be avoided if the staff were more on the ball. It isn't much good telling us that renovations are going to be done when we have travelled a long way for what we had hoped to be an enjoyable experience. We had also thought if our time at the Clarendon was nice that we'd return for Christmas but would need to be assured that the proposed renovations had taken place before chancing staying again. I emailed the hotel direct with my findings and on invitation from Ben Bethel, owner/GM, we were invited as guests 22-29 December to stay in a suite and enjoy the “replaced AC system with a state of the art system - one of the best out there….. elevator cab is being completely remodeled, even with air conditioning!”, new restaurant, and of course his pride and joy the new pool and waterfall feature. At the time this free offer was of a value of over $2,000. We booked a 3 week-long 3 centre trip with our last night prior to flying back to UK in an Executive Room at the Clarendon. In June 2007 the price quoted on the hotel’s website was for $514 (including tax) for the night of 3 January. Nearer the time of our trip I found the price had dropped to $179 plus tax but was unable to contact the hotel by email as their mailbox was full. I therefore emailed Ben direct and he said he would look into it when he was next at the hotel in the following few days. We heard nothing further from him and so cancelled our booking and rebooked at the lower price. Arrived on 22 December at around 3pm after a 5 hour car journey from Vegas, our first port of call. Welcomed by Ben himself (although we didn’t know until later it was him) who apologised for the boarded up hole at the front of the hotel, as they were awaiting installation of a new entrance. Another member of staff organised a trolley for our luggage. We were given room 215. The elevator had been remodelled in a very strange manner with white plastic sides, steel doors which caught when opening and a windowed back showing unattractive breeze-block wall of elevator shaft! On initial inspection of our suite we saw straight away that there was no TV in the living area, a chipped luggage rack which in May had been at the base of the bed was now being used as a coffee table, only 3 hangers and no bar of soap in the bathroom. We were unable to get heat in the room. We asked about these items on our way down to the restaurant for a late lunch. Soap and extra hangers were provided. There was no “spare” TV though for the second room of the suite. We were told someone was working on the heating. There were more pictures on the walls of the rooms than in May – unfortunately not level. We had a very enjoyable lunch in the new restaurant and Ben Bethel came and spoke with us and said how pleased he was that he had a restaurant after the lengthy and expensive court battle the hotel had been through with previously independent restaurant owners. We were given vouchers worth $10 per person to cover breakfast and were told to get a voucher for each morning of our stay. After lunch we went to the room to unpack and found many of the surfaces were dusty or sticky, the sofa was covered with crumbs, there was a used lint roller under one of the units and half of the little drawer space available was filled with telephone directories. The drawer space may well be sufficient for travellers living out of a suitcase or just staying one night on a business trip but is not sufficient for a lengthy stay. All other hotels on our trip had at least one if not two large 3-drawer chest of drawers for clothes as well as bedside cabinets. I went to get ice from the ice machine which had previously been on the first floor near the pool and was told by housekeeping that it was now on the 3rd floor. It was not working however (and was out of order for the entire 7 days) and ice was fetched from the kitchen by reception staff. Returned to the restaurant for dinner and were given a table by the large windows. There was no heating in the hotel and as it was 32◦F outside the cold air from the window made us move to the centre of the room. Another couple said they had just done the same as it was so cold. Having read on tripadvisor that a guest in November was cold when it was 43◦F and the hotel had said it was too early to switch on the heating I had emailed the hotel to mention my concern that there would be heating, as last year it snowed at Christmas in Vegas. After complaining to reception we were given their oil-filled radiator to take up to our room. There is no dividing door between the bedroom and living area of the suite so it is a large area to heat with a small radiator. We huddled under the bedcovers and watched the TV hoping the heating would soon be fixed. (It remained off for 6 days). The hot water in the bath/shower was not very hot and we never got hot water in the sink so my husband had to shave in tepid water all week. I don’t know if the water problem was linked with the heating problem. The next morning we went to get our breakfast in the restaurant and sat down at a completely bare table (no condiments of any description). After half an hour we got some coffee but had to repeatedly ask for milk for it and after getting a small jug of milk another waitress brought me a glass of milk. When I said I hadn’t ordered a glass of milk but merely some for my coffee she responded that I wouldn’t be charged for it! I ordered a power breakfast but there was no granola and so asked for an English muffin (out of those too), a poached egg (could only have 2) so ended up having white toast with 2 small greasy slices of bacon. My husband ordered sourdough toast but got plain white. This entire process had taken an hour and we were through our initial coffees by the time the food arrived and were given a look of horror by the waitress when we asked for a refill of coffee. A couple at the next table were served cereal in take-out containers (not in a bowl) and given a glass of milk to pour over it as “they were out of jugs”! Not an experience we wished to repeat so did not use the restaurant again. I used the guest computer to check my emails and there was one from Ben offering all rooms until 30th December 2007 at $89 per night. The value of our free stay had gone down from over $2,000 to $623! I also sent an email asking whether a B&B we’d used the previous May had last minute availability as despite the Clarendon being free board it was not shaping up to be the enjoyable, relaxing experience we’d envisaged. The following day I had a reply saying they were full and it was lucky I’d checked as the guest computer was out of service from then onwards. For some reason our room was never cleaned before 4pm and on Christmas Eve we were given 2 sets of clean towels so expected we were not to have housekeeping on Christmas Day. We had decided to make the best of it for Christmas and bought food on Christmas Eve from Safeway (they were closed on Christmas Day) and had planned to have a picnic on the roof. There are tables, chairs, sofas on exterior carpeting on part of the roof accessible via stairs from the 3rd floor. Unfortunately it was too windy to do so and so we dragged the small telephone table into the bedroom and using the one dining chair and bar stool seat we picnicked in front of the TV in our bedroom. Housekeeping arrived after 4pm and I gave her $5 to take out the garbage. On our last night at the hotel we arrived back at 6pm after a long hike and wanted to wash and change for dinner and the room hadn’t been cleaned so I had to go to reception for fresh towels. At 6.15pm housekeeping asked if we wanted service but by then we just wanted privacy. We found by accident a Marriott Hotel on Central Avenue and went in and asked for their rates and to see a room. For the night of 3 January when the Clarendon wanted $179 for the Executive Room we got a room including fridge, microwave, breakfast etc. for $152. We booked it and cancelled our night at the Clarendon. The Fairfield Inn Marriott is opposite 3 good restaurants and close to the Heard Museum. Having had it in writing from the Clarendon that their chauffeured care would be available we had asked to be driven to a restaurant in Central Avenue as we did not want to drink and drive and were told that it was no longer available but that they could call for a taxi. This was not notified to us prior to our arrival. The Marriott not only has this 5 mile radius free service but also collects and delivers guests to the airport. Our stay at the Clarendon did not ruin our holiday and we did sleep well and our room was quiet but I can’t say it added to its enjoyment. We used to dread returning to it each evening to find out what wasn’t working next and whether or room had been cleaned. I am sure people will be amazed that I have complained despite our stay being free but on hearing remarks from fellow guests who were also not at all happy with their experience I thought my observations would hold more gravity as a warning to others as my stay was free. I would not stay at this hotel again and would certainly not recommend it to anybody. I am amazed at how this hotel remains so high on the tripadvisor list considering the many bad reviews it has had since our first stay in May. At the very least one expects from even a Motel 6 to have a clean room, hot water, air conditioning/heating, ice, toiletries and when guaranteed the best price when booking direct to pay the best price on the day. In my opinion this hotel is run for the convenience of the staff and not the guests. On reading remarks from other December guests on tripadvisor I noticed that one remarked on the access door to the car park was not secure and Ben claimed that it was not broken. It may not have been broken but was open throughout our visit as we went in and out a couple of times per day and it was always on the latch.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a personality disorder”
Reviews.Author: AEricson23
Reviews.Content: I visited in December 2007 and had a fairly negative experience. It was worth the discounted rate that I receive, but the price quoted here is definitely way, way above what it should be. It is a painted motel with some neat features and good style points, but not the most comfortable stay. I did enjoy the mattress and the bedroom updates. Ultimately it didn't feel like I was in a better hotel and I was disappointed with the business service. The wireless access was important but the two nearest two my room (I was in the East side apparently) were not functioning so I had to either seek out a common area or constantly refresh my connection in hopes that it would be stronger then before. Having reviewed the other reviews, and the constant "feedback" from managment, I will say that I did call the front desk on three occasions during my stay and each time I was assured that they were either working on it or it was hinted that I didn't understand my computer's connection. Travelling and using Wi-Fi frequently, the notion was silly. All in all this is a decent motel stay. Its prettier and has some better in room amenities, but don't compare to any upper level three or four star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I'LL Be Baackkk !”
Reviews.Author: MIRockHunter
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit hard to find the first time, but once you figure out the cross streets, you realize that this is a great location. I was visiting the area museums and friends and found that it was located in a great spot. Once the rail transportation system is up and running and the road construction finished, this location will be more easily accessible. I stayed there before the pool was finished, but I am looking forward to my return and the chance to see what was constructed in the open space. As my niece said, the colors reminded her of being back in the 1960's. The bed was fabulous, the room size was very large, and yes the bathroom was small, but the bathtub and sink were clean, and it was supplied with nice fluffy towels. I too had problems with the water supply faucet and trying to regulate the water temperature. As I told the front desk, if a small child had gotten in the tub with the water running, they would have been scalded. I never did figure out the plastic temp. thingie… So I am glad that they are addressing that problem. TV is great, so is the sound machine, free internet, frig, coffee machine, desk area, etc. The staff is very friendly and courteous; the maid service was friendly and tried to stay out of your way while they were working in the hall with their service cart. The hotel was still a work in progress when I was there, but it sounds like they will still continue to work on and improve the property. But even staying there during the current time period- The Claredon is still a wonderful boutique hotel, it is a unique and original hotel. When you arrive, ask for an upgraded room, and I bet you get it. They seem very much wanting to please their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: DipSet141
Reviews.Content: I am not sure about "Yourconnection's" review on Jan. 5, 2008. It is almost like we stayed in two different places. I did not see any indication that there had been a fire in one of the restaurants. All of the restaurants that were on the property were open when I went only 5 days before "yourconnection" went.
