Maybe I missed one of the restaurants, but I am sure they were all open to all of the guest. The linens and rooms were great. The customer service was great. I actually liked the fitness room and there were machines in the fitness room that you normally do not find in hotel fitness rooms. I am not sure but you can not compare a fitness chain's facility to a hotel facility fitness room. When I was in the hotel (New Year's Eve) there were a few celebrities staying at the Clarendon. I enjoyed myself and I did not feel like there were security issues, but every person has a right to their opinion. I know that the Clarendon met and exceeded my expectations and I would recommend it to anyone. You will not be disappointed. It is a bit colorful, (in a good way) but it has a style to some of the boutique hotels I have stayed at (in New York, Miami, Los Angeles) for a fraction of the price. The beds are crazy comfortable and the rooms are spacious. The hotel is centrally located to everything. Close to downtown and Scottsdale. Definitely a hotel you want to try if you are in the area. The pool area is very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with a soul”
Reviews.Author: Yondergirl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value for the price that I would warmly recommend to visitors: this is a boutique hotel with a soul (the political elite of Phoenix would meet there in the 70s) and it has a history+ the place looks wonderful and has a swell view from its rooftop terrace) Our room had a huge comfy bed and a very pleasant staff. I didn't try the pool or the jacuzzi but the restaurant is very good and reasonably priced (no dish above 10 bucks.) The bartender studied chemistry, so his cocktails are expertly dosed. I also appreciated that the gym room is actually useful: you have a big plasma TV and modern machines -not enough lighter free weights for women, though. My only issue was with the wireless: I was in a room at one extremity of the third floor, and never managed to access the wifi. So I had to go to down to the bar to surf. Guests who want to work from their room may want to ask for a more central location in the hotel. This is one of my favorite hotel experiences: just loved the vibe and the level of comfort and surrounding beauty that we've enjoyed for less than 100 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great mattress and linens, but beyond that scary and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: yourconnection
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotwire, and it was an extreme disappointment. The pictures on the travel sites resemble nothing of the reality of this hotel. First, the location is scary, and not one I would ever pay to be in. I parked my new car under the security camera and hoped it worked. But when I found the outside door lock broken to the hotel I didn’t have a lot of hope for a working security camera. The restaurant was closed by a fire a few months before, and from the looks of things it is not coming back. The hotel appears to be badly managed and in poor repair. Most of all the doors going into the guest rooms were badly damaged and needed painting. In the hall going to the fitness room they had painted the walls, but failed to cut in the ceiling and corners. When I asked the front desk when they had painted the hall they told me two months ago. The fitness room had very old equipment. It would be far better not to have a fitness room at all than have guest show up expecting one and see that one. Lastly, the room was far from clean, but on a positive note the beds, linens and bath products are great. Although I know management can not do anything about the neighborhood that surrounds it, it will take a lot of money for upgrades and repairs to bring this hotel up to rating it gives itself.

Reviews.Title: “The 411 : Top Shelf ...Hip.... Hot Spot...A must stay”
Reviews.Author: champ7s
Reviews.Content: Take it from someone whom travels coast to coast all year long this is a must stay destination in Phoenix AZ. From top to bottom...staff...accomodations....bath products....bedding...oasis pool....this place is Top Shelf. What a value!!!! Boutique Hotels in Miami,NYC, and L.A. will cost you 4 times the price. Do yourself a favor....soak in the Phoenix culture and stay at this Hotel. Each and Everytime I hit Phoenix this is where I stay My many nights at this hotel are filled with fond memories. Its the place to be ! Nic Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel but not staffed for full business”
Reviews.Author: bradhmn
Reviews.Content: I took a chance and booked the hotel for two nights over the holidays. The rooms are 'hip', certainly and there has been work done to update the property. Beds were comfortable. The hot tub was nice on a chilly night. The staff was friendly. The location is great, too. The problem we encountered that could not be rectified since we had 'prepaid' for the room was the breakfast, which is included. We arrived and were seated and waited for water and coffee. We then were able to order and then waited for over an hour. Tables nearby were uncleared, obviously there was not enough staff to serve breakfast to the guests. We were not interested in even trying to wait for breakfast the second day. The menu looked real good, but it is difficult to say what is delivered. The second night we were awaken to noise in the next room (or nearby room). The insulation/soundproofing is poor or nonexistant. We did call the desk at 3am and the noise did stop shortly thereafter. The staff is responsive. They are friendly and apologized, but I guess I can't recommend this hotel since we weren't provided what was agreed and what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Waterrecycle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute on Expedia just before hopping on our flight to phoenix from Hawaii. Arrived at 4.30am and was very pleasantly surprised. Check-in was smooth and friendly. Room was spacious and very nicely furbished. Huge flat panel TV and the king size bed was fantastic. Room was very quiet (top floor of the tower). Appreciated the coffee machine in room. Bathroom was small but adequate - not a problem. The artwork in the foyer and rooms is great. Love the cowboy motifs. We didnt use the pool but it looked great. Breakfast was more than adequate and best bagels I have had for a while. Free international calls were much appreciated. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “not a good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: azflag22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother over Thanksgiving weekend and found the stay very unpleasant. Although Ben Bethel will write back with defensive excuses, as I saw he did to my mother, I will give the truth from my perspective: - It was very cold in the room. I called guest services to ask why the heater in our room was not working and they stated that "The days are still very warm in Phoenix so the hotel has not yet setup it's heating system." I then asked if they even had a spaceheater and the did not. I am from Flagstaff and feel like I have a pretty good tolerance of the cold, but this was ridiculous. - The "breakfast" (if you can even call it that) was truly only bread--muffins and bagels (not even juice). I am curious to know what this "upgrade" could possibly be in December. Anything is better than what it is currently. - The neighborhood is not nice. I saw a gun shop just five blocks away. Lots of construction going on with the roads as well, but at least not directly where the hotel is. - Was not very impressed with the smell of the hallways--did not get an overall feeling of things being 'fresh'. - The bathroom in the "executive suite" (supposedly an upgrade--I wouldn't want to find out what we had before) had a shower that was impossible to change the heat settings for unless you struggled with both hands pushing hard one direction or another to change it. Hope you like the temperature you finally get it at because it's nearly impossible to change after it's on. I travel a lot so maybe my expectations are high, but I stay in both moderate--expensive hotels and feel like I have a fair judgment on what is reasonable to expect. This hotel did not meet my minimum expectations for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: JTColorado
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at this property on business, it is a great find! Ben (General Mgr.) and his staff were outstanding, bending over backwards to help in anyway possible. Rooms were good-sized, quiet, and had very comfortable beds. Decor is definitely hip/modern, but done tastefully We ate in the restaurant a couple of times, food was unique, outstanding, and reasonably priced. Complimentary breakfast was simple but sufficient, only recommendation would be to have more coffee available (they ran out a couple of mornings) and add some fruit options. Pool area was large with many comfortable seating options. Roof-top deck was very enjoyable, a nice place to have a cocktail and watch the sunsets. It looked as if they were doing some fine-tuning to the pool and hot tub while we were there, but everything worked well during our stay. I spend a couple of weeks a year in the Phoenix area on business, this will be the new hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: boogieboard
Reviews.Content: This hotel's looks were greatly exaggerated on its website. The staff were great, for the most part. But the place is very, very drab on the outside (I literally gasped when my daughter and I drove up), and is painted with purple walls and red and black carpet on the inside. The pool is small, and nothing like the pictures on the website depict. But the biggest problems: 1. The weather was COLD for Phoenix - 43 degrees that night - and no heat in the hotel. We were cold, and when we called the desk, we were told that the Phoenix weather was not cold enough to turn on the heat yet. They offered no assistance. 2. The bed was facing the window, and there were many streetlights on the outside which lit our room throughout the night. No drapes, just a flimsy shade covering the window, causing me a great deal of grief, as I could not sleep well all night. 3. The free "breakfast" as described on the website, consisted of bagels, packaged cream cheese, and store-bought muffins with coffee. that was it. No juice, no fruit. Blah. What a disappointment. And yes, there is nowhere to sit when you get your food off of the small table it sits on. 4. And last, but not least, the artwork was very strange and offensive. There is one wall near the lobby elevator with 3 pictures of a nude woman by a pond, and on another wall, a series of about 100 pictures of another naked woman, I believe holding a pitchfork? I was embarrased for my daughter. I was bummed that I spent 11,.000 of my hard earned credit card points on this place. Oh well, that's the chance you take for believing what you see and read from a website.

Reviews.Title: “Original stay”
Reviews.Author: viaggiofelice
Reviews.Content: When i arrived to the hotel i was kind of scary because of the looks not from the outside but where the rooms are. They look like motel rooms( I didn't know that was the look) I entered the room and I was in shocked spacious, modern, aveda toiletries, free international calls and I can still mention more....the pool area was in construction and it looked very glamourous with beds and vivid colors. The only but is the bathroom too small and it needs a little remodeling. I called for free to Honduras, Central America. I would definetely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay! We'll be back again.”
Reviews.Author: Puddin_7
Reviews.Content: A few colleagues and I stayed at The Clarendon for a convention in November and really enjoyed ourselves. From the hip environment to fantastic customer service I highly recommend The Clarendon!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel that has a FUN, FRESH Appeal.”
Reviews.Author: llwhite21
Reviews.Content: I had the luxury of staying at the Clarendon Hotel in early Nov. By no means was the pool completed but I can't wait to go back and see it done. It was shaping up nicely and tile was laid. The staff was WONDERFUL!!! I am always out looking for a fun, cool hotel at a great rate and by far this was it. I would say that it not in the best part of Phoenix but I felt very safe. I wish that I would have had a chance to stay more than one night so I could have seen the night life their. We drove in on a Friday night and didn't arrive until 10:00pm, so we were pretty tired but it looked as though the resturant/bar was a fun place to go. If you are young and don't mind a few minor cosmectic issues (plugs & cords visible in lobby, few small issues near the bathroom in our room) But other than that it was great!!! My only request to Managment is to tell the cleaning staff to look up when cleaning. i would have never noticed but my husband did. The ceilings in the bathroom were a little dirty and to add a TV to the living space not just were the beds were. OH and the beds....FABULOUS and the window shades....very creative!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A warm place to stay during a most difficult time...”
Reviews.Author: MelodieSays
Reviews.Content: I had to fly to Phoenix recently when a life long friend passed away. My husband, a record producer in Los Angeles, made all of my trip arrangements, and off I went...alone and in distress. Imagine finding an oasis in the desert, except this one just happens to be chock full of artists and ultra sensitive souls. The Clarendon is fabulously fabulous, in that visually it is stunning... The beds are huge and perfect... The plasma TV is big and swell, and the restaurant beyond extraordinary. But, what I will remember most about the CLARENDON, are AMY and Justin... two incredibly sensitive and caring people, who went an extra mile, offering me a human touch, when this world weary traveller needed it the most!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical hotel, indeed . . . .”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVisitor
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at The Clarendon in October. After having to ask several locals for directions to the hotel (none of whom had heard of it), I finally found it. From the outside, this is an old, unappealing building not resembling a hotel. Having some reservations about staying there, I took a quick walk inside to find a hotel in need of renovations, a completely torn up courtyard (a dirt pit where pool once was) and contractors working on various things (there was no mention of any construction taking place on the website). It appeared to me to be a hotel with long term guests (a few rooms with open windows appeared to be apartments rather than guest rooms. The website suggested a hip, chic, new boutique hotel. What I witnessed was a rundown, neon lit "motel" with a dirt pit courtyard as its center of attraction. Needless to say, I checked into another hotel. The website was one of the most deceptive I have encountered. By the way, unless a miracle happened, there is no way the pool would be opening on October 26th.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Comfortable with Great Food”
Reviews.Author: unionmatt
Reviews.Content: My curiousity about the Clarendon was well satisfied with a welcome introduction when I walked in to check it out. A quick look around and I cancelled my four night stay elsewhere. Service was friendly, the decor is just plain fun, the pool remodel looks like it will be spectacular and most of all as a business traveler the Clarendon was very comfortable. The food was outstanding and affordable. Sunset on the rooftop deck before a good dinner with a great wine made my stay memerable. Just plain outstanding! - Matt McKinnon Sacramento, CA

Reviews.Title: “Awsome and so Fun!”
Reviews.Author: jamiefbowers
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights in the hot month of august. very chic hotel, being remodeled and looking amazing. we used the complimentary shuttle (electric car... bonus points from me!) to take us to several local, fine dining restuartans. we found these great places to eat on the hotel's website. even more kudos from me for suggesting such amazing food! my husband loved the large flat screen mounted on the wall. the pool area was quite comfortable and chic. also the entire room set up was perfect with refrigerator and organic bath products. the staff was so helpful in getting us anything we asked. complimentary bagels and coffee were great and really good! i just loved the feel of the place. very modern... very unlike other chains surrounding it. it will definitely be the place we stay on our next visit to phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Quite and Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: karmaleighta
Reviews.Content: I had to visit Phoenix for a week during the incredibly hot days of summer! I heard from associates in town I should check out this cute hotel off the beaten path. SO happy I did!!! I walk in and and was greeted by an incredibly welcoming and friendly staff whom I came to love during my stay! The lobby was graced with the sillohuette of a phoenix which I learned was from the old convention center. I stayed in an exectutive room on the third floor. Huge flat screen TV and nice desk area that overlooked the pool area.The bed was AMAZING! I am tall, so waking up sprawled out is awesome and the the MATRESS!!! Heaven! Lovin the L'occitane products. If you want to catch an amazing sunset, go to the roof top deck and sit at a table drink a cocktail and watch the sky change in all directions.. (Arizona has some amazing sunsets!) I do have to say, the front desk staff made my stay :) Incredibly helpful, FANTASTIC suggestions for local restaurants and shopping and just all around fun! Oh and also not having a laptop, the complimentary computer in the lobby was killer! This place had a really cool vibe, interesting, funky and quiet rooms! I am back in December and you bet I will kicking at the Clarendon!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Phoenix? Clarendon is it!”
Reviews.Author: kelly94131
Reviews.Content: Overall the property was exactly what I wanted. Great location, awesome staff, very clean rooms and quite large! Very spacious! Recently renovated. The pool area is under renovation - but the plans look amazing and the restaurant should be open soon. I definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Clarendon: Exceptional Service, Fun Style”
Reviews.Author: Delayed_Flight_Diva
Reviews.Content: I ended up at the Clarendon for a few hours when a late flight left me stranded in Phoenix overnight; I was referred to the hotel by the airline's booking-assistance number. Needless to say, it had been a long day, and the hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. They bent over backward, including driving me to a nearby fast-food restaurant for a late-night dinner (the hotel's restaurant was under construction). The decor throughout is chic but playful. The room was clean and quiet, and linens, honor bar, and toiletries were all very nice. Altogether, a thoughtfully assembled package I'd happily recommend to anyone in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great, with tons of potential!”
Reviews.Author: cmbassett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarendon for a night during my week long AZ road trip. The hotel is beautiful inside, with a wonderful staff. The beds were better than advertised. There are only a couple of *temporary* issues - 1) the pool isn't open - it doesn't even exist yet. It looks like it's going to be nice though. I was really looking forward to a swim after my long drive through the mountains. 2) Restaraunt/bar on premises still isn't open either.

Reviews.Title: “Hip staff, Great Location, Really Needs a thorough cleaning though.”
Reviews.Author: JazzCruise
Reviews.Content: This place is not the 2.5 stars it is advertised as, it is just a glorfied motel - Rooms are nice, large, great bathroom amenities from France, but the floor of the tub was dirty so I HAD TO CLEAN IT MYSELF before stepping in, hotel has a good gym but an almost bizaare color scheme, areas are half painted and look abandoned, tries to be artsy but falls short, staff is young, with tattoos, nice, friendly, location is excellent downtown but out of the way so quiet, supposed to be a non smoking hotel but people just step outside of their rooms to smoke and it drifts in around the cracks and into the central air, should be enforced non smoking if advertised as such, elevator floor was filthy, this place needs a good good steam cleaning, restaurant was closed when I was there, looked out of business for quite some time, wouldn't mind a cheap Priceline stay there in the future but would NEVER recommend this place at the rack rate, no way.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel which you’ll either enjoy very much, or hate.”
Reviews.Author: Seamus61
Reviews.Content: We’ve all seen those shows where they kick someone out of their dingy apartment, and over the next 48 hours they give it a major facelift using a lot of imagination, some nifty handiwork, and a somewhat limited budget. That’s what this hotel is. The bed was very comfortable, the linens and towels very nice. The décor was colorful, - my room, # 303, looked exactly like the picture on their website. It was spacious and reasonably well equipped, with a fridge and safe. Plenty of nice touches included the range of L’Occitaine bathroom supplies and a number snacks in the “honor bar”. Free wireless internet is a big plus for me, and they even have a PC in the lobby for guest use. However, for all these upgrades, it’s still undeniably a former cheap motel in a neighborhood that had me somewhat nervous when I was searching for some, any, form of retail establishment to get some food. Maybe I just walked in the wrong direction, but it seemed a strange place to build a hotel. Other comments: They have a chauffer service, but it doesn’t pick up from the airport so that taxi cost me $30 plus tip. They told me over the phone that they would be able to take me to my downtown meeting in the morning, but it turned out my 9am meeting was “too early”, so I needed another taxi for that. The restaurant was closed due to flooding, … but I see it’s been like this a long time. Shame as it would have saved me cruising the neighborhood on foot, and when I booked through Hotwire I was thinking (for 3.5* !) I’d end up with a nice bar/restaurant to hang out at in the evening. Breakfast in the lobby was down to crumbs by the time I came down. On the plus side, the front desk staff was pleasant and did I mention free wireless internet? Finally, I’m impressed that the management is willing to brave these review sites. … and I did enjoy my stay and slept very well. I wish the owners luck, we need more imagination and color these days. Whether it’s for you or not depends upon what you’re looking for, and some (including myself) do get directed here unfortunately without a full disclosure of this “boutique-type” establishment, …little wonder one ends up with negative reviews. Ps, you need a new favicon – unless you’re using it to promote the Jupiter Hotel in Portland

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Escape in Downtown...”
Reviews.Author: awnrynirish
Reviews.Content: Recently I had an overniter in Uptown (North Dowtown) Phoenix and had a wonderful stay at one of the few true boutiques in Phoenix. The Claredon is what a boutique was meant to be - trendy, but doesn't break the bank, centraly located to great food (Fez, Ticoz) and bars and a room you wouldnt mind holding up in for the night. The staff was pleasant and though there was construction, it was not intrusive to our stay. My partner in from out of town was thrilled since his company booked the hotel and we were meeting up downtown. It cost less and was a lot easier to manage (avoiding all the downtown one way streets). A definate recommendation for any Phoenix stay. K. L.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly Building, Mold on cramped bathroom walls but covered parking!”
Reviews.Author: josef3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend at the recommendation of a friend. Driving up to the hotel; there is no other way to describe the hotel building other than an ugly, ugly, cinderblock, 70ish, old communist bloc look. Not much they can do about it. Checked in early (no problem) with Justin; he was nice. This is a motel, not a hotel. Rooms all have external entrances around a pool but I would hardly call this a "villa". From the pool, the place looks like a quasi-dorm block/military barracks (I have stayed in both in my lifetime). Stayed in a Suite; the decorating is minimalist and quite frankly, I kind of liked it. The problems with my room were #1) Opening the door to the room and the room is damp and dark. The dampness I believe is due to a swamp cooler system and all the walls and ceiling being concrete/cement. Since none of the windows open, (which is necessary when operating a swamp cooler), the moist air just sticks to the concrete walls and the carpet. I don't like swamp coolers #2) A mold problem in the tiny cramped bathroom of the room I stayed in. Alot of hotels seem to always skip the bathrooms during remodels; this place is no exception to that rule. #3) No glassware in the room. Come on folks, at least one glass (and I mean glass) on the very nice bathroom sink is expected. (Jason did bring up glassware within ten minutes after calling down; thanks Jason.) #4) Pictures on the wall were in bad shape. #5) Fridge needs to be defrosted. #6) Breakfast was a doughnut or a cheap Danish and coffee if you make it in time; no juice unless I missed it. Bananas are cheap, nutritious and easy to handle; might want to consider putting out some bananas. #7) Coffeemaker in the room is one of those that drips all over the place when you try to pour a cup of coffee; learned this quickly and poured my coffee in my plastic styrofoam coffee cup over a very nice bathroom sink. #8) Restaurant is not open and should be noted on your website that it is not open nor has it been open for a long time. Pluses for me were #1) As mentioned in many reviews, I loved the bed. It was extremely comfortable and I slept like a rock. #2) The room was well sound-proofed and quiet. #3) Covered parking in Phoenix is a treat in the summer when the temperatures exceed 100. #4) I liked the location and felt safe in the neighborhood. It was centrally located for me and not on one of the major crazy Phoenix thoroughfares. I hate Phoenix traffic; everybody drives way too fast. #5) Justin was pleasant as were the two young gals on the evening shift. Thanks for the extra coffee! I probably wouldn't stay here again in the summer due to the "dampness of the room" caused by a swamp cooler. Is it a swamp cooler?

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Hotel with (Cheap) Lipstick”
Reviews.Author: TEXCOLO
Reviews.Content: Just an awful experience - Many complaints from a guy that hardly complains at all. 1. Breakfast ended early without warning. I wish I could review the breakfast items, but good luck finding any. When asked at the front desk, the guy didn't even apologize or offer any alternatives. Advice - get there at 7 AM and stock up for the entire week. 2. OK, hotel was painted in trendy colors. Painting is easy, but if you don't truly upgrade appliances, sinks, and other parts of a pre-existing hotel, it's like putting lipstick on a pig. Even the painting was fairly sloppy in places. Carpet all over the building in the common areas was problematic. 3. Fitness center was a joke. It is a converted hotel room, except they also took the TV out of it. 4. Warning to those in the summer - rooms open to an outdoors courtyard area. This is not one of those newer hotels that have an indoor atrium. The heat hits you like a brick. 5. Rooms were spacious, but bathrooms were small and there were numerous problems all around. Rooms looked like they were newly painted, but everything else inside the room reminded me of 1970s (meaning that everything appeared as if it was built in 1970s). Bathtub slowly released water (after about an hour it was empty). 6. Most of the minibar items had expired dates. This isn't usually a problem for me since I hardly use it, but the special was that I would receive a $20 minibar credit. It wasn't stocked with enough unexpired items to even get to that point. I'm very curious how all of the positive reviews got here given the numerous problems that were so plainly evident. Even the service staff didn't appear all that concerned when we informed them of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel Falls Flat”
Reviews.Author: az_travelgal
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I had such an awful hotel experience. First, I was sent to the wrong room. Then upon inquiring about their advertised limo/town car service the employees laughed like the joke was on us. They did actually laugh. It was incredibly insulting. They didn't even pretend to care. The car was a Prius (no problem with that) but there was no one to drive it so we couldn't schedule it's use. The restaurant that's advertised to be in the hotel was closed and an employee told us that it has been under construction for the entirety of her employment and had no idea when it would re-open. Our room didn't have any of the advertised movie channels. I called downstairs to ask because I thought that maybe I made a mistake and a man told me that we in fact did have HBO but couldn't tell me how to get this channel. Next, our hot water didn't work and wouldn't turn off - it just dripped all night. There was an empty wine bottle under our bed (that we didn't drink or bring). The toilet felt like it was not bolted down, I'm not a plumber so my best description of it would be that it was wobbly. Needles to say, we didn't want to spend anymore time at this hotel so we cancelled the rest of our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Tops at the Clarendon”
Reviews.Author: RLJComm
Reviews.Content: My party of four stayed at the Clarendon July 6-8 to attend the UOP graduation ceremony. Overall, we had a good stay. I enjoyed the color scheme of the rooms and the hotel in general as it reminded me of Southwestern flavors from my time living in California and Texas. The rooms were clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, and we enjoyed the continental breakfast. Customer service is great at Clarendon thanks to Justin - he is The Man. Clarendon offers free local transportation via hotel vehicle driven by one of their staff. Justin made sure that we were driven to breakfast, to the drug store, to Arizona Center, and later in the evening back to the hotel. When we wanted to switch rooms at 11PM because it was just too hot up on the 4th floor to get some sleep (we had a 6AM flight back - I have since been told by the hotel folks that they are putting a new roof on that will greatly reduce the heat on the 4th floor), Justin found us another room on a lower floor right away. And when my wife left some garments in the other room, he made sure we got them as soon as we alerted him to the situation. That Saturday, July 7, I think Justin must have worked 16 hours as another employee didn't make it in. It didn't matter if we needed him at 10AM or 11PM, Justin provided top quality service and our group appreciated his time and attention. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean hotel with staff second to none. I will stay at this hotel again should my business take me to Phoenix. R.L. Jenkins Chevy Chase, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jax3636
Reviews.Content: This was the single worst experience I have ever had in a "hotel". I use the term hotel very loosely. I'm saying this because I am of the understanding that the difference between a hotel and motel is that the guest enters the room of a motel from the parking lot (outdoors) whereas a guest of a hotel must enter the room from an indoor corridor. You do not directly enter this "hotel" from outdoors but the rooms are arranged in a type of villa setting. If that's your thing cool, but I was not prepared for that. For the $150/night myself and my two co-workers had to shell out for our rooms (for four nights) I expected to have a corridor. Anyways there were many many things that went wrong during this trip. First of all the heat was not working at all. Our rooms were extremely cold at night. We kept complaining but were told that it was being worked on. Finally on the third night we were offered extra blankets, only there were only two blankets and a space heater. I got stuck with the space heater and while I was drying my hair the breaker for the room got tripped. When I went to the desk to get the power turned back on I was told "you shouldn't have been running the space heater while you were drying your hair". Like I was supposed to know that the room had poor wiring. If they had just apologized for the inconvenience instead of blaming it on me, I wouldn't have been as upset. Then there's the issue with the "Shuttle". We did not rent a car b/c we thought there was this great shuttle. Hardly. You had to sign up for the shuttle the evening before for the time you needed to be dropped off and picked up. So I'm sure you can imagine how difficult it is to get the shuttle for dinner if you are staying with people who don't make up their mind where they want to go to dinner until like an hour before their ready to go. We ended up taking cabs pretty much everywhere. Then on our last day we were told that the shuttle could drop us off at our meeting and then pick us up when we were ready and take us to the airport. I specifically asked "even if we've already checked out of the hotel" and the response was "oh yeah that's fine." Then the last day comes and we are packing our suitcases into the trunk and ask the driver to make sure and he says "Oh no. I'm not allowed to pick you up after you've checked out. There is too much liability" Whatever that means. The point is the staff was not very competent, during our trip. We were offered a discount for the inconvenience of the heat not working, but that does not make up for the incompetence. Anyways there is more of the same that went on but I will stop here because it's just making me more upset just thinking about it. All in all I will never stay there again and I will definitely not be recommending this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! - comfortable room - great bedding!”
Reviews.Author: TUGhil
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay. Great service, comfortable, and very spacious room and the bed was excellent. Can't say enough about the service. From the General Manager (Ben) to each and every staff member, this is a very friendly and accomodative hotel. Thank you! I gotta say that the courtesy car within 5 miles of the hotel is a huge plus! This is very convenenient and valuable. For example, if you are going to a baseball or basketball game or a pub or eatery in the downtown area enough can't be said about how the staff do their best to get you when you need. Very nice! What other hotel in ARIZONA would do that for you as a courtesy? Thanks. Stayed one night Friday June 22nd 2007. Certainly earned my loyalty - thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for an evening during the first weekend in May. I hate to say this because it sounds like the manager is a nice person and the service was good, but the hotel is a bit creepy. This is certainly a case of a hotel website description and photos being misleading. I ceratinly agree that for the price, we should not have expected the Ritz Carlton. However, hotel rates in Phoenix are not outrageous as it is, and their rates somewhat reflect the going market. Therefore, you are not getting a great deal staying at the Clarendon. Yes, when we checked in, the restaurant was closed due to water damage - no big deal as we did not plan to eat the hotel. Our room was quite musty and very dark. We settled in and decided to freshen up before heading out. Unfortunately, the toilet would not flush. We called the front desk and they sent the maintenance man up (he arrived quickly and was very nice). He told us it was part of the problem that several of the rooms had and moved us to another room. The second room was equally dark, drab, and musty. Yes, the toilet worked in the second room but the shower did not. We could not control the shower temperature and were burned everytime we got in. At that point, we didn't want to move our rooms again so we dealt with it. Also, I the shower knob was broken so I had to have my husband turn the water on and off everytime I showered. Again, we could have called and been moved again but we did not want to deal with the inconvenience again. The mini-refrigerator, metal furniture, and odd lighting choices gave me college dorm flashbacks. The rooms are not cheap and chic as they would lead you to believe - more cheap and yucky. The location of the hotel is a bit odd. It is in the middle of a not so great neighborhood (transients hanging around outside) and there is no secure parking for cars. Again, I hate saying these things as the management certainly seems hard to please and everyone was helpful, but overall, the hotel was a bit creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: shersaguaro
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. While others have suggested that the outside needs some updating, we found it to be just perfect and more European in design. The room was delightful and unique in its presentation and again, had a much more European feel to it. The customer service was excellent. Parking and location was easy and safe. The hotel is located midtown/downtown and is close to other attractions. If you are tired of the typical corporate chain cookie-cutter hotels, this is a perfect choice for getting off the beaten path. For future business and social travel to Phoenix, the Clarendon will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clarendon - First Rate - All the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zrow
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many cities performing across the US. The Clarendon is one of the best. The staff is friendly, professional and attentive. The property is well kept and the rooms are very comfortable and clean. The entire cast, crew and production staff still raves about the hotel. *The Last Supper Production*

Reviews.Title: “awfull”
Reviews.Author: angelus33
Reviews.Content: I dont know what hotel the other 2 reviews were staying at but it certainly was not the Clarendon. I checked in staff were very friendly even checked me in early which was nice of them, i asked them about the onsite restaurant and was told that it was closed due to water damage but i looked inside and trust me what i saw that restaurant has been closed for a while, i then asked about the rooftop bar the front desk looked at me as though i was stupid i was told you can go up on top but theres no bar, anyways i thought ok just a few teething problems i went up to my room to be met by a musty smell the rooms are so dark and drab i was not happy but i thought i could shrug it off i looked around the room it was very unclean the dust on the tv was thick no way had that been dusted over..there 2 mirrors in my room both very big one stood over 7 feet tall none of them were fixed to the wall if that falls on someone it could be fatal, the window sil was thick with dirt and dust and the shock of what i saw out my window was terrible it was a rubbish dump the mesh blind was very dirty i dont know what was on it but it looked like squashed bugs really not pleasent to look at,the tiles in the bathroom were cracked with dirt in between the cracks. I have been coming to Phoenix for over 5 years and this was my worst experience i checked in and within a hour i was checked back out i have pictures to prove all of what i have said what they boast on their website is nothing like it really is the high speed internet was a joke they even gave me a room with internet access it would work for 5 minutes a time it just kept dropping off this hotel does not deserve its 3 and half star rating it even has a 4 star rating on some websites just because it has aveda products and some of the rooms have 42 inch tvs this hotel is nothing more then a glorified motel it might look like a hotel from the front but seems more like a motel.. oh and that picture of the hotel they have on numorus websites offering this hotel the one with all the bright pretty coloured lights it doesnt exist.

Reviews.Title: “A Work in Progress”
Reviews.Author: Juggling_Mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in early May, as the temperatures were starting to rise in Phoenix. For $109 per night, I think that this hotel is a terrific deal. On the positive side, the room was very clean, recently renovated and had an outstanding quality bed and pillows. The new flat screen TV was terrific. The free local and long-distance telephone service turned out to be a real asset. The work space and closet were great. The Aveda amenities were a plus. When I came to my room both nights, music was playing and the lights were on. While this was in some ways a pleasant and ethereal effect, the environmentalist part of me wishes that they would save a few cents on electricity and just leave one light on. There were three bigger issues. First, the WiFi did not work in my room. That turned out to not be a big deal as I could use my Treo to access the internet, but I can imagine for some business travelers that this would be very annoying. This needs to get fixed or the hotel needs to not put people needing WiFi in rooms that do not have functional WiFi. Second, the AC did not work well in my room. Despite turning down the temp, I was really not able to get the room to come to a comfortable level for sleeping. The staff suggested I turn up the fan; quite honestly, that just made more noise but did not solve the problem. This is an issue the management really needs to fix. Third, the "continental breakfast" is pretty bare bones -- coffee and muffins. The bran muffins were really good, but that was about all there was. In addition, a sense of disrepair was reinforced by the fact that the restaurant was not operating due to water damage. So, to get dinner at 8:00pm, I needed to walk four blocks over to Central, where, in fact I had a terrific meal at Fez. I did not find the area unsafe or a problem, and the desk staff correctly assured me it was not. However, there were few people on Clarendon, so for some I can imagine it could be a bit spooky. Finally, on a positive note, the desk staff did a great job of getting me a limo that knew how to avoid the morning rush hour traffic and get me to Sky Harbor in 15 minutes. That was MUCH appreciated. If you are on a limited budget, give the Clarendon a try. From what I could see they are working to make the place better, and I expect that they will succeed.

Reviews.Title: “If the W Chain Had Motels, it would look like this”
Reviews.Author: htowntravel
Reviews.Content: Lest the debate over this property continue, I join in the fray. I just completed a two night stay at the Clarendon. Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience--above all because I kept my expectations in check. In short, the Clarendon is a quirky, boutique MOTEL-like property, with a truly wonderful staff that makes you overlook--and forgive some of the problems you may encounter. At no time did I confuse (or attempt to compare) the Clarendon with the W hotel, or other up-market hotels or resorts (as others before have). But then again, I paid considerably less than I would have at such other hotels. Yes, the beds are wonderful (and perhaps are the same as used by Ritz, or the Four Seasons), the linens/towels are high quality (certainly well above a motel), the bathroom was kitted with Aveda bath products, and the flat screen TV in my "junior suite" was nicer than the one in my home. These were the amenities I truly appreciated and which make the Clarendon better than a motel. However, the basic feel and layout is that of a motel. The size of the bathroom was awful. Not until the final morning did I finally get hot water in my shower; the rooms and hallways (though painted in funky colors and motifs) are disgusting concrete; there is only so much anyone can do with that. The air conditioning was a joke ( the temperatures were already soaring above 90 degreees outside and the room air conditioner could not keep up. I cannot imagine what it will be like in the Summer). If only the water in my shower was as warm as the air from the air conditioner. The restaurant and bar was closed during my 2 nights stay, and the workout rooms were dark and dingy. Finally, the staff is not set up to accomodate business people. The fax machine ran out of paper and I had to bring that to their attention when I did not get my complete document, another time when I had to send out a fax, even though I brought it down at 5am (which should have indicated some degree of urgency to get it out), the staff did not send out the fax for 3 hours, and finally, one fax that I received on my first day was not presented to me until checkout! The only reason I did not "loose it" was that I had just been presented my bill, which was ridiculously reasonable. You are not "nickeled and dimed to death" on phone calls or other service charges here. And as I said earlier, the staff is so nice, so helpful, and so eager to please (though they may fall below the mark), you cannot get angry at them. So, all in all, as long as you are not expecting to stay at the W hotel, or a resort, but instead are looking for a great central location, very reasonable prices, and some nice "extras" that make this property well above your typical motel, you will be content. The next time I am in Phoenix, if I can afford (or am willing to splurge for) the Biltmore, I will stay there. But if not, I will be happily returning to the Clarendon. I just hope they do something about the a/c in the rooms. This is Phoenix, you know.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and freindly in Phoenix”
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel at about 12 noon and my room was ready. I read the reviews here and was looking forward to see this Boutique style hotel in Phoenix. If you are staying in chain hotels all the time this hotel would be a welcome relief. The hotel used to be a Motel and there are are still signs of its faded past around. Check in was very friendly and helpful and when I went into my room I was presently surprised. Rooms are spacious with TV Minibar and complimentary Wireless Internet access which for me worked very well. Rooms are set around a courtyard where there is a nice pool with Loungers. Décor of the room is very modern within an ex Motel setup. Bathroom is adequate – fans are very noisy though. Nice Aveda amenities and fluffy toweling give it a quality feel. Only negative point was there was a little dust in the room. There is a Restaurant and bar in the hotel – although I didn't use either as I was on a short visit. If you are visiting Phoenix and want something different this is the place to stay – staff are very friendly and helpful and the rates on offer are good too. I can heartily recommend this Hotel to the young and young at heart .

Reviews.Title: “Hip Motel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Lon
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort hotel by any means but the service is good, staff very helpful and the free car service great. Rooms are nice - not luxurious but well laid out and comfortable. Bathrooms are small. The rooms open onto outside corridors overlooking a small pool, rather like a motel. Nice roof terrace to watch the sunset. Not sure about location, not a great deal within walking distance like most of Phoenix. Good budget option but don't expect a luxury hotel. This is more a young, cool and trendy place.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN THE WEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ttboyy
Reviews.Content: Let me see...I love this hotel. Its beautiful. Its QUIET! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The beds are AMAZING! I can sleep there without interuptions i get from other hotels. Noise< Housekeeping. I love it. The complimentary bkfst is great. The location is ideal. The decor in the rooms and lobby is beautiful. I had problems with wireless in the new part of the hotel and they came to my rescue in no time. Anytime i'm in phx i'll stay here. Thank you clarendon for your great service.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK NO FURTHER!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerPlanet
Reviews.Content: Ben Bethel has created one of the greatest experiences of hospitality in the WORLD! Background: I was sent to the Clarendon because the Hotel at which I had a "confirmed reservation" was "overbooked" (big conference in town). After a day of flight delays I was already in a grumpy mood. So, I figured there was nothing that was going to make me feel much better. Then the driver pulled up to the Clarendon! The staff was more than friendly, they were "family". They treated this weary road-worn warrior with a special touch of kindness. Then the art deco and spacious room layout swept me off my feet. I called my wife immediately and said, "Honey, let me tell you, if I were to design my own hotel this is EXACTLY the way I would want it to look and feel." It represents the best of European flavor with a gentle and soothing nouveaux ambiance. Everything about this place lulls you into a peaceful respite, and just when you think you've had the greatest experience of your life you'll find more. Even the complimentary limo (using an alternative fuel vehicle) and drivers were helpful and prompt. I want to thank the Claredon and staff for sprinkling stardust on what was looking like a travel disaster. You guys sparkle and shine. I told the staff, “I don’t want to give my key back . . . I haven’t found a hotel, and I’ve found a home”.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: burkadvisor
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it is a great 'find'. The bed was wonderful, the staff was extremely friendly and attentive, and the pool area was very enjoyable. This was my first trip to Phoenix and I had to travel throughout the city during my stay, this hotel was near the center of everything. You can definitely tell the owner takes great pride in this 'boutique' style hotel and has done a wonderful job with this property!

Reviews.Title: “Very unique and special experience”
Reviews.Author: TFSEngineers
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Drew Date of stay: March 19, 2007 We can not more strongly recommend this hotel. My wife and I were stranded in Phoenix due to airline cancellations. We were returning from a resort in Mexico. The stay was wonderful and the bed in room 303 was possibly the most comfortable in which we have ever slept. The staff was very friendly and helpful and diner at Camus was excellent. We were not pleased that we could not get back to South Carolina that night. However, our experience at this hotel quickly made us forget our unhappiness. We are not sure when or if we will be back to Phoenix again. However, should we make it back; we will definitely stay the The Clarendon. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Clarenedon -”
Reviews.Author: seaninNJ
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Clarendon Inn and Suites - and the experience ws even better the second time around. I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms - and the same attention to detail I found during my first day was found - the bed was great - the bathroom newly renovated - flat screen tv and the senseo coffee maker all there. In addition to the rooms - the staff at the hotel was great - they are friendly and always ready to help with a great suggestion - whether it is where to find a great burger or where are great places to shop or go sight seeing. I would recommend the Clarendon to anyone looking for a great hotel experience in Pheonix

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort at the Clarendon Hotel & Suites”
Reviews.Author: nuggetAspen
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff provided prompt and courteous service to address our every need. The interior decor reflected modern style and charm with four-star comfort. The pool area was a delightfully bright place to cool off on those hot Phoenix days. We highly recommend the Clarendon Hotel and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Property, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Working_sociologist
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at The Clarendon and will definitely stay there again the next time I am in Phoenix. Ben Bethel, the manager, is to be commended for his rejuvenation of this historically and architecturally significant hotel. (Ask the staff about the hotel’s fascinating history.) Clearly, this has been a labor of love for him. But his skill as an hotelier shines through in two very important aspects. The first is his attention to the details of design. The second is his ability to recruit outstanding people who share his commitment to excellence; Alicia, Carlos, and the rest of the staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the city. Combined with considerate amenities such as free wireless internet connection, free car service, and its excellent restaurant , Camus, The Clarendon is once again a vibrant part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GCDallas
Reviews.Content: I always check the tripadvisor website for hotel reviews before I decide which hotel to book and so far it has never failed me till I stayed here. 1. Someone from their management cancelled my reservation, good thing I had the confirmation letter they sent by email printed out with me. I arrived late that night and was really tired. The guy at the front apologized and instead of giving me a better room for the inconvenience tried to downgrade me because of the unavailability of the room I originally booked.There was a girl who happen to just wander by from management as well who had to help him get me a better room ( hellooo !!!- this is what youre supposed to do). 2. The one bedroom suite was ok. There is no TV in the living room area. Bed was comfortable. 3. Hotel close to a sketchy area. 4. They did not clean my room one of the nights. 5. Camus restaurant was fabulous however.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: KTBR
Reviews.Content: We luckily just stayed for one night at the Clarendon Hotel & Suites. I think we were disappointed because we had too high expectations based on some of the better reviews from Trip Advisor. We should have headed the warnings of most of the reviewers. The reality is that the Phoenix/Scottsdale area is such a tourist mecca (not entirely sure why now after our experience) that the cost of accomodations is extremely inflated. I guess with the comparison of costs of the other major resorts and high end hotels we got what we payed for at the Clarendon. We do agree that it is basically a somewhat renovated motel. They still need to do alot of work on the place. Perhaps with their efforts hopefully it will improve. The staff however was very helpful and assisted us in changing to a new room after we checked in to one and found it to be dirty and gave us a decent discount.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: savitz
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel March 8th & 9th. We did not know what to expect based on the write ups on this website. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. This hotel is nothing more than an old 70's style motel with a fancy paint job. The rooms have old, dirty carpetting. The walls are paper thin & you can hear every noise taking place in other rooms & outside the hotel. The bathrooms are very small. The sink area is placed in the bedroom and their is NO counterspace. The good news is the mattresses appear very new and the beds are very comfortable. The furniture appears to be clearance items purchased at IKEA and is very postmodern but not very useful. The lobby is also an assorted mess. Instead of a front desk, they have, well a pair of desks! B/c of this setup, you can overhear every phone conversation. The one wall consists of 4x6 pictures of a naked woman with full frontal nudity. This is totally inappropriate outside of an art museum. Their is a continental breakfast put out each morning, however, I did see some good sized roaches crawling underneath the table where this is put out. Overall, this hotel had the ambiance of a cheap motel. It is certainly not worth the price they are asking. I would not recommend this to anyone or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can Find Better for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tnwinn
Reviews.Content: Well, I managed to get a fantastic rate for this hotel via an online booking site, so I really can't complain at all. However, if people are truly paying $100-200/night, I feel as if I should warn them. The front desk was very friendly and very helpful-- but they have to be friendly and helpful when the key making machine wasn't working right and the wireless internet was down. The hotel has been recently painted and decorated and was clean, but you can tell that it is an old building with surface fixings. My sink was new and nice (and the Aveda bath products were nice as well) but everything else (floor, shower) in the bathroom was old. My bed was huge and very comfortable. I have no complaints about the bedroom itself. The wireless internet worked very poorly for about an hour later in the night, so this was very frustrating. The pool and hot tub area was cool and modern looking. Like I said, for what I paid I got a great deal, but if you are planning on spending more than $80/night on a room in Phoenix, I would suggest going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel65
Reviews.Content: I was on a last minute business trip and all the cities hotel rates were double because of conventions. Expedia found this nice boutique hotel that was close to downtown but off the beat and path. It's located in a residential type area. I really liked the very metropolitan feel with all of the clean lines and unique furnishings. Alicia was great. She changed my room so that I would have better internet reception to work that night. Really enjoyed the stay. Reminded me of the south outside and New York inside. C. Williams

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: sser
Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel! My husband,two friends and myself booked two rooms at this hotel to celebrate a birthday. Most of the promised amenities were not available. Neither room came with heat or blankets for the beds,the website promised down comforters. When I finally got maintenance to bring some bed covers,they consisted of one polyester blanket per room. No hot water kettle,coffee or tea,and the local/organic snacks consisted of Pringles and M&M's. The tub was covered in grout and the shower leaked,when you finally got it turned on. To top it all off our friends had an extra room mate, a very large cockroach! Wi Fi was down the whole time and work on unfinished rooms began at 7:30 am. New paint,carpet,fancy tv's and furniture mean nothing if the basics don't function! I would suggest management take a trip to the Bay Area and visit a real boutique hotel. For the money you can book a much nicer room closer to or right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: miishie
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively throughout the world and this is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. I have so many complaints about this hotel it's hard to know where to start. The overall "theme" of this hotel seems to be "trendy boutique". Ha. It's more like a motel 6 with different colored paint on the cement walls. Granted, the sink in my bedroom was a slightly upgraded sink, but it's still a sink in the bedroom. We got there in the morning to be greeted by mattresses lined up outside the hotel. Seems like all the rooms were not finished yet. There were major problems at check in with some people not receiving their rooms until 5pm. I guess those were the rooms they had to finish building. One guy in our group had to lay a towel in his bathtub because the grout, which was still wet, kept coming off. As for the free internet, it is free but it doesn't work. The only way I could get a signal in my room was to stand by the door and hold my computer up and even then it kept going in and out. For people who like their room dark while they sleep, good luck. Curtains aren't "hip" at this hotel. Instead they have this painting that one pulls over to cover the window. Fine but it doesn't cover the whole window. I had a one foot gap at the top which was very annoying once the sun started to come up. Although, when I think about it maybe that doesn't matter as I wasn't able to sleep very well anyway. There is no air conditioning at this hotel and the room was stifling hot during the day and at night. Yes, you do have aveda products in the bathroom. I would have traded those in for a shower that works though. More water was coming out of the bathtub faucet than the showerhead. And that upgraded sink in the bedroom? They didn't upgrade anything in the bathroom. It took me asking 4 times throughout the day for a tv remote that worked. It would have been faster for me to walk to the nearest shop and by the batteries myself. Although from the look of the surrounding neighborhood, I wouldn't want to walk. This hotel is not in a decent part of town and is not near anything. They do have a shuttle car service but it's one person and one small car so if he's out somewhere else you have to wait. The gym needs a lot of work but it does fit into the motif of the whole hotel needing alot of work. No towels or water fountains so bring your own to the gym. Overall this hotel is a Motel 6 with trendy furniture. Give it a pass as there are better hotels in the phoenix area with free internet, ac, room service......things that work!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Anon42
Reviews.Content: Rate was $133/night for a double room (including taxes). Staff were all friendly. Restaurant was good. Rooms were clean, but fixtures were low-end. Windows were old and do not provide good insulation from outside noise or weather. Overall, not a bad experience, but there are better deals to be had for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than bad”
Reviews.Author: RoadRunner007
Reviews.Content: My car was broken into, an ipod stolen and window was broken in the none secure parking lot promises The bar downstairs attracts party people who made lots of noise all night, specially when the party was over. A couple of males next room came up once the party was over to do their personal business out loud, Embarrassing when you travel with your family. And their advertising (pictures) they use to promote this hotel is not what the place looks like at all. A V O I D !

Reviews.Title: “Where my money and friends will go.”
Reviews.Author: geekdaddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and management went above and beyond to make our stay outstanding. The pictures don't do justice to what the owners have done with this historic and sheek hotel. Will definitely go back to this 5 star hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Clarendon Hotel + Suites”
Reviews.Author: filmdreamer
Reviews.Content: My night in downtown Phoenix started out with a rocky start, as i got lost on the maze of freeways. But when I called the Claredon I spoke to Tonya, on night shift and she helpfully guided me in. When I arrived, she was so friendly, I felt that I was right at home and breathed a sigh of relief. The rooms were spacious, with a big comfy bed, and bathrobe provided but my favorite extras were the Aveda tolietries that are provided. The next morning I was happy to find there was no cost internet access in the lobby. My only complaint is that didnt know that there was FREE unlimited international calls from the room. I have done some traveling but have never come across this. Next time I stay, Ill be bringing my phone book and settling down for some long talks across the time zones.

Reviews.Title: “Great sunsets from the roof deck”
Reviews.Author: cactusofa
Reviews.Content: Almost nothing to add to what most travellers have already said: Great staff, good atmosphere, free wireless, free worldwide calls and so on - that's simply gorgeous at these incredibly low rates. Compared to the many chain hotels on my recent trip across the southwest the Clarendon is much better and more stylish. I booked on hotels.com and got a rate that was similiar to a chain hotel. On the minus side just two things to add to some stuff that has been said: Our non smoking room has obviously been a smoking room in earlier days - or some guest smoked anyway... that taste of old smoke in the air disturbed me a lot, but not my two friends who were in the same room, so we stayed in there anyway. There has also been some above average noise from A/C and a nearby generator on the street or something similar all night, but a) that's probably a temporary thing and b) we're in a downtown location where such things are to be expected. Be sure to watch sunset from the roof deck. Fabulous! And I like the attitude of the staff here, answering to most complaints immediately. I wish more managers were like this.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Hostel for Cool Grown-Ups”
Reviews.Author: joepinstripe
Reviews.Content: This is a review of my experience at the Clarendon Hotel + Suites, from August 25, 2006, to August 27, 2006. I was in room 309...a large suite. My experience with hotels runs the gamut. From suites at the grand hotels of Europe (Le Sirenuse, Claridges, the Adlon, the Crillon, the Goldener Hirsch, etc.) to exceptional US properties (various Ritzes, Waldorf Towers, Auberge, Post Ranch Inn, Bacara, etc.) to boutique hotels, as well (Sydney House in London, Arcotel Velvet in Berlin, Blakes in Amsterdam, etc.). I share this because Clarendon gave me an entirely new experience, which I did not really think possible after decades of travel to hotels big and small, great and good (and yes, some downright lousy). Travelers to the Clarendon should prepare themselves for a hotel that is not sizzling with high-end design (although the rooms are pleasantly appointed and the whole place is VERY clean). But the design that is there is really cool. LED desklights, sliding shades that feature reproductions of the artwork in the lobby, enormous rooms, an exquisite sound system playing big band and jazz standards by the pool, the same sun chairs I lounged on in Positano earlier this summer and the exterior painting and lighting all conspire to delight. You aren't going to get a Phillipe Starck tour de force here, but you will get a feeling that the owners care enough to provide you with far more than the average Holiday Inn. But enough of design, because what the world DON'T need now is a design hotel without the basics nailed. And this, dear readers, is where the Clarendon knocks 'em dead. Service. What a tragically underrealized concept in hotels today. But the staff at the Clarendon could school the buffoons at MUCH higher end properties in what service means. Always greeting guests. Always asking if they can do that one extra step to help? Always producing the unexpected (for instance, with the no liquids rule at airports, we found ourselves without sunscreen. Would the desk have a bottle we could use? You bet they did.). And this wasn't just a bunch of hip young people helping out other hip young people. I observed several much older guests receiving the same level of truly engaged and respectful service and that just made me feel incredibly affectionate toward this property. The ability to experience design and a unique interaction with it should be the province of all ages, not just 20-somethings with the latest Prada swimsuit. The bed was top-notch. We did not use the TV. There is no liquor in the mini-bar (actually it's a mini-snack stack...there is no chilled beverage selection in the room). The A/C worked...not to an icy chill like many Phoenix properties, but it definitely felt much cooler in our room. The shower pressure was perfectly adequate. We did not use the bar or restaurant but peeked in and it looked appealing. The property is very close to many restaurants, bars, clubs in central Phoenix (not to mention museums) so we tried some of those instead. I told the girl at check-out that I felt I had discovered the coolest youth hostel on the planet -- only it was for grown-ups. I still feel that way. It's a lower-budget-higher-design concept paired with the absolute perfect pieces of internal architecture: a genius bed, clean property, and staff who would fit seamlessly into the finest properties in the hospitality industry. I still love my Christmases at the Arizona Biltmore -- I'm a hopeless traditionalist in many senses -- but for any other visit to town, I am going to definitely stay at the Clarendon. Congratulations to manager Ben Bethel for reminding me that it's still possible to assemble a team of flawless customer service providers within the chic walls of a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fabulous.......”
Reviews.Author: GetFletch
Reviews.Content: I've never taken the time to write a 'Hotel' review...have traveled all over the world......but my experience @ The Clarendon was too excellent to keep to myself. The Staff....never once in need of ANYTHING as they ALL anticipated our needs and followed through. The 'Hotel'....beautiful, fun Ikea type interiors. The bed was something you just don't want to leave. Its better than anything you've ever owned yourself. If you are picky about linens then this is definitley a place you have to visit. The sheets...hight thread count but better than that....the highest quality sheet in the linen industry. We had a King suite which I suggest as it makes you feel like you are in a West Hollywood Apartment of some famous "someone" or something. The pool sparkled clean clean clean and there are these wonderful chase lounges poolside that I have to find out where they bought them. Striped towels make you feel like you are on a cruise. Just a gorgeous boutique Hotel. We didn't sample the fare @ their Restaurant because of other engagements but you should.....the menue is eclectic and concise w/ wonderful choices. The Restaurant interior which is located in the Lobby was just like the rest of the property....Fab/Beautiful/Fun....just wonderful. The Lobby Bar is GREAT. The locals mixed w/ the guests give you the perfect beginning, middle and end to a wonderful time in the beautiful city of PHX. Go..for fun or business but find a reason to visit PHX and stay @ The Clarendon.

Reviews.Title: “Potential Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TOWERSX2
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel again if only for the service and freindliness of the staff. A minor car accident the morning of my arrival caused the locking mechanism in my rental car to break. Ben, the owner and his electrician, Gilbert, came outside, took my door apart and fixed it on the spot. Saved me tons of $$$ on the car considering that I opted to waive the insurance. My room was upgraded to a wonderful suite overlooking the pool with custom furniture, 2 TV's and the most comfortable bed outside of my own! Will definately come back, but will rethink coming back in the summer (122 degrees!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “The Clarendon is a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just had my second stay at the Clarendon Hotel last week. I can't wait for my third. First and foremost, this hotel has excellent beds and pillows. The art deco of the room decor is warm and exciting. The staff made me feel like a king. They offer all the amenities you would want while traveling with a touch of art and class. But did I mention the beds and pillows? That's what you need in an overnight stay -- comfort, comfort, comfort. I give it two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “It's an acquired taste”
Reviews.Author: quivondra
Reviews.Content: I pulled up to the parking lot and I was afraid, very afraid. Then, when I walked in and met the concierge (an uber-hipster that made some great food recommendations), who allowed us to check in early since the room was ready. I got the feeling that I got a good deal on the room because they opened recently. Anyway, the building is obviously a renovated 60's building that probably housed old people until 5 years ago. I actually like that sort of thing and found that it made the hotel have personality. The heavy drinking partiers hanging out by the pool were out of place to me. I felt like being a new yorker, we fit right in. We understoond and appreciated the kitsch and were happy that it didn't extend past the courtyard into the rooms. We liked the blinds so much that we bought the same ones in new york and installed them into our own place. You can see out, but people can't see in. The beds were very comfy and the design was really done well. Whoever owns this hotel obviously took care that every room had its own touch, which is more than I can say about most non-bed and breakfast type hotels. The aveda products in the bathroom were a nice touch. The courtyard had a jacuzzi and pool filled with beach balls. I lounged on a deckchair reading while they played electronic music. The breakfast was mostly yogurt and croissants with juice and coffee..I was happy with what they offered. If you are in Phoenix and want to stay at a nice hotel with a lot of personality (which comes with a few flaws like a weak AC and paint chipping off the building) this place is great. The concierge also were obviously deep into the scene and will tell you about cool places to see bands and hang out. Now if only they opened a hotel in brooklyn like this.....
